results.description:
Come join us for an invigorating breakfast and networking event.

There will be at least 15 members at each meeting, regardless of how many people RSVP on Meetup.

Meet successful business owners from different professions to give and pass referrals and grow your personal network.

BNI, the largest business networking organization in the world, is a business and professional referral organization that allows only one person from each profession to join a chapter.  Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. When they meet someone who could use your products or services they hand your card out and recommend your services. It's as simple as that!  

For 28 years BNI has used a simple but elegant philosophy that exemplifies membership, "Givers Gain," or, "what goes around comes around."

 Last year alone, Business Network Int'l generated over 7.1 million referrals resulting in more than $3.3 billion worth of business for its members!

In Manhattan, BNI currently has more than 1250 members in 53 Chapters. 

BRING LOTS OF BUSINESS CARDS!!!
Cost is $20, which includes breakfast.
results.how_to_find_us: We are the only people there at the time of the event.

results.description:
One of our group members suggested a morning MeetUp.  It makes perfect sense as many of us have more time available in the earlier part of the day, but hardly have availability in the evenings. A morning MeetUp will help level the playing field. 

If you reside in Windsor Terrace or Kensington - chances are - you already know, and have visited Brooklyn Commune. Over the past few years, this eatery has established itself as a place that brings local community together. 

We have a healthy mix of seasoned business owners, coupled with people transitioning from corporate, W-2 type jobs, and others, who work for a boss, and are also self-employed on the side. Such mix creates a perfect environment for mentorship opportunities, and for building long-term business relationships. In this particular case, we network over delicious breakfast foods.
results.name: Small Business Tips for People In Transition

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.
results.name: Indie Coworking Space

venue.name: Inside the Met museum, in the Temple-of-Dendur room in the Egyptian wing on the first floor.

results.description:
This is a vast, indoor space with lots of options during the cooler weather.

My wife recently went back to work so I'm kicking off the weekly dad meetups for the group again. Generally, we'll meet on a weekday morning and take advantage of a park, museum, or playground when it's less crowded during a weekday morning.  Hope you can join us!

This week we'll meet inside the world famous MET Museum.  Admission is steep, but you could choose to "pay what you wish" and contribute only $5 for suggested admission.  The museum is extremely accessible for strollers.  We'll plan to hit the Temple of Dendur room enjoy some Monet...and if the weather holds, we can hit the roofdeck.

results.name: NYC Dads + Kids Meet at the MET Museum

results.description:
Looking to develop speaking and leadership skills? Ace a job interview? Ignite your career? Toastmasters International is a world leader in communication and leadership development. Our membership is 280,000 strong. Our members improve their speaking and leadership skills by attending one of the 13,500 clubs like Bryant Park Toastmasters Club Membership in Manhattan

Toastmasters is one of the greatest investments you can make in yourself. At Bryant Park Toastmasters we provide a safe environment to overcome fear, try new speaking tactics, or practice that upcoming sales presentation. Visit our website

MEETING TIME: Tuesday, 12:10pm to 1:15pm

VISITORS WELCOME: In order for you visit our club you need to register to this meeting and RSVP with your FULL NAME  AT MOST  SUNDA. Please arrive by Noon to allow extra time for security check-in.

** PHOTO ID a must!!

** Bring your confirmation email from a Bryant Park club member having added you to the security list is a must!! 


A Toastmasters Meeting always for follows the same agenda:

• Opening of the meeting by the president and presentation of the guests


• Welcoming by the Toastmaster of the Day and presentation of the watchtowers


• Speeches and Evaluations (up to 4)


• Club Business


• Table Topics Session - Guest can participate if they want to


• General Evaluation


• Closing of the meeting
results.name: Bryant Park Toastmasters

results.description:
Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

"Instead of the 'knowledge gained', I find it appropriate to give a 5 star to 'raising my vibrations' during the meditation.... the energy of the group was Amazing and ZINGING! Thanks... " - S

I had a real moment of knowing who I was, am and always be. Also, I have in the past trained in yoga and meditation but not practiced for a number of years - I felt all the beauty of it flowing connecting through my source once again aaaahhh bliss." - A.S.

"Truly inspirational, loved it, thank you ." - Anonymous

"Really loved being able to just switch on and meditate." - L.M.

"So relaxing and cleansing." - T.H.

results.description:
Sex and relationships are some of the most important and potentially rewarding things in life. And very few people actually put energy towards improving them. At OneTaste, we treat sex and relationships as flow sports— arenas where we can access peak states and achieve the mastery of pro athletes in our connections with other people. 

We don’t teach the formulas of “pickup artists,” or any other cheap shortcuts or substitutes for connection. We teach you how to tap into the power of desire, and untangle the often paralyzing societal conditioning around sex and connection.

If you’ve ever felt confused by a date's mixed messages, trapped by conflicting social scripts, defensive towards a girlfriend's anger, or just want to know how to break out of your shell and start having the sex and relationships you want— that’s what we’re here for. 

Come meet relationship and dating coaches from OneTaste NYC over coffee, ask us questions, and find out more about the courses we offer. 

**OneTaste is an international organization devoted to bringing consciousness to the realm of human connection.**

A coach will be at a table in the back room of Maman wearing a shirt saying "Orgasm." 

Text Dave at[masked] with any questions.
results.name: Cracking the Intimacy Code: How to Connect with Women

venue.name: Online Webinar

results.description:
This event is brought to you by our global partner and sponsor- Webinara

To Participate You Must Register In Advance To Secure Your Spot. 

CLICK HERE TO REGISTER 

ORGANIZER: MediaOps: DevOps/ContainerJournal - Miles Blatstein Twitter @devopsdotcom

HOST: DevOps.com - Alan Shimel

SPONSOR: JumpCloud - Greg Keller

The 2016 IT Guide to Onboarding and Offboarding Employees 


A step-by-step guide to help streamline your processes while keeping your company secure.

You sit down to order lunch and your phone lights up, with numerous calls and texts flying in. An engineer was let go and it didn’t go so well. He/she has access to all of the source code, some production machines, and knows critical passwords. Do you have the right systems in place to cut off access quickly and securely?

In this webinar, JumpCloud Chief Product Officer, Greg Keller walks you step by step through the onboarding and offboarding process to ensure that you are both setting your employees up for success, and keeping your company secure.

What you will learn:

How to onboard employees in a way that is accurate, efficient, and secure.

The four step process to off-boarding an employee.

The risks associated with improper off-boarding.


Why attend this webinar:


1. How to onboard

2. 4 steps for offboarding

3. Risks with improper offboarding

To Participate You Must Register In Advance To Secure Your Spot. 

CLICK HERE TO REGISTER 

More information about the speakers:

DevOps.com - Alan Shimel - CEO & Editor-in-Chief - Twitter@ashimmy

An often-cited personality in the security and technology community and a sought-after speaker at industry and government events, Alan has helped build several successful technology companies by combining a strong business background with a deep knowledge of technology.

JumpCloud - Greg Keller - Chief Product Officer - Twitter@mudandcowbells

Greg is JumpCloud’s Chief Product Officer, overseeing the product management team, product vision and go-to-market execution for the company’s Directory-as-a-Service offering.
results.name: The 2016 IT Guide to Onboarding and Offboarding Employees

** Do NOT bring any outside food to the shop.  La Casita sells refreshments & snacks. **

 

We are meeting at La Casita Yarn Store at 253 Smith St between Douglas & Degraw from 2-4pm. The Carroll Street F stop is the closest and the 57 bus stops at Douglass St.

The yarn store is small and cozy and has a cafe with yummy snacks, small meals and drinks - including wine and beer!  In order to support LaCasita, who generously hosts our weekly meeting, we ask that you buy something while attending.

As always with meetups, you'll probably want to leave your more complex projects at home...

Attendance for this meet up is limited to 10 people due to the size of the venue. Please be sure to RSVP if you plan to attend and change your RSVP if your plans change.

results.description:
Tuesdays can be depressing, so we're putting some fun into them!  Come celebrate with members of Gotham Social Happenings and more than a dozen other meetup groups!


=============================================

Instructions - If you wish to attend, please use this link for full details and to RSVP: 

http://www.meetup.com/GothamSocialHappenings/events/227443007/

Why - Posting a meetup in many groups gets more people to attend, which makes for a better event.  However, this creates multiple signup pages, which make it hard for hosts and organizers to keep track of the total headcount - and even harder for members to see who else is coming!  It is much better if everyone registers in the same place.  Thank you!

venue.name: Andrew Heiskell Braille and Talking Book Library

results.description:
People Vision Vs. Computer Vision

Akash Khanolkar, Founder of CrowdViz, a mobile app that provides V.I.P’s and people who are blind with remote sighted assistance. Akash believes that as the world continues to build more artificially intelligent assistive technologies, it will not be able to replace actual sight in the foreseeable future. Instead he believes that “building technology around people, replacing “objects” with “experiences” without eliminating the irreplaceable “human” touch, that’s the future.”

Communication Access Realtime Translation (CART) services for this meetup are sponsored by SSB BART Group and will be provided by White Coat Captioning.
results.name: People Vision Vs. Computer Vision

group.name: a11ynyc - New York City Accessibility & Inclusive Design

results.description:
From humble beginnings, a handful of lost souls must rise above their misfortune to achieve greatness.

The uncountable islands of the subtropical Korina Archipelago are the sanctuary for many who have fled from the never-ending wars of distant Altamere. That land, where the life of the common man is cheap and reckless kings all-too-often burn their lives, and kingdoms, out in blazes of glory.

The Korina Archipelago is home to several large city-states, each of which views the others as rivals, but generally coexist, for there are greater threats to their safety. Renegade Altameran privateers, depraved nation-less pirates, demon-worshiping cannibals, horrors from the uncharted oceans, and far worse are reminders for the city-states of the constant dangers that exist outside their walls. 

These dangers are all-too-real, and to whom can one turn to in times of desperation and need when threats arise? Each city-state will defend its own, but outside that, help is not easy to come by. Even the enlightened gods favor all, yet they favor none; those whose prayers and sacrifices are the most persuasive bend their ears for a time. The gods are powerful and wise, but fickle they are, too, and to understand their ways is not the way of man.

This is no place for the weak of heart. Salvation comes from strength and strength alone. The strong survive, the weak do not. This is the tale of the rising of heroes, the elevation of men from what they were to what they are, the making of the great from the small, this is the story of ascension.
results.name: Ascension

results.description:
Part I: Servants of the Elder Eye

Following the fall of the Temple of Elemental Evil, peace was restored to the lands of Central Flanaess... for a time. Now, in the wake of the kidnapping of Prince Thrommel of Furyondy, rumors abound of cultists making their way back into the blighted lands surrounding the ruins of The Temple. With these rumors comes a growing sense of paranoia among the people of nearby settlements, and mysterious disappearances and deaths threaten to throw the lands back into chaos.

This 5th Edition D&D game is great for new or experienced players, and will take characters from level 1 to level 4.

The game will be hosted at Barnes & Noble in Edison NJ and will run for 8 sessions plus an introductory/character creation session.  Sessions should run from 6pm until 10pm.


Additional resources: 


Guide to Greyhawk - This pdf gives a brief overview of the campaign world, including new subraces and an expanded list of gods and their domains. 

World of Greyhawk - My website for this classic campaign setting. 


Greyhawk Game - My site for the game, once it starts.

Character Generation Guidelines - This explains some of the basics of character creation for the game.
results.name: The World of Greyhawk - Servants of the Elder Eye

Most likely, I will show some advanced Node.js features that the StrongLoop framework adds: generating APIs with Swagger, managing users, authentication, and permissions with ACL. These features turn your hobby Node.js site into a more professional platform.

I am following this sample app tutorial:

http://www.remkohde.com/2016/01/04/add-custom-objects-and-user-management-to-nodejs/

based on this documentation:


https://docs.strongloop.com/display/public/LB/LoopBack


Join Hack Hours at our WeWork Lounge, with a technical demo, then follow the workshop step by step, or code on your own, technical help is always present on site. (Bring your own laptop)

AGENDA

6.00 sit down, have a drink, chat, relax, forget you're in NYC

6.30 today's topic: TBD

7.00 after the demo, you can do the workshop step by step, ask for help if needed, or work on your own cloud project

9.00 wrapping up

At the end of the evening you should [...].

Hosted @WeWork, with FREE FOOD AND DRINKS.

PS. Join our new Free Bootcamp NYC page on Facebook to share your suggestions for new topics, photos, ideas and other tech stuff.

https://www.facebook.com/freebootcampnyc

results.description:
Welcome the New Year with Cyber Security panel and presentations. Meet colleagues, security professionals, learn, mingle and prosper. 

Cyber Security Workforce Discussion Panel:

-  “The demand for the (cyber security) workforce is expected to rise to 6 million (globally) by 2019, with a projected shortfall of 1.5 million,” stated Michael Brown, CEO at Symantec.  Cross-training IT workers and converting them to security specialists, automated security solutions from the vendor community, sending more youth to cybersecurity school. U.S. colleges may be a few of the answers. Is that sufficient? 

BNY Mellon

Christopher Hall – Deputy CISO

</a><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/rwlehman">Rich Lehman - Vice President - Cyber Security Architecture

Jeff Northcutt – Global Head of Cyber Incident Response

Frank Perrelli – Global Head of Cyber Engineering


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Presentation: 4 Tips for IT Security Professionals to Secure Mobile Endpoints

Mic McCully, Skycure


Skycure revolutionizes the way mobile devices are protected by introducing a solution that addresses emerging mobile security threats without compromising privacy, usability or battery life. Skycure enables organizations to embrace the BYOD (bring your own device) trend, but still provide strong protection and control.

Mic McCully is a Senior Solutions Consultant currently working as part of the Skycure Team.  Mic’s current focus is on educating and promoting awareness of the current and evolving mobile threat landscape.  This includes industry knowledge of mobile threats such as wifi and cellular threats, i.e. “Man it the Middle” attacks, next generation Malware and Mobile OS level exposure.  His current time is spent helping educating Enterprises on this threat landscape and communicating the details of the Skycure solution. 


cyphre The most ubiquitous threat to cloud data at rest and in flight is the period when security keys are memory resident on the host server. Cyphre’s patent-pending BlackTIE™ technology augments vulnerable single encryption keys with hardware-encrypted Black Keys to render hijacked keys useless, thus nullifying the threat. Chip-resident Black Keys are completely isolated from hacker exposure, and in fact even from Cyphre. For more heightened security, BlackTIE™ uses a one-file/one-key approach to encrypt all data.


Presentation: Encryption Keys - The Next Vulnerability


Lance Smith, Chief Executive Officer Cyphre, LLC

Lance is a seasoned executive with more than 18 years of Global 100 and start-up experience. A serial entrepreneur with proven C-level skill sets in revenue enablement, capital strategies, cloud data security, supply chain operations, and critical technology real estate management. Lance has led large multi-continental (i.e., follow-the-sun or 24×7) data center operations teams for Atos (EPA: ATO) and ACS/Xerox (NYSE: XRX). Most recently, Lance was the CEO and Founder of cloud companies, Eagle DevCo and Horizon Data Center Solutions, both venture-financed B2B companies offering flexible collocation and managed services with an innovative cloud computing/IaaS platform. Lance led each company to build a robust $100M sales pipeline and secured more than $75M in contracts, and exceeded $100M in equity financing and capital leases. Lance has his Bachelor of Arts in Economics from Austin College and a Master in Public Administration from the University of North Texas.

New York On Tech

http://www.newyorkontech.org/about.html

New York On Tech (NYOT) is a 501c3 nonprofit organization on a mission to prepare the next generation of technology leaders emerging from New York City. We are committed to developing, mentoring and providing support to low-opportunity students in the field of technology.

Anime tuesdays are back. Rosario & Vampire will be playing on the two big screens. SUPERFIGHT card game! Walking dead Superfight & ANIME super fight.

We will also be playing two card games: Cards against humanity and the new game SUPER FIGHT card games. Those who aren't familar with the new cool superfight game, here is the video showing you how to play it:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oftjijhP-fs


____________________________________________ Meetup happy hour specials at Action Burger:

Meetup Happy hour specials:
3 shots for $5.
32oz rum and coke $10.
Buy a beer, get a free shot.
$20 Rum & coke, open bar for 2 hours. Unlimited 16oz rum and cokes for one person for two hours.
Cheese Burger fries & Soda $8. Comes with up to 5 of the free toppings.

_______________________________________________
See you there. Written rules for SuperFight:

SUPERFIGHT BASIC RULES

The Setup:
Separate the white-backed cards
(characters) and the black-backed cards
(attributes).

Youngest player goes first. Player one
starts by drawing three white cards and
three black cards. You can look at them,
but don’t let anyone else see them.
Player two (the next player to the left) does
the same.

Each player chooses one white card and
one black card from their hand to create a
fighter and places those cards face down.
Then they discard their remaining cards
into two separate piles (one for characters,
one for attributes).
Next, both players turn over their cards and
reveal their fighters.
Each player then draws a random black
card from the deck and adds it to their
fighter.

The Superfight:
Both players argue and plead their cases
about why their fighters would win the fight.
Once the arguing is done, the table votes
for a winner.

In the event of a tie, both players draw a
random white card and fight to the death
with no attributes. The table votes again. Do
this until there is a winner, then discard the
white cards from the tiebreaker fights.
The winning fighter stays on the table for
the next player to fight and will not get any
new attributes in the next fight. The player
who won the fight earns one point.

The Next Match:
Player three (the next player to the left) now
creates a fighter to battle the winner from
the last match, following the same rules for
fighter creation as in The Setup. Then The
Superfight begins again.

ALTERNATE RULES

Villain Battle:
Separate the white-backed cards
(characters) and the black-backed cards
(attributes).

Every player draws three white cards and
three black cards. You can look at them, but
don’t let anyone else see them. The least liked
person at the table takes the first turn
as the Villain.

The Villain chooses one white card and one
black card from their hand and places those
cards face up on the table. Then the Villain
draws one random black card from the
deck and adds it to their fighter.

All other players choose one white card and
one black card from their hands to create
fighters to defeat the Villain. When everyone
is ready, reveal the fighters one at a time and
announce them to the table. Starting with the
player to the left of the Villain, play an
additional black card from your hand onto
any fighter on the table (including the Villain
or yourself!) and then discard the rest of your
hand.

Next the Villain picks who would do the best
against his or her fighter. That fighter wins
the battle and gets one point.
The player to the left of the current Villain
becomes the new Villain. Every player draws
three new white cards and three new black
cards, and a new battle begins.

Battle Royale:

Separate the white-backed cards
(characters) and the black-backed cards
(attributes).

All players draw three white cards and three
black cards. You can look at them, but don’t
let anyone else see them. Each player places
one white card and one black card face
down on the table. One at a time, players
reveal their fighters and announce the
fighters to the table.

Before playing the second black card, select
one of the following game modes:

A) Each fighter’s second black card is drawn
randomly from the deck.

B) Players may play one additional black
card from their hands onto any fighter at
the table (including themselves).
Everyone votes on which fighter would be
the last one standing.

Pacifists:
Follow any of the rules outlined above, but
this time choose the winner based on who
is the funniest, or imagine it’s a dating
website and you’re picking the best match.
Pick who would be the best construction
worker, or nanny, or use your imagination!

Finally:
Unlike other judge-based games, this is not
anonymous. If a player is being biased, for
whatever dumb reason, never play with
that person again. They are lame, and
should go play charades with their cats
until they learn how to play with people.
Imagine the fighters are fighting on an
island or anywhere you want, but New York
is a good default.

Happy New Year 2016!  We believe this year will be an incredible year for WooCommerce and the global Ecommerce community.  We have an incredible amount of meetups, topics and speakers designed to educate, enrich, and share knowledge of WooCommerce products and Ecommerce best practices.


So all members can appropriately plan for attendance, we intend to keep the the timing of the meetup consistent throughout the year.

Come and learn and be part of the ever growing WooCommerce community.

Location: Grind NYC

Meet & Greet: 6:15pm - 6:30pm

Get To Know your fellow WooCommerce patrons, exchange a business card, and perhaps learn a thing or two you didn’t know before.

WooCommerce Plugin Series: 6:30pm - 7:00pm

Our Plugin review series explores a new Woocommerce plugin.  We review the importance of the plugin and why its valuable to your store.  We will also have a free license giveaway to those attending the in person meetup.

Speaker Series: 7:00pm - 7:45pm

ECOMMERCE DESIGN - BUILDING TRUST FOR YOUR BRAND

We are excited to introduce Martha Lynn Laskie as our guest speaker for the next meetup.

Martha will be speaking about Ecommerce Design and how important it is to have an impeccable design to build trust with your customers.

MARTHA'S BIO


URL: http://marthalynnlaskie.squarespace.com/


An alumnus of the prestigious Purchase School of Art & Design, Martha Lynn’s diverse work can be found in multiple online publications and her abilities are constantly sought after by the top companies in the business in and around the New York City area and Hudson Valley.


In 2013, she was accepted as part of the Made in NY coalition as well as being voted “Best Design Consultant in Yonkers’ by Yonkers Business Awards, and continued to receive the award in 2014 and 2015.


Branding and marketing are part of Martha Lynn’s  arsenal of abilities that she brings toward companies that she has helped thrive and flourish because of her award winning work.


Martha Lynn has designed hundreds of visual and branding collateral for businesses to help them brand themselves in a thoughtful and professional way. 


She also is one of the Creative Directors for Alpha Beta Creatives.

ABOUT SPEAKER SERIES


Our speaker series brings in some of the best Woocommerce innovators to share insightful information for Merchants, Designers, Developers, Marketers of Ecommerce.

Meeting close: 8:00PM

results.description:
This week I am going to see Joy I will arrive at 6:30 for the 6:50 pm showing. I  have seat D6 If you are coming post your seat #  Meet in lobby after the movie for some chit chat.

Hope to see YOU at the movies!   Love, Cassie

Ok who LOVES the movies as much as me? Who has a limited entertainment budget like me? LOL Well this is the event for YOU!

My local theater has discount Tuesday every week and if you sign up online they will even send you a coupon for the concession stand, each week a different one (this weeks is free small popcorn with a drink purchase). They also have those awesome new reclining seats! And you get to choose and pay for your seat in advance so there is no rushing in at the last minute and sitting in the front row and straining your neck!  Here is the link to the theater for more details: http://www.cinemark.com/theatre-detail.aspx?node_id=83854

If you purchase tickets online and can’t make it to the theater, just respond to the email address you receive the confirmation email from ([masked]) and they can refund the payment remotely.

So here is how it's going to work each week. I will choose a movie when the new schedule goes out (Fri/Sat) and choose the movie and showtime. I will buy my seat online and post what row and number. Those of you who wish to join me can buy your seat near me. There are two ways to buy seats: 1) online in advance is your best bet but there is a $1.25 service fee per ticket unless you buy a gift card at the theater and pre-load it 2) At the theater no service fee but you really need to drive there in advance if you want seats near us. OR you can just show up that night and sit wherever there is space available.

Hope to see YOU at the movies!!    Love, Cassie

PS: I am doing this with my friendship group too so if you are S&L do wear your wristbands. If you need to buy one let me know, they are just $1 These are loads of fun at the movies though they glow in the dark!

if you can't make it, no need to post why. We understand and will catch you next time!

results.description:
Traders! Precision Trading Labs (PTL) is rebooting the NYC/Tri-State TradeStation (TS) Users Group. We aim to give TS users a local place as well as an online community to meet and discuss all-things-TradeStation. Some of us are experienced users and very well-versed in TS's core and advanced features, but don't code EasyLanguage (EL). Others are EL wizards and write their own strategies and functions. Still others are new to the platform, either experienced traders moving to TS, as well as rookie traders new to everything.

The principals of PTL are fulltime traders and use TS for all four asset classes. We are very well versed in the platform but don't code, except to lightly personalize code someone else has written.

Please join us and share your questions, tips, experiences, and ideas. Novices come and hear from experienced users. TS is great, but there's definitely a learning curve. All are welcome. And if besides discussing the platform we talk a little trading, all the better!

Please join us for the group reboot on Tuesday January 5 @ 6:30pm here at the PTL traderoom. We've got a wall monitor to which we attach a laptop via HDMI, so if you wish to demonstrate something, it can be done if you bring either your own laptop or workspaces and EL files on a flashdrive.

Also, please check out our trading groups:

http://www.meetup.com/NYC-Technical-Trader-Talks/

http://www.meetup.com/nyc-options-traders/
results.how_to_find_us: north side of W45th St, btwn 5th-6th Aves, 7th Fl (Offices of Sunrise Captial)
results.name: The reboot of NYC (TriState) TradeStation Users Group!!!

results.description:
Topic

Come to the meetup to learn how to create a Java-based microservices using Spring Boot, containerize it using Maven plugins, and subsequently deploy a fleet of microservices and dependent components such as Redis using Kubernetes. 

Spring Boot makes creating microservices fast and easy - when it comes to running a single instance. Like most Java application, the harder part is usually the clustering and fail-over configurations.  First, we'll go over how get started with Spring Boot and then use Maven plugins to generate and create Docker images during the build process. Next, we'll go over some basic architecture and configurations such as: 

• Configuring Spring Session - Using Redis as the session store.

• Testing the configuration locally with container linking.

• Tips and tricks for faster startup.

Finally, with the images, we'll deploy the microservice into Kubernetes covering topics such as

• Defining pods and services 

• Linking microservices to Redis using Kubernetes 

• Perform rolling upgrades of the application 

• Canary new versions of the microservices into the fleet 

• Visualize all of these activities happening in Kubernetes.

About the Speaker


Ray is a Developer Advocate for the Google Cloud Platform. Ray had extensive hands on cross-industry enterprise systems integration delivery and management experiences during his time at Accenture, managed full stack application development, DevOps, and ITOps.  Ray specialized in middleware, big data, and PaaS products during his time at Red Hat while contributing to open source projects, such as Infinispan. Aside from technology, Ray enjoys traveling and adventures.


Agenda

6:30 pm Registration and Pizza

7-8 pm Presentation
results.name: Spring Boot Micro-services, Containers, and Kubernetes

results.description:
Given by Yasuko Kasaki
Tuesdays from 6:30 – 7 pm
Free

Please join us in the sharing of miracles. Here, your mind can come to rest and you can remember true peace. No experience with meditation is required, and everyone is welcome. We ask only that you make it your intention to sit still, quiet in body and mind, and to listen to; receive and follow my instruction to the best of your ability. You will learn to meditate as you practice. Please arrive for Meditation before 6:30 pm as we don't allow latecomers to enter.

We at CRS are dedicated teachers and students of A Course in Miracles (ACIM) who are waiting to share miracles with you through our ACIM Healing. We ask the Holy Spirit to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and we share forgiveness and bear witness to the miracles that are happening in your life. Each week I will share with you a different inspirational message from Holy Spirit. This may take the form of creative visualization exercises, or instruction about the nature and purpose of meditation, or about our true nature and relationship to ourselves, to one another, and to the world. In a sense, this is both a meditation practice and a meditation class.

Some students have been coming regularly for a number of years. Others drop in and out as they have time or need. Some come to learn and grow, others more so simply to calm down, to take time out from the frenetic pace of their busy lives. If you are new and feeling uncertain or shaky, do not hesitate to introduce yourself to some of the other students, to ask questions before or after. Try to observe and emulate the stillness and concentration of others around you whom you sense are most grounded. Soon, you, in turn, may provide inspiration and guidance for others.

While the principles are based on ACIM, it does not matter if you are unfamiliar with ACIM or are not prepared to study it outside of this meditation. You can still take from this practice some very practical, effective lessons, tools, and experiences that can enable you to lead a more peaceful, purposeful, fulfilling and loving life.

Namaste,

Yasuko Kasaki,
Founder
CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing)
123 4th Ave, 2nd FL (between 12th & 13th streets, above Think Coffee)
New York, NY 10003
[masked]
www.crsny.org
results.name: ACIM-Based Guided Meditation

results.description:
Maximize your potential with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your FALL with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call 

<a>[masked]</a>

Aside from our League play we offer Open Play 6 days a week. 1 hour and 45 minute sessions only $11 midweek.

Format: 3 teams of 5 per court. Score by 1’s. Games to 7. Winner stays but must sit after 2 games. No refs. Call your own. Our moderator will help things along. All players must bring a white and a dark shirt (not grey). This is a friendly run. Anyone with the wrong attitude will not be allowed back. Age: 21+

Our open runs are designed for good fun and a run. The A / B breakdown is purely a self rating device to try and split things up in an enjoyable manner. Think of it as if you were going to the park to play. If you are average or above go to the A court. If you are average or below go to B.  It is not exact. There is always going to be some crossover.  

***Please note- RSVP'g on Meetup will not reserve your spot. Please go to our website to sign up.*** A credit card payment is required to reserve your space. Just click the session that interests you.

results.description:
Our Tuesday night Central Park training workouts are typically tempo runs or hill repeats.  These workouts are usually very well attended with a wide variety of paces.

The meeting spot is at the 72nd street transverse by Bethesda Fountain. There we'll give the full workout details, including distance, pacing groups, expected run time, and where we plan on meeting at the end. You can expect a typical workout to be between 5 and 8 miles (or less during hill workouts).

A note on warm ups: We do not do a full warm up as a group in Central Park, so we encourage you to show up at 7 p.m. having jogged an easy mile or two ahead of time.

If it's your first time meeting us, feel free to come a few minutes early with any questions.  There are many other groups who meet on 72nd St so look for the one with folks in Whippet singlets.

Please note that there is no place to store bags inside Central Park. Pack light, or store your bags at a nearby gym if you are a member. Another option is the New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center, which stays open until 9pm: http://www.therunningcompany.net/new-yorks-homepage
results.how_to_find_us: We meet on 72nd transverse at the point that overlooks Bethesda Fountain

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Beverly Francis will call a lovely program of English country dance with live musical accompaniment by The Dressed Ship.

Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance!

English country dance is choreographed community dancing, with repertoire ranging from court dances of the 1650s through dances composed this year. If you’ve seen any of the Jane Austen movies, you’ve glimpsed some kinds of ECD.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up.

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost:  $15 for general public; $12 members and for full time students with ID.  Be sure to tell the people at the door if this is your first time dancing with us.  They will give you a free pass to return as our guest!

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!
results.name: English Country Dance with Beverly Francis and The Dressed Ship!

results.description:
Dear Enneagram Group -

We will start the new year with a meeting on the topic of coaching - hopefully to be continued into a new series.

The field of coaching, both the more general "life coaching" and the various forms of career coaching, has been a major vehicle for the contemporary dissemination of the Enneagram.  While not as well known as the authors who first gave birth to and popularized the field (Ichazo, Naranjo, Riso, Palmer), in more recent decades a cohort of Enneagram authors who are themselves professional coaches has appeared - such as Mario Sikora, Ginger Lapid-Bogda, Mary Bast, among many others.

In general, coaching with the Enneagram tends to stress more down-to-earth seeming applications of the system, apparently mainly because people in a business context may find overtly "spiritual" material to be overly threatening or otherwise inappropriate.

One new member of our group who has ample professional experience in this field has been meeting with me recently to discuss how coaching actually works, along with some of the resources that are available.

This evening, we will start taking a look at some simple self-coaching exercises, intended to spark insights into how we may be inspired to work on our professional lives (and, by extension, on our personal lives as well).  No previous experience with coaching is needed, though any who may have such experience are particularly encouraged to attend.

This is also a beginner-friendly topic for newcomers to our group who may be just getting into the Enneagram - those I haven't met are asked to please come to the meeting early, if possible.  I'll be arriving at 6.30 at the Quest Bookshop, next door to our meeting-building at 240 E 53 (slightly below-ground) - please look for me there; if several new people come, we may head upstairs before 7.

With Regards,

Nicholas (Organizer)
results.name: Enneagram as a Tool for Coaching (and Self-Coaching)

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
Sun 1 – 2 pm (12 – 1 pm on 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

results.description:
It's almost January, which means that Gotham Rock Choir, NYC's only Rock, Pop and Soul Choir (recently featured on NBC's "Today" with Kathie Lee and Hoda) will be admitting new members!

Some helpful info:

--GRC runs in "cycles" (think terms or semesters). Our new cycle (Cycle 17) begins on January 5th and runs through the end of April, culminating in a concert at an off-Broadway theatre. Rehearsals are once a week, on Tuesday evenings from 7-9 PM. Please be sure that you're available for this day and time each week. 

-- GRC repertoire includes pop/rock songs from the 60s to today, made famous by artists such as Queen, The Beatles, Aretha Franklin, Bon Jovi, etc. Music-reading skills and previous choral experience are not required--all you need is a good ear, a passion for singing and an appreciation of pop/rock music. Many solo/small group opportunities for especially talented vocalists. 

--GRC is a performing choir. Each cycle includes a Cabaret Evening, where our members can perform their own favorite tunes as solos/duets/small groups, as well as a full choir concert held at the end of the Cycle. In addition, we may be doing some outside gigs. Previous outside gigs have included performances at Madison Square Garden, Barclay Center, the New York City Veteran's Day Parade, the Knitting Factory, the New York Stock Exchange Christmas Tree Lighting and Gotham Girls Roller Derby. We recently completed an as-yet unaired commercial for a famous beverage. 

See our website at GothamRockChoir.com for more info on joining GRC.

***GRC rehearses in a school on the Lower East Side of Manhattan. Out of an abundance of caution for the students who attend there, we don't publish the address. Those who indicate that they plan on coming will receive an email with the exact address.***

results.description:
Shochu Tuesday is now called "Shochu'sday", begins its 2016 izakaya pilgrimage on January 5th at Uminoie, which is arguably the most authentic shochu bar in NYC. "Uminoie" means "beach shack", which is fitting since Mutsumi-san, the owner, is from Goto, an island off the coast of Nagasaki Prefecture. Her father sends udon from Goto to give the menu a decidedly authentic flare. Her partner Mika developed the fantastic menu prepared by whichever one of them is working that night in their tiny kitchen behind the bar. 

We will be pouring barley shochu from Nagasaki and Oita as the beginning of our shochu journey for 2016 as barley shochu from Nagasaki is some of the most traditional shochu available. 

Have you tried shochu? The traditional distilled spirit from Japan? It's drier than sake and much easier to drink than other spirits. Goes great when paired with food. 

Stephen Lyman, editor of <a>http://kampai.us,</a>; certified shochu adviser, and and shochu consultant for several NYC Japanese restaurants, pours selected shochu each Tuesday around NYC. The location will be on the move so stay on top of each week here on meetup or by following Stephen on twitter @kampaius
results.name: Shochu'sday: Nagasaki Style

Come with your intentions and questions and journey to find the answers. This will be an open Journey where you come with you own needs and plans. We will open our sacred circle, introduce ourselves and share our goals. Then we will journey for 20 minutes and search our sacred pathways for our own answers.

We will then gather again as a community the support each other and hold space for each other.

Admittance $10
results.name: Shamanic Journey Night

results.description:
Thank you to everyone who came to December's Smutty Book Club! Although we enjoyed the fact that reading a comic book was different, we are eager to get back to a regular book.  So here it is! 

January's book is a classic:  Delta of Venus: Erotica by Anaïs Nin. It's a collection of short stories, so there will be something for everyone, and some things for no one.  Delta of Venus is recommended by Merry and Gerta with a unanimous thumbs up from everyone.  


The publisher says: In Delta of Venus Anaïs Nin penned a lush, magical world where the characters of her imagination possess the most universal of desires and exceptional of talents. Among these provocative stories, a Hungarian adventurer seduces wealthy women then vanishes with their money; a veiled woman selects strangers from a chic restaurant for private trysts; and a Parisian hatmaker named Mathilde leaves her husband for the opium dens of Peru. Delta of Venus is an extraordinarily rich and exotic collection from the master of erotic writing.

This book is available on Kindle, iBook, and Nook. But the physical book is difficult to find, or expensive.  If you want a paper book we recommend www.abebooks.com. They sell Delta of Venus for $2.99.  

Look for the meet-up for our Annual Holiday House Party. It will be on December 26th at Heidi's house.  Only those who have attend a previous Smutty Book Club meeting are invited - we don't want weirdo strangers in Heidi's house - It's only open to weirdos we already know :) 

And please come to my Ugly Sweater Brunch party at Nelly Spillane's on December 12th. It's a fundraiser for Cycle for Survival. I'll post that too. 

See you next time at Smutty Book Club!  

Dawn
results.how_to_find_us: We are the loud laughing people in the back. Follow the signs.
results.name: Monthly Smutty Book Club - Delta of Venus by Anaïs Nin

results.description:
Questions/Scriptures to be discussed include:

1. Why does God permit so much evil in the world?
2. What does mankind's future look like, as per the Bible?
3. Are science and faith mutually exclusive? Could they be reconciled with each other?
4. What happens when a man dies?
5. What has happened over 2000 years of church history and how has that changed Christianity from its original version?
6. Can the Bible be harmonized from Genesis to Revelation? Does it contradict itself anywhere?
7. What is the Kingdom of Heaven?
8. Why did Jesus tell so many parables (more than 90%) about his upcoming Kingdom?
9. What's the purpose of this Kingdom of God?
10. Why is it taking so long to come? Hasn't it been 2000 years since Jesus?

results.description:
In this group, you'll learn new ways of communicating in order to share more vulnerably and openly, bring attention more fully to the present in order to discover the richness of whats happening in relationship with others, and begin to see and co-explore aspects of yourself you may have been unaware of before in service of greater self-understanding, expression and awareness. You'll have the opportunity to learn and use new tools to participate in circles by sharing yourself, understanding others, and growing in both enjoyment of and capacity for presence and deep connection.

The more Ive seen people Circle the more genuine, " in the moment" conversations Ive seen become possible for them.

Likewise, the more Ive seen them become comfortable in their own skin, get clear on what their feeling, wanting or needing in any moment, grow in a sense of presence and natural interest in others, and generally embody a deep capacity for presence and authenticity.

If connecting profoundly with others, developing present moment awareness, and learning new communication skills inspires you, come try Circling out! The cost is $20

To ensure a full experience for everyone, the meetup will start promptly at 7:00. Please arrive no later then 6:55 to set up and be ready to begin.
results.name: Tuesday Night Circling: Creating Connection and Presence

The Coming of Shadows (1996 winner - season 2, episode 7):  The Centauri emperor visits the station, leading G'Kar to attempt to assassinate him. Lord Refa and Londo conspire to expand their power on Centauri Prime

Severed Dreams (1997 winner - season 3, episode 10):  When President Clark tries to seize control of Babylon 5 by force, Sheridan is faced with the prospect of severing the station's ties with Earth. Delenn receives disturbing news from a Ranger.

results.description:
ALL CRITIQUE SPACES TAKEN. BUT PLEASE COME AND LISTEN IN. WE'D LOVE TO HAVE YOU!


The last one was so much fun...we are doing it again!


Learn to improve your photography through a gentle and honest interactive online photo critique led by professional photographer, Vickie Lewis.

Here is the link to attend:

https://global.gotomeeting.com/join/769819077

<a href="https://global.gotomeeting.com/join/769819077"></a>You can also dial in using your phone.

United States +1 (224)[masked]

Access Code: [masked]


The very best way to take your photography to the next level is to get personal feedback. These critiques are a great place to feel safe, talk about your work and get constructive feedback.
Vickie has been a full-time professional photographer and editor for over 30 years and has shot over 150 portraits for People Magazine. Her work is represented by The National Geographic image collection.
To assure personal attention during the critiques, we are going to limit the number of photographers being critiqued to five. Photographers being critiqued will be able to interact with Vickie and get their questions answered.
We’ll using gotomeeting.com. It requires downloading a viewer on your computer. I will post the link to go meeting before December 10th.

I've been doing critiques for a long time and realize that just listening can be educational too and so we are inviting all our Meetup group members to view the critiques for free.
The first five photographers who sign up to be critiqued will send 8-10 photos via email. Send your best, a recent shoot or something that didn't come out the way you thought it would and we'll help figure out what could have been done differently. Due to time limitations, we probably won’t critiqued all the photos each photographer submits, but we like to have a selection to look at to help you improve. We will make sure those who choose to participate get personal attention.
It doesn't matter what your skill level is, we have beginners and advanced and everyone learns something!
If you’d like to have your photos critiqued, the price is $25 per person.
Go to this link to sign up:
https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=K88M9X3ASDRLG

What past participants have said about critiques:
"Fantastic! I was nervous about having my photos critiqued, but Vickie offered suggestions with gentleness and respect. It wasn't painful at all! Listening to her feedback, I had a great "ah-ha" moment about what I need to do to take my work to the next level. I'm so grateful to have had this opportunity to personally interact with a respected and experienced professional at such a bargain price. I will definitely do it again if the opportunity comes around again!"

"I enjoyed the webinar and it was very informative. It made me look at my photos in a different way along with understanding focal point. I would take another webinar with Vickie. Thank you."

"I enjoyed this session very much. Vickie has such a good eye it's amazing! There was a nice balance between recommendations for improvement and pointing out what was good. We saw some outstanding photos, I hope the other photographers will post some of them."

“Once again, our group provided a rewarding way to learn. Each one of our members showed interesting photographs, along with unique approaches to the subject matter. Vickie gave us valuable feedback, and it was the feedback that we all needed. If you want to belong to a social and educational photo Meetup, try this one!”

“A very enjoyable evening. I learned a lot!”

“Great evening! It was good to see everyone and I enjoyed everyone's work. It very helpful to me get reactions from other folks to improve my pictures.

“So interesting to see how cropping can move a photo from good to wow! A thoroughly enjoyable evening. Thanks for such an enjoyable discussion.”

Great feedback! Great to see other photographer's work and viewpoints.

“All, thank you for a great experience and the great suggestions. I'm using them already and got many new ideas from all the wonderful photos.”

“As usual, I was impressed and inspired by everyone's photos. I also picked up a couple new tips, so it was a great night!”

“Thank you all for a wonderful evening! Beautiful photos, great tips and a great group! Hope to attend another informative session :)”

results.description:
:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

Please join us at our January General Meeting of the Rockville Centre Tea Party Patriots-  Tuesday, January 5th, at 7:00 PM.


In addition to out invited speakers, this month we feature the movie "IRANIUM"

Iran’s nuclear program presents a threat to international stability.  Yet successive American administrations—Republican and Democratic alike—have misread the intentions and actions of the Iranian regime.

How dangerous is a nuclear Iran, even if it never detonates a weapon?  What are the guiding principles of the Iranian leadership?  To what lengths would the regime go to carry out its agenda?  How far have Iran’s leaders already gone to fund the world’s most powerful terrorist organizations?  And why have American leaders failed to gain the upper hand in relations with Iran during the past 30 years?

In approximately 60 minutes, Iranium powerfully reports on the many aspects of the threat America and the world now face using rarely-before seen footage of Iranian leaders, and interviews with 25 leading politicians, Iranian dissidents, and experts on: Middle East policy, terrorism, and nuclear proliferation.

Iranium documents the development of Iran’s nuclear threat, beginning with the Islamic Revolution of 1979 and the ideology installed by Supreme Leader Ayatollah Khomeini.Iranium tracks Iran’s use of terror as a tool of policy, beginning with the 444 day seizure of the U.S. Embassy in Tehran, through Iran’s insurgent actions in Iraq and Afghanistan.Iranium details the brutal nature of the Iranian regime to its own citizens, and the Iranian people’s desire to rejoin the international community.Iranium outlines the various scenarios the greater Middle East and the Western world may face should Iran cross the nuclear threshold.


**************************************************************************


Also, "Bob Dann's Tea Party University", and his specially  hand picked "Videos of the Month".

***************************************************************************

Don't forget to purchase your 50/50 raffle tickets at all of our meetings. Last month's winner walked away with  $150.00! Get a full arm's length of tickets for only $10.00. You can use your arm, our arm, or the really tall guy with the long arms sitting next to you!!

Remember, we use the proceeds of our monthly raffle sales to help offset the costs of running our meetings. Please participate, and be generous!

*****************************************************************


Please Note:

Speakers and agenda times listed above are subject to change. With only a few exceptions our General Meetings are held the first Tuesday of every month from 7:00 to 9:00 PM at the American Legion Hall, 197 Maple Avenue Rockville Centre. All of our meetings are open to the public. Doors open around 6:30 for early-birds, shmoozers, and those wishing to help us set up the meeting. Our actual meeting begins at 7 PM.

All are welcome. Bring your neighbors, bring your friends!

We respectfully request that you RSVP your attendance to all of our meetings and events regardless of if you are able to attend or not. Simply click the link contained inside this invitation to RSVP.  Please do it now.
 Thank You.
results.name: JANUARY GENERAL MEETING OF THE ROCKVILLE CENTRE TEA PARTY PATRIOTS

Guest Teacher

Carl Chimon Viggiani, Sensei

We are fortunate to have Carl Viggiani, Sensei visit with us.

Carl is a Dharma Heir of Robert Kennedy, SJ, Roshi.

Carl began formal study of Zen Buddhism with the Japanese Teacher Eido Roshi in 1987, later moving to Dai Bosatsu Zendo, Eido Roshi's monastery in the Catskills, where he lived and practiced until 1993. He continued with Daido Loori Roshi at Zen Mountain Monastery, and with Roshi Robert Kennedy at Morning Star Zendo in Jersey City.

He will sit, offer daisan (one to one teaching) in the second period and a Dharma talk in the last period.

results.description:
How signing up works: There are 4 spots for this meetup.

Please sign up on the waitlist. After 24 hours, if there are less than or equal to 4 people signed up I will move everyone to the going list and afterwards signing up will be like normal. If there are more than 4 people, I will give priority to those who have previously been on the waitlist and were not able to attend a prior meetup. I do sign ups this way so everyone has a chance to attend events. I know I tend to post things late at night and want morning people to also get to come to events.

The Place: Sister to soul-food spot Peaches, this Bed-Stuy poultry purveyor has a smaller space and shorter menu, but shares the focus on sustainable, locally sourced ingredients. The interior, like the food, centers on nostalgia for simpler things: A cloud-gray room hosts wraparound picnic-style benches, and a scuffed hardwood floor complements a down-home service style. The kitchen doles out a collection of the usual high-end rib-stickers: sweet slabs of cornbread that taste more like cake; fried green tomatoes dressed with sprigs of arugula, barbecue mayo, and thick strips of bacon; large, juicy shrimp covered in mild barbecue sauce over fried-grits cubes; a bowl of creamed corn garnished with that same wonderful bacon. House cocktails that lean on bourbon, mashed blueberries, and sweet tea make for excellent chasers. Peaches' fare isn't always exceptional: Shrimp and grits with plainclothes Cheddar lacks any discernible kick, and greens, like a bland side bowl of sautéed kale, play second string. The kitchen’s famous fried-chicken plate, on the other hand, consists of three pieces stacked over a slab of white bread and dusted with a spice so red it almost glows. While the “hot” variety is surprisingly mild, the “extra hot” option warrants a special note: Try it if you dare, but don’t say we didn’t warn you.

RSVPs:

Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event.

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I always give priority to people on the waitlist if spots open up. If there are a lot of people on the waitlist I will try to get more seats, although for reservations made far in advance I am unlikely to be able to do so. At very least it will let me know what kinds of restaurants are popular so I can schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.
results.name: Peaches Hot House- Nashville Hot Chicken

After brief report-backs on ongoing projects, we will have an open, facilitated discussion on a topic of freegan interest. This month, we'll discuss ideas for systems and strategies for sharing "stuff" – physical non-perishable goods. Bring your ideas and opinions and let's talk! We welcome both those with experience taking part in non-hierarchical consensus-based groups and those participating for the first time. At 9pm, we will end our business meeting and have a brief, newcomer-friendly discussion about freeganism before the trash tour. The meeting is NOT open to media.

Newcomers are always welcome and encouraged to attend our full meeting, but if you ONLY want an introduction to freeganism and to dumpster dive, DON'T sign up for this meeting! See the next one (Freeganism 101 and Trash Tour, later the same evening).

If you have trouble finding us call Janet [masked]).

results.description: On a windy spring day, the calm, organized life of science writer Joe Rose is shattered when he witnesses a tragic accident: a hot-air balloon with a boy trapped in its basket is being tossed by the wind, and in the attempt to save the child, a man is killed. A stranger named Jed Parry joins Rose in helping to bring the balloon to safety. But unknown to Rose, something passes between Parry and himself on that day--something that gives birth to an obsession in Parry so powerful that it will test the limits of Rose's beloved rationalism, and drive him to the brink of madness. A novel of love, faith, and suspense, and of how life can change in an instant.
results.name: Enduring Love by Ian McEuan

results.description:
Is it possible to have too much Origami? In the world of OMG never!

This is our Weekly Tuesday Folder's meeting at Argo Tea on University Place near Union Square!

If you have models you would like to learn or teach, let me know and we will try our best to accommodate.

This meeting is free and open to all level of folders from beginners to advanced. bring paper and your books and also there will always be free paper available to share so you can just show up and fold!

hope to see you there! happy folding!!

It would be great for you to RSVP if you plan on attending so others will know you will be there. Thanks and happy folding!

-Sok

NOTE: reminders emails for WTF will not be sent out because it will always be at the same time and same place and same day of the week and I am trying my best not to send out too many mass emails for the group! So check back here on the website for any changes and updates or cancellations ;)

results.description:
Come on out and enjoy a night of food drink, conversation and a little friendly competition with members of several Meet Up Groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com! Test your skills as New York Social Network Founder Dave Cervini hosts a fun evening that will have you thinking, laughing and learning about pop culture, music, TV, Movie, History, NYC and more.

Most questions are easy and others you may have to rely on your teammates for help. Come alone or with a friend. Even if you think you don’t know much trivia, it is still a great way to meet others in the group. We will have special sections set aside for NYSN members to meet and team up.  Pay as you go for food and drink. There are several rounds and prizes awarded for each round!

Can I come alone? Yes! If you do not know anyone there we will introduce you to others and make you part of teams.

What should I wear? Most come from work but The Firehouse is a pub with a very casual atmosphere.

Can I eat there? The Firehouse is known for it's wings. But they also have burgers, quesadillas, veggie sandwiches, salads, pizza, burrito's and more. If you want to eat with the group, plan to get there around 7pm.

How long does it last? We have 3 rounds of 15 questions each.  The trivia usually lasts until about 9:30pm.  After that some stayb and socialize and other head home.

How do I get there? It is near the corner of west 85th and Columbus Avenue.  The B,C stop a block away at CPW and 86th and the #1 stops at B'way and 86th.

This event is being hosted by The New York Social Network  WWW.NEWYORKSOCIALNETWORK.COM  and several of their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP’s below reflect only a portion of those attending.  Please only sign up for this event if you are serious about attending. (We have a 3 flakes and you’re out rule). If you have any questions regarding this or any of our events please contact Dave Cervini directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: Fun & Easy Rotating Teams Trivia Night

results.description:
Come on out to the Tara Hill Irish Tavern for a bluegrass jam.

This jam is for all level of players.  There will be a mix of traditional instruments and any uke players who come from this group.

Bring a song to share.  It's best if you have at least some printouts of the music.  Traditionally at a bluegrass jam people take turns leading the songs.  If you don't have any bluegrass songs other country or folk songs fit too. 

If you don't have a song or don't want to lead, that's ok too. 

In case you were thinking that you don't play much bluegrass, come anyway!  Most bluegrass is pretty easy to play. 

The plan is to do these jams every first and third Tuesday of the month.

Email me for more info:  [masked]

See you there!
results.name: Bluegrass jam (ukes and traditional instruments invited)

results.description:
Here is a unique opportunity to join a healing group that meets regularly to support your needs using the amazing potential of Tapping.

There will NOT be a lot of discussion or socializing because we will be too busy Tapping on specific and general issues of our Emtional and Physical concerns using EFT and something called Tong Ren.

EFT is well known for eliminating the causes of emotional distress. Many people are also aware of using EFT for physical well being. Sometimes we need to look at the emotional aspects that may be behind the issues of concern, and sometimes we just tap directly on the symptoms and notice if we get relief just from that. Its very nice when this happens and it happens a lot.

Tong Ren is another form of healing using tapping but unlike EFT it doesnt involve any dialog to describe the issues of concern. We just tap on a surragate model (Tong Ren) as if we were doing acupunture on a real body with intention of healing and it works!!!!

We'll meet at Jain's home in Scarsdale every 2nd and 4th Tuesday evening and whoever is interested in joining us is welcome. The only stipulation is that whatever issue you bring to our attention you let us tap on it.
results.name: Tapping Meetup for Emotional and Physical Healing with EFT and Tong Ren

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!
