results.description:
Next episode of Eco-Logic, Tuesday, Jan. 5, 8PM:
www.wbai.org and 99.5FM

Cyber-Attack on the Electricity Grid. How likely is it?

Our lifestyle and civilization rely on steady supplies of electricity and an electricity grid was created to supply that electricity. Our society is increasingly reliant on computers and the grid is no exception to that. There have been several articles online about the grid being vulnerable to a cyber-attack and how a dam in Rye, NY did indeed get a cyber-attack. So did a portion of the grid in California. Is the Indian Point nuclear plant vulnerable as well?

I will explore that with Michel Lee, who has been studying just how vulnerable the grid is. Michel is Chair of the Council on Intelligent Energy & Conservation Policy (CIECP) and on the Steering Committee of the Indian Point Safe Energy Coalition (IPSEC). Joining us will be Rob from the Wednesday night WBAI program "Off the Hook," giving us more in-depth knowledge of hacking.

Here are links to some of the articles Michel will be referring to. Copy and paste the web sites below into your internet browser:

http://www.lohud.com/story/news/2015/12/22/cyber-attack-rye-dam-raises-concerns/77755474/

http://www.wsj.com/articles/iranian-hackers-infiltrated-new-york-dam-in-2013-1450662559

https://www.chathamhouse.org/sites/files/chathamhouse/field/field_document/20151005CyberSecurityNuclearBaylonBruntLivingstoneUpdate.pdf

http://nymag.com/daily/intelligencer/2015/12/report-new-york-dam-targeted-by-iranian-hackers.html#

http://www.democratandchronicle.com/story/news/2015/12/22/cyber-attack-rye-dam-raises-concerns/77767142/

http://www.homelandsecuritynewswire.com/dr20150910-insider-threats-organizational-rigidity-pose-challenges-for-u-s-national-security-study

http://www.nytimes.com/2015/11/08/sunday-review/the-cyberthreat-under-the-street.html

http://www.nytimes.com/2015/10/22/business/international/hinkley-point-nuclear-plant.html

http://bits.blogs.nytimes.com/2015/10/14/online-attacks-on-infrastructure-are-increasing-at-a-worrying-pace/

http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/2015/03/24/power-grid-physical-and-cyber-attacks-concern-security-experts/24892471/

http://www.nytimes.com/2014/07/01/technology/energy-sector-faces-attacks-from-hackers-in-russia.html

http://www.nextgov.com/cybersecurity/2014/08/exclusive-nuke-regulator-hacked-suspected-foreign-powers/91643/

http://www.symantec.com/content/en/us/enterprise/media/security_response/whitepapers/Dragonfly_Threat_Against_Western_Energy_Suppliers.pdf
results.name: Cyber-attacks on the electricity grid

results.description:
Join us every Tuesday at 8:30pm as La Luz hosts an ALL LEVELS, OPEN,  DROP-IN Improv Comedy Class!!!

We begin the class with a focus on group activities and fun games as we  move towards some individual character building, short and long form scenes, listening, supporting our partner(s), and performing in front an audience.

Each week is a bit different with various teachers from Upright Citizens Brigade, Magnet Theater, the PIT and places all over the world! Every instructor is a new experience and want our students to have a dynamic well rounded learning experience.

Classes are donation based so please come anyway. We ask $10-13.

Now get on over to La Luz and Let’s Play!!!!

Join us for our next FREE Dating and Relationship Teleseminar 

 "What's Keeping You Single? Starting the New Year as a Smarter New You!"

with Relationship Coaches and Authors, Rosalind Sedacca and Amy Sherman

WHEN: Tuesday, January 5th, 2016 from 8:30 PM to 9:45 PM (ET)  
SPEAKER: , Rosalind Sedacca and Amy Sherman
WHO'S INVITED: This Teleseminar is Open to EVERYONE  
HOW MUCH: Complimentary!  
HOW TO RSVP: http://predatingteleseminar.eventbrite.com 

 "What's Keeping You Single? Starting the New Year As a Smarter New You!"

Certified Relationship Coaches and authors Rosalind Sedacca and Amy Sherman provide a fresh new approach to dating and relationships.

In this must-hear program you'll learn how to ...

·  Overcome relationship struggles

·  Identify unproductive patterns

·  Make better dating choices

·  Attract more desirable partners

·  And have more fun being single!

++ PLUS ++

All attendees will receive: 

·  One free copy of their eBook!

·  Special discounts from Pre-Dating Speed Dating

About Our Speakers

Rosalind Sedacca is a Dating & Relationship Coach, a Divorce & Parenting Coach and co-author of 99 Things Women Wish They Knew About Dating After 40, 50 & Yes, 60! She is also the founder of the Child-Centered Divorce Network for parents and author of How Do I Tell the Kids About the Divorce? Rosalind is an Expert Blogger for The Huffington Post, an Advisor at ParentalWisdom.com as well as a Contributing Writer for Exceptional People Magazine and the 2008 First Place Winner of the Victorious Woman Award and co-creator of the Create Your Ideal Relationship Kit for singles.
  Amy Sherman has a master's degree in counseling/psychology and is a coach, trainer and co-author of 99 things Women Wish They Knew Before Dating After 40, 50, and Yes, 60! Amy understands the needs, challenges and insecurities singles face in finding meaningful relationships and helps them avoid the disasters and disappointment they often experience when dating in mid-life.  She is also the author of Distress-Free Aging: A Boomer’s Guide to Creating a Fulfilled and Purposeful Life and The Joy of Optimism 10-Lesson eCourse, which offer strategies for overcoming adversity and other challenges of middle age.

REMEMBER: 

If you somehow can't make the call; everyone who registers will receive access to the recording replay and bonuses in a follow-up email after this free teleseminar.

For recordings of past teleseminars visit www.Pre-Dating.com/teleseminar
results.how_to_find_us: To get the telephone number or computer log-in information you must register at http://predatingteleseminar.eventbrite.com/ and the information will be emailed to you.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes; timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Why do you need Title Insurance? 

You finally found the perfect house or condo you are going to purchase.  You have gone through all the necessary steps to get there: the realtor's contract to purchase, the real estate attorney to review and finalize the contract, the imortgage commitment, the home inspection and appraisal, the homeowners insurance, and now you're ready to close on the purchase.  The final and crucial step before closing is the ordering of title insurance.  You're asking what is this?  Is this expense necessary?  Yes, it is!  This most important form of insurance, for a mere one payment fee, protects the rights of the real estate ownership by providing the detailed property information through research as recorded with the county recording office, flood requirements per flood map research, past deed history and mortgage history on the property, in addition to municipal payments required.  However, how do you, an inexperienced customer, understand this intricate and detailed information.  You need the expertise of a title insurance company you trust. Speaking today will be Justin Christodoro, an attorney with  Legend Title Agency.   Who better than Justin  the speaker today on this topic, since he is not only part of Legend Title Agency, but also a real estate attorney with so much varied experience which he gained while practicing in this field.  The need for the same title services also applies to those of us experienced owners, for refinances, which Justin will also explain to us. 


Business owners, managers, and salespeople learn about each other's business and we share referrals.  First time attending? Enjoy breakfast on us!


Now, more than ever, business people need to network to stay in business. BNI Crossroads provides a positive, supportive, and structured environment to share ideas, contacts, and business referrals.

To avoid conflict, BNI chapters are allowed to have only one professional per profession - which mean that each of our members represents a specific category of business, effectively locking out the competition. Check out to see if your profession is currently taken at the following link: http://www.bninewjersey.com/chapterdetails.php?chapterId=1636&t=db3907f9cf60c71add464fcce0eddcfde87cc619cfe76e34c4aa5cb439f60347&name=BNI%20BNI%20Crossroads

If you or  someone you know  are looking to increase your sales and your sales force, we have plenty of leads to give out.  Check us out on January 6th and enjoy  breakfast on us.

Email with questions or for more information.

results.description:
Other than strict RSVP rules (if you say you're coming and you don't show, you're out of the group), this is a chill game, open to anyone who <a>signs up</a>.

Here's what separates this group from many others:

• Chill, positive attitudes. (People without forgiving personalities don't last long in this group, let alone in a given game.)

• Good quality equipment: $145 match balls; solid small goals - not pop-ups!

• Freshly laundered, adult-size, pillowy soft pinnies.

• We won't ever over-crowd a game. The size of pitch we use is best suited for 7v7. We're happy to make the pitch smaller if numbers are low. But we won't make it bigger or allow more than 7 players per team. 


• The small fee we ask of each player (at least $3 per session) supports a non-profit that we created and run: a high school soccer league for under-funded schools that don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming. 

See nyisl.com or the below video for more info. about our <a>program</a> for under-served public school students.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc. 

If you have any of these, please bring them to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee!

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.
results.name: Indie Coworking Space

As our earth moves into the next phases, it is getting easier to connect with Loved Ones, Guides and your Higher Self.

Your Higher Self is a source of Omnipresent Intelligence that can guide you in your life purpose and direction of your life. To be connected with this aspect of your Self is an extraordinary experience and can take your life in new directions! Learn how to deeply access this beautiful aspect of your Being in this 3 hour workshop. You will learn:
· Reliable methods to access your Higher Self to tap into deeper wisdom, direction, and creativity

· Discern the differences between Higher Self, Guides, Angles, Loved Ones and other means of channeling information

· How to leverage your current talents to deepen this important relationship

· How to effectively ask questions (and what not to ask) to deepen this connection

· How to create goals in light of this guidance and information, including New Year resolutions

We will use in session meditations and exercises throughout to practice your skills and use the information gathered in session, with time for questions throughout. Marijo Puleo, PhD is a minister, coach and energy practitioner. She has been working with her Higher Self all her life, and helps others discover their intuitive talents and receive guidance. She is a Reiki Master and graduate of the Brennan Healing Science Advanced Studies program. www.marijopuleo.com

results.description:
City of Thorns: A Conversation with Ben Rawlence
Writer Ben Rawlence spent four years living and working in Dadaab, the world’s largest refugee camp, situated on the Somali–Kenyan border. A leading practitioner of “immersion journalism,” in which the observer becomes enmeshed in the lives of his subjects, Rawlence will consider whether such reportage is more effective than traditional forms of media coverage.

Rawlence will be signing copies of his new book, City of Thorns: Nine Lives in the World’s Largest Refugee Camp.

Lunch will be served.
Speakers

Open Society Fellow Ben Rawlence is a former researcher wth Human Rights Watch in the Horn of Africa and is the author of Radio Congo.
Howard French (moderator) spent 18 years overseas with the New York Times and is the author most recently of China’s Second Continent: How a Million Migrants Are Building a New Empire in Africa. PLEASE RSVP! https://www.opensocietyfoundations.org/events/city-thorns-conversation-ben-rawlence-new-york?utm_source=Open+Society+Foundations&utm_campaign=c80a894ae5-events-20151228&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_d16374add2-c80a894ae5-49402341
results.name: Meet the Author of City of Thorns about Dadaab (Kenya)

The campaign to hold the NY Blood Center accountable for abandoning 66 chimps with no food or water continues.

Laurie Glimcher, the dean of Cornell Medical College, resigned from the board of the NY Blood Center as a result of our protests, but her decision to walk away from the scandal did nothing to help the chimps who were abandoned on her watch. We will continue to hold Dr. Glimcher accountable until NYBC reinstates the funds or until she issues a public statement demanding that NYBC reinstate the funds.


4:30 - 5:45 - Laurie Glimcher's Office at Cornell (70th & York)
6:00 - 6:30 - Laurie Glimcher's Home (308 E. 72nd St.)

CALL to ACTION! The abandoned chimps need YOU!

Smart Materials + Wearable Design:  we're experimenting with Wearable Wednesday! Calling all fashion designers, soft circuit enthusiasts and curious makers! Come explore the world of wearable design. Bring your own project if there's something you are working on, or start something here! Want to brush up on your sewing skills and interested in learning about e-textiles?

Wearable Wednesday is hosted by Kate Sicchio. Kate works at the interface of technology and choreography. Her work includes performances, installations, web and video projects. She has presented work internationally across the US, Canada, Germany, Australia, Belguim and the UK at venues such as the V&A (London),  EU Parliament (Brussels), Banff New Media Institute (Banff) and Arnolfini Art Centre (Bristol UK).

results.name: Open Night

results.description:
￼“Collective Song Club” Meets every other Wednesday – 5:30-8:30PM

The "Collective Song Club” will begin on October 14th and follow every other Wednesday evening (skipping the night before Thanksgiving).

Location: Planet Studio NYC (www.planetstudionyc.com)

244 West 54th Street between Broadway and 8th Avenue in Suite 800B on the 8th floor. It will begin at 5:30PM so those heading home from work can stop in without it getting too late. Each session will end promptly at 8:30pm when the studio will go back into record mode for the evening schedule. Drop in at anytime up until 7:30pm during each session. You can’t even really be late! Leave when you like!


The goal of the Collective Song Club is to create a nurturing space for songwriters, artists and producers to present their works in progress, completed songs and productions as well as ask questions about the music business. Vetting songs about to be recorded will give you one more moment of clarity and reflection before you spend energy and dollars on your recording. Song tempos and keys can be discussed as well as best possible producers and vocalists for your project. The studio will have guitars and a keyboard available so no need to feel you have to bring your own. The studio can playback a CD, your iPhone or Android, MP3 player, or connect via the internet to your website or Dropbox. Bring a few lyric sheets of the song you would like to share. The entire evening is about forming a creative community that enhances your art and helps you grow as a songwriter.


There will be no advance payment or sign-up necessary. Each session will cost $20 per person payable at the door as we begin. The studio has a “Square” reader so you can put it on your debit / credit card for $22 with the additional sum to cover the handling charge. Come one week or skip a session - feeling inspired - come on down - feeling tired or have a change of plans - there’s no need to feel like you have to be there. Sessions might be crowded - some might be just a few people - or you!


There are no requirements other than to become a full member of the Collective. The annual membership fee until the end of 2015 is only $35. This membership entitles you to participate in all the Collective workshops as well as perform a song (or have your song performed) in our quarterly Member Benefit Showcases held at the Bitter End. It's easy to become a member - go to www.newyorksongwriterscollective.com and look for "Sign Up/Sign In" in he top right corner of the webpage!


The CSC is an experiment that will hopefully find a place and grow with the necessary changes and additions as it is established. Could it happen every week save for special days and holidays? Could special guests from the industry drop in that would be announced shortly before a session on the Collective website? We shall see!
￼￼
results.name: The "Collective Song Club" presented by the New York Songwriters Collective

results.description:
Travel photography instructor, author and international guide Ralph Velasco discusses a variety of tips and techniques that will help photographers of all skill levels to bring back even better images of their travels. He’ll also get into detail about the preparation he does before a trip, how to make the best decisions with regards to travel and photography during a trip, as well as touch on his post-trip workflow.

To visually demonstrate these simple-to-understand and easy-to-implement concepts, Ralph will be using images he’s made in the last year or so from his recent scouting and group trips to Cuba, Lapland, the Baltics, Morocco, Romania, the Adriatic, Spain, Turkey, Mexico's Copper Canyon, Cambodia, Vietnam, and others. If you’re looking to improve your travel photography, this is a program you’ll definitely want to attend.

Bonus: Everyone in attendance will receive a free PDF version of Ralph’s 101 Tips for Developing Your Photographic Eye & More eBook to enjoy on any reader (it's 150+ pages in length).

Ralph Velasco is President and CEO (Chief Experience Officer) of PhotoEnrichment Programs, Inc. (PEP), the company he founded and has been operating for over a decade now.  He and his team at PEP have organized, and he’s led,, more than 50 cultural tours around the world.  Destinations have included Cambodia, Vietnam, Iceland, Central Europe, Morocco, the Adriatic, Romania, Turkey, Spain, Tuscany, Egypt, Mexico’s Copper Canyon, Bhutan, Nepal, Death Valley, Chicago and San Francisco.  Additionally, as of this writing he’s organized and led more than a dozen fully-licensed People-to-People programs to Cuba.


Currently Ralph is a finalist for the prestigious Travel Photographer of the Year 2015 award (winner to be announced mid-December) and in 2014 he was selected to a list of The Top 100 Travel Photographers in the World. Two years in a row he was awarded “Open Category Photographer of the Year” by the Professional Photographers of Orange County, California. Consumer advocate and National Geographic Traveler columnist Christopher Elliott selected his blog (PhotoEnrichment.com) “One of the 11 best new travel blogs of 2011,” which was also selected one of the Best Travel Blogs of 2012 by Washington Flyer.

His latest eBook is titled Essence of a Place: A Travel Photographer’s Guide to Using a Shot List for Capturing Any Destination, and in it he discusses working from a shot list in order to create a well-rounded portfolio of images that tells a complete story. In his first book, Ralph Velasco On Travel Photography: 101 Tips for Developing Your Photographic Eye & More, he outlines a variety of photography and travel tips he’s learned from a life on the road, as well as provides over 100 sample images and fun and interesting quotes.

As creator of the My Shot Lists for Travel app for iPhone, iPad and iPod touch® (free on iTunes), Ralph has taken the age-old concept of maintaining a shot list and brought it into the 21st century. Designed to help all travelers to bring back a more well-rounded set of images from any destination, the app is a powerful organizational tool, no matter the user’s photography skills or type of camera used.

Ralph has taught travel photography classes at the University of California at Irvine Extension Program, Saddleback College, Santa Ana College, Julia Dean Photography Workshops and REI Outdoor School, among others. He’s a regular speaker at the New York Times Travel Show, the Travel & Adventure Shows, Orange County Fair, and he’s spoken in Spain and Egypt about travel photography and travel blogging.

Connect with Ralph at the following social media sites and subscribe to his blog:

PhotoEnrichment.com

Facebook.com/photoenrichment

Twitter.com/ralphvelasco

Google+

LinkedIn

SIGN UP HERE
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/a-guide-to-better-travel-photography-with-ralph-velasco-tickets-19727811415
results.name: Seminar: A Guide to Better Travel Photography with Ralph Velasco

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].


This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.description:
Welcome to Drupal NYC!


*RSVPs will be closed on Tuesday, January 5th at 12:00pm.*

We're back on first Wednesdays for 2016! This Meetup will be on Wednesday, January 6th! You must enter your real name on the RSVP question or your RSVP will be removed. Check-in opens at 6pm sharp, see you on January 6th!


Agenda
• 6:00 - Check-in opens, socializing + pizza
• 6:30 - Announcements
• 6:45 - Who's hiring, who's looking?
• 6:50 - Talks begin!
• 8:20 - Closing Remarks, socializing + leftover pizza
• 8:45 - Afterparty @ Bill’s Bar & Burger, concourse bar (1 block north, 16 W. 51st St., accessible via Rockefeller Concourse) https://goo.gl/maps/Eghs2

Talks & Speakers

Microservices Architecture for Content Management Systems using AWS Lambda and more by Eugene Istrati

Content Management Systems are by nature resource intensive, expensive to customize, and difficult to manage at scale. What if we can change this perception and help PHP / Drupal developers architect a content platform that is high performance and low cost, high security and low maintenance? This talk will focus on 3 key topics: 1) serverless environment, 2) microservices architecture and 3) hands-on demos. We will describe a serverless solution and propose a scalable architecture that will help Drupal community to adopt cloud-native approach without huge efforts or expensive resources allocation.


Bio
Eugene Istrati has spent over 15 years as a technologist in a variety of industries, including digital media, cloud computing, and reputation marketing. Before joining Mitoc Group as Technology Partner, Eugene worked as Director of Engineering at Hearst Corporation and Program Manager at Amazon Web Services. He holds a dual Bachelor of Science degree in Mathematics and Computer Science and a Master of Science degree in Computer Science and Engineering.


==========

tmate by Mai Irie

tmate is a fork of tmux and makes it easy to share your terminal with someone else. tmate is a great tool for remote pair programming and is also useful for when helping a teammate debug environment issues. Check it out @ tmate.io


Bio
Mai Irie is a Senior Developer at Phase2 Technology.

==========

Evolving your Mobile site Experience - Responsive and ReSS by Greg Lowenthal

Basic 'Responsive Design' is not 'good enough,' enhance your strategy with ReSS (Responsive with Server-side components) leveraging vendor or open source DDRs (Device Detection Repositories) to build for Device Context that can improve your site performance, relevance, and overall mobile UX experience.


Bio
While currently a Senior Solutions Architect at Acquia, Greg Lowenthal has been in the Enterprise CXM space calling into Fortune 500 companies for over 12 years (techs include WCM, DAM, MVT, onsite and ad personalization, recommendations, and mobile optimization). He lives on Long Island ('lawn-gisland') with his wife and three cats. Greg enjoys trying new booze, wine, and beer while smoking brisket and ribs in his backyard.

==========

Want to present at Drupal NYC?!
We are always looking for new talks and speakers from all skill levels. If you are interested in presenting at Drupal NYC please message Ben Jeavons, our Speaker Organizer, @ http://www.meetup.com/drupalnyc/members/6722489
results.how_to_find_us: Enter of 50th street entrance under the neon sign that says Rainbow Room/Observatory Deck. Then go straight and slightly to the right to the check-in table. Here is a video => http://bit.ly/drupalnyc30rockcheckin
results.name: Drupal NYC Meetup @ 30 Rock - January 6th

results.description:
Join D.A.Wagner at Tekserve with award-winning Iranian photographer Ali Rajabi for an evening of unique photography and Lightroom techniques. Don't miss this!

Ali Rajabi Bio

Ali Rajabi started his career at Tehran Institute of Technology in 2001 as a developer of numerous Lightroom Courses and Photoshop Advanced Techniques seminars for photographers at the Tehran Institute of Technology. In 2010 Ali founded the online Training Center for photographers and graphic designers, Atrin.

Ali’s first solo photo exhibition in 2013, “The Land of Silence,” was purchased by the Cultural Heritage of Kerman Province in Iran as a “prestigious work of art,” and in 2014 he was selected as one of 24 notable Emerging Artists in the International Edition of Musee Magazine. He has written guest blog posts for Scott Kelby, was the first Iranian instructor to take part in Photoshop World and his work has been exhibited in group exhibitions around the world in the US, England, Germany, Philippine and Emirates.

Join us tonight to see Ali Rajabi’s rich and powerful award-winning photographs and get insights to his Lightroom (and maybe some Photoshop) techniques. 

Please note: Requested donation for Meetups are $2.00. Cheap! This helps us with the annual cost of maintaining our Meetup page and production costs. Pay online or pay at the door. Thanks for your help!
results.name: Start the New Year by Seeing NYC with Fresh Eyes with Special Guest Ali Rajabi

results.description:
>>>> PURCHASE TICKETS HERE <<<

PLEASE BYPASS the RSVP button at right and register directly above. If you are a dues-paying Member of Out Professionals, this assures you no-cost or low-cost admission to this event. (Nonmembers are always welcome, but nonmember rates apply if you are just part of our Meetup group.) For a full year of Member savings and other career benefits, join Out Professionals here.

YOU SURVIVED THE HOLIDAYS. NOW ENJOY THE YEAR’S FIRST OP.LOUNGE AT LOW COST OR NO COST!

On Wednesday, January 6, members and friends of Out Professionals meet in Hell’s Kitchen at Atlas Social Club (A.S.C.) for the year’s inaugural edition of OP.LOUNGE, our monthly, after-work networking series.

According to Huffington Post, A.S.C. was born when GLAAD Media Awards producer Josh Wood and downtown nightlife impresario Benjamin Maisani decided that “People with that East Village, downtown, Brooklyn sensibility who live in Hell’s Kitchen would patronize a cool ‘downtown’ neighborhood bar.”

The Wall Street Journal describes the club’s design as “Highly evocative of the 1906-era home gym in the quasi-Victorian West Village firehouse-turned-townhouse Mr. Maisani shares with his boyfriend, Anderson Cooper.” Maisani himself terms A.S.C.’s three-room, 2000-square-foot interior “A cross between a gay speakeasy and a retro athletic club.”

The New Year is a great time to renew connections with others, both socially and professionally. That’s why Out Professionals … OP.LYNX, our dynamic women’s network … and dozens of our young and fast-rising LGBT professionals are coming together tonight. Grab some business cards and join us!

WHAT'S UP 

Socializing and networking from 6 to 9 p.m. Happy Hour specials: Absolut vodka drinks and well drinks 2-4-1.

WHERE 

Atlas Social Club, 753 Ninth Avenue at 51st Street. Subway: Number 1/C/E to 50th Street; N/Q/R to 49th Street; B/D/F/M to 47th-50th Streets.

ADMISSION 

Nonmember, $10. Pre-registered, dues-paying OP Member, free! OP dues-payer at the door, $5. Advance registration closes at noon on January 6. Pocket a copy of your online receipt; thanks! Walk-ins welcome; cash only at the door.

IT PAYS TO BE AN OP MEMBER 

Enjoy a 12-month individual OP membership (new or renewal) PLUS guaranteed admission to the first networking mixer of 2016 — just $65. And remember, that buys you a year’s worth of low-cost or no-cost networking and socializing. Order here.
results.name: Let's Meetup and Network!

Our host thelab will be providing pizza and drinks at no charge to attendees. :)


Say hello on IRC! We're #django-nyc on Freenode. 

About our host thelab

thelab is one of NYC's top digital agencies. We build sites, e-commerce systems, web apps, mobile apps, retail installations, and whatever else we concept next for some great brands and clients. We focus on python, javascript, and contributing to open source projects to meet client needs.

Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a><a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/">

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late leave a comment on the website. If you can't find the group just ask at the front desk.  Food/drinks apres-climb if the group decides.

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them).This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day.Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;).
results.name: Midweek Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
Is your organization designed to learn?
Lean management is not about experts providing answers, or aligning ‘resources’ to a vision. It’s about designing a system of constraints for people to ask the right questions, find purpose in their work, and be empowered to make decisions and constantly learn & improve through experimentation and failure.

”Learning organizations are organizations where people continually expand their capacity to design for the results they truly desire; where new and expansive mindsets are nurtured, where collective aspiration is set free, and where people are continually learning to see the whole together instead of optimizing for the parts.” – Peter Senge
  When people talk about the application of Lean principles to knowledge work like software, what immediately comes to mind? Perhaps “visualize your work,” using visual management systems like Kanban? Perhaps the idea of removing waste from the system to increase flow of value? While both of these are incredible powerful tools, many software companies believe that simple installing Kanban boards will move their organization forward. The reality is that it’s missing the most important aspect of the Lean (or the Toyota Production System), which is the use of A3 to create a continuously improving, learning organization.

As Jim Womack from the Lean Enterprise Institute says, "The most basic definition of an A3 would be a P-D-C-A storyboard or report. The broader notion of the A3 as a process–embodying the way of thinking represented in the format–captures the heart of lean management. In this context, an A3 document structures effective and efficient dialogue that fosters understanding followed by the opportunity for deep agreement.”

This two hour introductory workshop designed by PraxisFlow, will introduce the basics of design thinking and A3, unpacking the concepts and tools to introduce it into your organization. We’ll then integrate Edgar Schein’s notion of Humble Inquiry to teach coaching strategies for mentoring knowledge workers in its application towards designing better futures, solving problems, and removing waste from the value stream.

Benefits:

Through hands-on instruction, small group discussions and exercises, the workshop participants will:

·     Learn the basic concepts of design thinking and formats of A3s and uses of the A3 as a learning process;

·     Gain experience in the three basic roles of the A3 process (Author/Owner, Responder, Coach)

·     Learn the four types of inquiry necessary for coaching A3 at the team, function, and leadership levels of the organization

Who should attend:

·     Any leader who wishes to improve her organization

·     Any designer who wishes to lead and manage her organization more effectively

·     Lean and Agile coaches

·     Human Resources and Organizational Development professionals who wish to seek more effective means to deeply improve the thinking, behavior, alignment, and performance of their organization and the people in it

·     Senior executives who wish to improve their abilities to lead and manage

·     Anyone who wishes to improve his or her critical lean thinking

Presenter: Will Evans explores the convergence of practice and theory using Lean Systems, Design Thinking, DevOps, and LeanUX with global corporations from NYC to Berlin to Singapore. As Chief Design Officer at PraxisFlow, he works with a select group of corporate clients undergoing Lean and Agile transformations across the entire organization. Will is also the Design Thinker-in-Residence at NYU Stern's Berkley Center for Innovation and Entrepreneurship.

Will was previously the Managing Director of TLCLabs, the world's leading Lean Design Innovation consultancy where he brought LeanUX and Design Thinking to large media, finance, and healthcare companies.

Before TLC, he led experience design and research for TheLadders in New York City. He has over 15 years industry experience in design innovation, user experience strategy and research. His roles include directing UX for social network analytics & terrorism modeling at AIR Worldwide, UX Architect for social media site Gather.com, and UX Architect for travel search engine Kayak.com. He worked at Lotus/IBM where he was the senior information architect, and for Curl - a DARPA-funded MIT project when he was at the MIT Laboratory for Computer Science.

He lives in New York, NY, and drinks far too much coffee. He co-founded and co-chaired the LeanUXNYC conference, founded the LEAD SUMMIT NYC, and was also the User Experience track chair for the Agile 2013 and Agile 2014 conferences. 

Location: Spotify is on 45 W. 18th Street. That's between 6th and 5th avenues, above the Bed Bath and Beyond. We meet up on the 7th floor.
results.how_to_find_us: Between 6th and 5th avenues, above the Bed Bath and Beyond. Spotify is up on the 7th floor.
results.name: "Design Thinking the Learning Organization using Lean A3" with Will Evans

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

Join Nafisa Sharriff and the West African Dance Family for Free Classes every Monday and Wednesday evening from 6pm – 8pm at Countee Cullen/PS 194. located on 144th Street between Adam Clayton Powell and Frederick Douglas Blvds in Harlem, NY. 

Summer Hours: 5pm – 7pm (July and August only).

Nafisa Sharriff is a Master Teacher and Choreographer of Traditional West African Folklore from the Old Malian Empire. She is the recipient of the 1996 Ethnic Dance Award and numerous Community Service commemorations. Throughout her illustrious career Nafisa performed with Stevie Wonder, Whitney Houston, Spike Lee, TC Carson, C&C Music Factory, The Chuck Davis Dance Company & The Kairaba West African Dance Company. Her television credits include performances on the Richard Pryor Show, Dance Black America & Positively Black.

Who: Joel and Moshe will be the hosts of the meetup. Please find them if you need belay partners.


Where: Brooklyn Boulders 575 Degraw St, Brooklyn, NY 11217

When: We usually climb between 6pm and 9pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers try their best to be there around 5pm. If you are new, please feel free to warm up on an easy bouldering wall and find us later if you need a belay partner.

Transportation: By subway: Take the 2, 3, 4, 5, N, Q, R, B, or D to Atlantic-Pacific, transfer to the R for one stop to Union St. Walk 2 blocks north, turn left on Degraw, we are the last door on the right side of the street.

Cost/Discount: get a meetup discount if you sign up with our group which gives you $19 entrance + FREE gear rentals. You can bring your friends and they will get the same discount from us. Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount and free rentals.

How to meet us: If you need a belay partner, come find the organizer(s). Come say hi even if you don't need a partner. Sometimes we grab drinks/food apres-climb.

Notice to beginners: if you have never ever climbed or belayed before you will need to take a class - it takes place every night at 7pm. There is a nominal fee for this. What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. I usually get to the gym around 6pm, and either boulder at the entrance wall or top-rope in the main room. I post a comment what I'm wearing that day the afternoon of.

Here is the link to BKB: </a><a target="_blank"><a target="_blank"></a><a target="_blank">http://www.brooklynboulders.com</a>;;

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.

results.description:
WEBSITE : TWITTER : FACEBOOK

Every Wednesday we bring some serious board game madness to Berg'n from 6:00 PM to 11:00 PM. They like board games; we like board games... it's a match made in heaven!

Just a quick reminder not bring in outside food and to patronize any bar that hosts us. Check out bergn.com if you want to check out their food and drink menu; they have a great selection.

We usually have many more people who attend than who RSVP. We try to adjust the numbers on the Meetup to reflect that, but we err on the side of lowballing. As of Nov. 2015 we are averaging out around 25 people throughout the night though for special events we've had up to 80.

HOW MUCH IS THIS EVENT?

There's no admission fee, but there is a two drink minimum* which you will be expected to honor.

* (or monetary equivalent in non-alcoholic purchases if you don't touch the stuff.)

WHAT TYPE OF GAMES ARE PLAYED?

All types. Real short bluffing games decorated with skulls and flowers. Cooperative games fighting horrible diseases. Classic euro games where you haggle over sheep and wheat. Whether you want to fight unspeakable horrors in Arkham or build railroads across America or rebuild your farm after the black plague (more fun than it sounds) you can probably find a game you would like.

Some games you might see are 7 Wonders, Settlers of Catan, Pandemic, Dominion, Dixit, Puerto Rico, Eldritch Horror, Ticket to Ride, Carcasonne among many others. You're also welcome to bring any game you want to play!

I DON'T KNOW THESE GAMES? IS IT COOL IF I COME?

We're very friendly and if you have no idea what the hell we're talking about just trust us when we say it's ton of fun. We'll have tons of games and we're very happy to show you the rules. Hang out, haves some drinks, and learn a new game.

Questions? Comments? Contact us at [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be either in the private room or the main room. Either way look for the people playing games!

Evaluate for Change’s 6-week Introduction to Measuring Your Impact for Social Sector Professionals course is for individuals interested in learning the skills needed to become data-driven and results-oriented.

===========================================

This is a paid course. Space is limited -- be sure to purchase your ticket here: http://bit.ly/BSCEFCJan6

=========================================== 

Knowing how to effectively measure the impact of your work in the social sector enables you to powerfully tell your story to donors and stakeholders alike, as well as constantly improve the services you offer. Whether you are looking to advance your career or focus on helping your current organization become stronger, you will leave with the skills you need to measure your impact.

All 6-week courses will be conducted through hands-on activities, out-of-class assignments, and readings. Using a small class size model ensures that all students get one-on-one time with trainers. Students should expect to spend 2-3 hours each week outside of class completing readings and assignments. This course is ideal for individuals with little to no evaluation and data experience. The six-week course covers the following topics in detail:

Week 1 (Jan. 6): Understanding the Power of Data Explore the broad reasons for engaging in evaluation in order to understand the power that data can deliver to your organization. This session provides students a high-level overview of the evaluation cycle. Learn why using data-driven practices are important and leave knowing how to articulate how the social sector can leverage data to measure their impact. 

Week 2 (Jan. 13): Assessment Phase & Logic Models Dissecting programs through a critical analysis helps to articulate the core components of any initiative, including inputs, outputs, and expected outcomes – also known as conducting a Logic Model or Theory of Change.  Determine what data you already track and what data still needs to be collected for each component. Explore the complementary aspects of regular data collection, and targeted, periodic evaluation.

Week 3 (Jan. 20): Transforming Programming into Measureable Outcomes & Outputs Want to make sure your measurement tools are as efficient as possible? First, you need to make sure you are asking the right questions. In this training, we start by breaking down your program’s purpose and mission. Throughout the process we train nonprofit professionals to be strategic when designing an evaluation. Participants will leave with a set of variables/indicators to be used in a survey or interview and discuss how they could be best measured.

Week 4 (Jan. 27): Designing Measurement Tools Using a Mixed-Methods Approach Sometimes, numbers can give you a good indication of how well an organization is doing, but it’s not always the whole story. Organizations need to also support evidence of their impact with humanizing stories and real-world anecdotes of how their program changes lives. Explore the complementary aspects of quantitative and qualitative research and be ready to address your own biases!  Learn about mixed methods approaches and how to develop measurement tools that actually capture the results you are looking to measure.

Week 5 (Feb. 3): Organizing, Managing, and Analyzing Data Once you have collected your data, the next step is to take it from raw data to aggregate results. It is imperative to value the methodologies of this process over simply obtaining advanced statistical technological programs. Learning how to handle your data and manage any pitfalls that occurred during the implementation phase will help you maximize the data you have collected.  This will also mitigate the effects of any less-than-perfect implementations. Learn more advanced methodologies to help you ensure your analysis is sound and impress stakeholders. 

Week 6 (Feb. 10): Storytelling Using Data Having aggregate data of your evaluation is not enough. This session will teach you how to craft this data in a format that effectively conveys your true impact. Understanding how to present your results to a variety of audiences ensures your efforts are communicated in the best light. Learn how to take your results to the next level by analyzing your audience and customizing your data to convince all stakeholders that you are making a real impact.

https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/BX7ETbNlQjo0vlCzlzLnQ4yHqAUPLKQ8bTvsewbmHqjLLMIkHh7C6UawWUPPro7fuT1QJgkUs3k_qsDIbilLmCGNJ9nOinBQkjWf3MbCu_XFEtAFsQQOg-ktrGlyGeGKEkJ8uBg0

At Evaluate for Change, we are dedicated to shifting the social sector towards a more data-driven and results-oriented industry, all while remembering people are more than just numbers! We provide data and evaluation training exclusively to social sector professionals and organizations that are dedicated to making an impact in their community. We teach customized curriculum that leaves individuals and organizations with the skills needed to measure and prove their impact. Our model of teaching as opposed to doing, contributes to our larger mission of helping the social sector become self-sustaining. We do this by teaching the skills they need to succeed. All of our trainings are hands-on and interactive. Learn more about our unique training model here.

Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].


This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: New & Existing Member Social Networking & After Work  Party--Free Event

Come join us for a night of board gaming fun. We play all sorts of board games and card games. We tend to play more euro games so please keep that in mind. Bringing a game is not necessary, but if you have one you want to play bring it along.

Valley Stream train station is very close about three blocks.

For those who drive:

• Street parking meters are until 6pm. If you come early, W. Jamaica Ave has a free parking lot, behind the pizzeria.


We have permission from the restaurant owner to play in the restaurant on the condition that everyone consumes something. At least a soda. The restaurant also has a bakery attached with treats.

We play in the restaurant; to get there, you enter the bakery walk to the back, then make a right. There you'll find the restaurant, we are located by the front windows.

• The bakery is located across the street from Mitchell's restaurant. There is a lighted OPEN sign on the window.

• Be aware this group has an age limit, those who come to game must be adults under 40**

**Due to popular demand we will now be having a 3 no show rule. If you RSVP but can't make it please take the time to take yourself off. Our group is small and we do plan our games on how many members will be showing up. Even if you unrsvp right before we start, one of us is always checking and we appreciate the info. I'll send you a warning after the 2nd no show, but after the third I'll have to take you out of our group.

Before the lecture, refreshments (usually wine and light food) will be provided by the museum!! I have already pre-registered this group with the museum - therefore, it is not necessary for you to register with them for this event.

If people are up for it, we'll head out for a drink/bite afterwards...

Your payment for this event (a free public lecture) represents a contribution toward my Meetup Organizer fees.

Mysteries at an Exhibit: Math as Art Detective - Ingrid Daubechies

Ingrid Daubechies, Past President of the International Mathematical Union, shows the sleuthing side of mathematics as she tackles thorny questions coming out of the art world: what was underneath that Van Gogh painting?  What did this Renaissance masterpiece look like before it aged and cracked?  And most vitally, which paintings are real and which are forgeries?  Come discover how analytic image processing helps unravel these mysteries.

~Hazel

results.description:
Let us know if you are  interested in serving on the next board for the term February 1 - July 30, Sean Rivera president,Michael Maturo president-elect, Jason Weible past president

Everyone is welcome to YEP, and everyone is welcome back. 

Please review the four founding principles, requirements for leaders, 2016 schedule and leadership opportunities.  I have included below in the body of this email and attached  a pdf.

YEP is about creating new opportunities, new challenges for young at heart event professionals.  We realize none of you studied how to be a VP or Director of YEP in school,  you may have never served in a similar position. 

That's okay.  We'll help you succeed in whatever leadership position you choose if you bring your enthusiasm, are motivated, have an open mind. 

We encourage those who served as Directors in the last term to consider being a VP. 

Please provide your preference for a named position or choose a specific event to help plan or both. 

"A man's reach should exceed his grasp..." 

This has characterized the evolution of YEP from not existent just a few years ago to the most vibrant, and one of the largest,  event professional groups. Sometimes we lack a grasp on a lot of things, including reality, but we do keep reaching.

Board meetings will be the first Wednesday of the month in Manhattan, 6:30 - 8 p.m.

The interim organizational meeting will be the first Wednesday of January.

 Please register at this link in case we produce nametags.  http://yepleadership2016.eventbrite.com

We are also seeking new leaders for the Wedding Association of Manhattan for the term January 1  - December[masked], Jasmine Roberts president.  WAM meetings will be the second Wednesday of the month in Manhattan, 6:30 - 8 p.m.  Register to attend the January 13 meeting at this link  http://wamplanner2016.eventbrite.com

Best to all,

David Fletcher

YEP Co-Founder

www.youngeventpros.org

[masked]

[masked]

1. YEP! is a hybrid networking organization. At one time the co-founders were members of NY MPI, NY EPA, NY ISES, NY NACE, NY ABC, DC ISES, DC NACE, and NYC & Company. They adopted the best practices of each of those organizations to maximize the growth and effectiveness of YEP!. We welcome all suggestions and debate. It is likely that we have considered a number of policies and procedures before selecting the most appropriate for YEP!.

2. YEP! is an LLC that minimizes overhead. The purpose of YEP! is to create new leadership opportunities for event professionals, provide quality low-cost events, and help members in their careers and businesses. Because we don't have employees, or high monthly expenses, events just have to break even. Plus, there is no membership fee.

3. Everyone is welcome, everyone is welcome back and everyone is included. The most important part of genuine networking is participation, either as leaders or attendees at our events. We welcome all of our attendees to be participants at our events and on our leadership board. We find opportunities for all those who wish to serve. Our terms of leadership are only six months.

4. There are no advisory positions. Leaders either embrace an on-going responsibility or assume significant responsibility for an event. Our leaders are given a platform and a space from which they can showcase their abilities and the abilities of other sponsors and individuals. We are not limited to one event per month. We are only limited by our imagination and ability to organize.

Requirements for Board Members

1. Attendance at monthly meetings. Meetings are the first Wednesday of each month in Manhattan, 6:30 - 8 p.m. We realize leaders might have other more pressing obligations and miss a meeting on occasion. Leaders are expected to commit to attend most, arrange their schedules to accommodate this responsibility, and make YEP! a priority.

2. All board members must either serve in a defined leadership position or assume responsibility for an event.

3. Board members must be responsive to emails. We generally expect a response to all emails within 24 hours.

January 6  New Leader/Volunteer Orientation 

January 27  Kick off event

February 3  First official board meeting of new term

February 17  YEP YAK #1

February 24  Mardi Gras to end all Mardi Grazzes

March 2  Board Meeting

March 16  YEP YAK #2

March 30  Pop Up Wedding show,  combined event with WAM

April 6  Board meeting

April 20  YEP YAK #3

April 27  Eco Event

May 4  Board Meeting

May 25  General networking event ,  games

June 1  Board Meeting

June 29  Event on boat

results.description:
WHAT WE DO

Open space for artists & technologists to get hands-on with new technology. We supply a bunch of hardware and a chill environment so you can hack away.

Tweet: @hardwarehacklab at #ThoughtWorksNYC

Visit: hardwarehacklab.io

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0kxNCYpxcXM

We use creative coding environments like openFrameworks or Max/MSP to play with everything from webcams to Oculus Rift. People of all experience levels, from beginners to veterans are welcome here.

WARNING

This meetup has no particular structure. We don't have 'hack lab' projects. We work on whatever we, and you, bring in each week - which could be anything.

The schedule is loose, the feeling is social and non-judgemental. We are just curious and want to see your projects. So bring what you have and share!

ROSTER

Oculus, Kinect 1/2, Arduino, Leap, Glass, Depth video, Brain-Computer Interface, openFrameworks, SuperCollider, Max/MSP, vvvv, Processing.

DO YOU HAVE SPECIFIC NEEDS?

Some of these items are only available on request or particular occasions. Use the comments below and direct messages to find out if particular hardware or people with particular skills will be around that week.

If you can't confirm, still drop by and meet us. The lab is a great place to come and learn and meet people.
results.name: Hardware Hack Lab

----

Special Screening of Mystic Mountain. 

Join us for a tour of Sacred Spaces at 6:30 PM, before the screening. A discussion with the filmmaker follows the screening.


About the Director: Tsering Dhondup is the writer and director of Mystic Mountain. He currently lives in the United States and works as a translator of Buddhist teachings in San Jose, CA.

----


To help the museum expenses, the Rubin Museum will charge a nominal fee of $15.  I will be emailing a discount code to everyone and should bring the fee to $10.

For more details see below.  

Tickets may be purchased day of program at the Admissions desk. or contact[masked] x344 to purchase ticket or visit http://rubinmuseum.org/events/event/mystic-mountain-01-06-2016. 

Space is limited.


6:30 PM: Meets at the base of the spiral staircase

Eddie

results.description:
Tai Chi Quan, a martial arts form of ancient China, is practiced today primiary to promote health and wellness. The practice of Tai increases and uplifts energy, relieves paid and fatigue, improves balance and coordination. 

Tai Chi is right on time for young and stressful people, it is a great way to learn wisdom of Tao, meditate and enhance your health, of course reduce stress too! 

Wall Street Chinese is introducing a Medication Qigong Tai Chi group workshop to the public every Tuesday evening from[masked]pm.  This is a by donation program, we expect serious learner with suggested donation of $15-25 per time. 

About the Instructor Rengang Wang:

Born May 7, 1965 in Chao Yan City, Liaoning Province, China. Practicing martial arts since the age of seven in response to being bullied due to family’s extreme poverty and his small, sickly stature. Senior student of Hao Wei Zhi, renowned Grandmaster of Hao-style Tai Chi Mei Hua Tonglong Quan (Plum Blossom Mantis fist). Chosen as the fifth generation lineage holder by Grandmaster Hao when he became terminally ill, being the first person outside of the Hao family to carry on the line. Later studied with Wang Xuan Jie, the very famous Grandmaster who was the senior student of the founder of Dachengquan, Grandmaster Wang Xiang Zhai. Three days before his death, Wang Xuan Jie chose Rengang Wang to become the third generation lineage holder and requested to bring this style to the United States for the first time. Immigrated to the United States in 2000 and was awarded a Green Card as an Alien of Extraordinary Ability. Founded International Dachengdao the following year and travels the world teaching seminars and judging tournaments.

Some links of interest for Tai Chi

http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/21742279

http://www.mayoclinic.com/health/tai-chi/SA00087

http://www.nytimes.com/2010/09/28/health/28brody.html
results.how_to_find_us: RSVP is a must then come up to Suite 1812 Wall Street Chinese

results.description:
The Brooklyn Futurist Meetup has invited us to their event on Wednesday. Please RSVP at their link because they need to give a list of attendees to building security.

Join us January 6 when Robin Hanson previews The Age of Em. His upcoming book and research unveil a world run by robots. Not a science fiction novel, he envisions every aspect of our lives influenced by the spread of robots from the workplace and life extension to personal relationships. His insights on employment challenges are especially noteworthy. Robin will devote extra time for Q&A, due to the subject’s depth and his varied interests (as below). Doors open at 6:30pm. 

About Robin in his words: 

I am interested in all aspects of the future, including uploading, nanotech,  hypertext publishing, cosmology and the foundations of physics, future economic growth rates, limits of computation, and the origin of life. I'd love to specialize in the economics of science fiction. Some fun places to discuss such issues are the Polymath and the Extropians mailing list which I have participated in since 1991. (I especially enjoy posts by Hal Finney.) I don't sign onto "Extropianism" though; I don't sign onto any "ism". I am, however, a Alcor http://www.amazon.com/The-Age-Em-Robots-Earth/dp/0198754620

Speaking Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9qcIsjrHENU

About Robin Hanson: http://mason.gmu.edu/~rhanson/home.html#AboutMe

Web Coverage:

http://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2015/09/robin-hansons-new-book.html

http://www.overcomingbias.com/2015/03/oxford-to-publish-the-age-of-em.html

http://anglejournal.com/article/2015-06-brain-emulation-economies-the-next-stage-of-human-development/

RSVP Here. 

Admission is $5.50 online, $7 cash at door. Light snacks and refreshments included. Several tech books from our Focal Press Sponsor plus one pre-order of The Age of Em will be given away at random. 

Lead Sponsor:  Promenade Speakers Bureau
results.name: When Robots Rule The Earth – Robin Hanson, Author of The Age of Em

results.description:
Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

Join us on Wednesday nights for meditation and conversation about mindfulness. Learn how to bring mindfulness into daily life, and how to establish, maintain, and deepen a personal mindfulness practice.

Each class will consist of instruction in different forms of mindfulness meditation, and time for group discussion and connecting with the community. Depending on the week, the teacher may give a talk or share a reading about a related topic.

Check out our group guidelines.

Teacher for this night's gathering: Emily Herzlin 

Emily (also the MeetUp group organizer) is a writer, editor, and teacher. She has taught creative writing and mindfulness meditation at Columbia University, The Interdependence Project, Adelphi University, GreenspaceNYC, and Mission to (dit)Mars. Emily has been practicing mindfulness meditation for ten years, and trained in Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) through the Center for Mindfulness at UMass Medical School. She is also a graduate of the Yearlong Immersion and Teacher Training program at the Interdependence Project, where she currently teaches MBSR and a monthly contemplative writing workshop. 

Mindful Astoria

Every Wednesday, 7-8:30pm at the Astoria First Presbyterian Church.

All classes are drop-in, but RSVP. $5-$10 at the door to cover meetup dues and support the teachers and the Astoria Presbyterian Church. *Note that no one will be turned away for lack of funds. If you cannot afford the suggested donation, please give what you are able.

Email any questions to Emily Herzlin at [masked].

Looking forward to deepening practice and strengthening mindful community with you all!
results.how_to_find_us: The church is located at 23-35 Broadway, between Crescent St. and 23rd St. It is on the north side of Broadway, just past Trade Fair and Synergy Fitness. There is an awning over the front door. The church shares the space with Art House Astoria.
results.name: Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

results.description:
Have you ever tried Salsa? How about CUBAN salsa? Now is your chance to learn this exciting and fun dance! On Wednesday, January 6th, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment - also a great opportunity to practice your Spanish!

The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The January session of Cuban Salsa begins on Wednesday, 1/6!

Wednesdays (January 6th - 27th):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 1
This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner safety in an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

PRICE
-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 classes: ONLY $60 - That's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

Adelante Studios
25 W31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.


*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 15-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video links of our group doing Rueda de Casino:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class on Wednesdays at 8:30pm, immediately following the beginner class.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (January 6th - 27th):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (starting January 5th) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

Location:


Adelante Studios
25 W31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom
*Can't find our room? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.
results.how_to_find_us: Take elevators to the 2nd Floor. We have the entire studio loft space, complete with brand new, clean rooms, hardwood floors, mirrors, 12’ ceiling, A/C, & sound system.

results.description:
Men's Pick-up basketball in Hunters Point, Long Island City.

The cost is $10.75 for this session. 

Once you RSVP to a specific session, no refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before committing to that session.

It is a regulation sized court, but we divide it into two games simultaneously with each playing 4x4. We will do our best to break up the teams evenly at the outset, after which it's the luck of the draw based on who's sitting and who shoots in from the losing team. There will be a sign-up list for each court, and players from the losing team must shoot foul shots to play next, not be chosen by those already sitting.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. No fighting, rough playing, or screaming allowed. You will immediately be asked to leave the gym.

No food or alcoholic beverages allowed into the school. Save it for after the game.

All games must end by 8:45pm

From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson. Walk straight back towards the River to Center Blvd(in the direction of the city).
