that's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

LOCATION
Adelante Studios
25 West 31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor - Grand Ballroom (3,000 sq ft!)

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.
*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 16-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video link of our group doing Rueda de Casino
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class immediately following Level 1 on Wednesdays at 8:30pm.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (January 6th - 27th):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (January 5th) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

results.description:
CHECK IT OUT FOR ONLY 5 BUCKS!


Welcome To The Writer’s Room


More than just a writing class, our TV Drama workshop gives you the experience of a real writer’s room on a 1 hour TV Drama series, with a teacher with over 15 years of television experience acting as showrunner, and a class of 12 talented student staff writers.

You’ll not only complete an hour-long pilot or spec script for a TV Drama series of your choice, you’ll also collaborate on the development of your fellow students scripts for a different show each week..

What You’ll Learn

You’ll learn the elements of a successful TV Drama series, and how to write a series pilot or series spec script that shows off your talent as a writer, but also your ability to demonstrate your professionalism to every network, studio, and series producer who reads it.

By the time you’re done, you’ll not only have real world experience of working in a TV writer’s room, you’ll also a community of writers you can depend on, and a draft of a professional grade spec script or pilot episode for your own Television Series.

One-On-One Mentorship From A Teacher You Can Trust

In addition to your work in class, you’ll get a one-on-one consultation with your showrunner and teacher, Steve Molton, to discuss the unique challenges of your script and the goals for your career.

What About The Online Option?

You can be a part of our TV Writing Classes from anywhere in the world, through a live two way video stream! All you need is a computer, a headset, and a high speed internet connection. You’ll be able to see, hear and participate in everything, just like being in the room!

For more info or to set up a plan, give us a call at[masked]-3594.


---

NORMAL COST: $899

MEETUP MEMBERS:  Check out the first day of this  10-week workshop for only $5 bucks with no obligation!

Class Size is Strictly Limited To 12 Students To Allow All Students The Opportunity to Workshop And Receive Feedback On Their Writing. 

You MUST RSVP to attend this event.

You'll LOVE this workshop or your money back!
results.how_to_find_us: www.writeyourscreenplay.com

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

6-7 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
7:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
7:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
8:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going!

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: David Rubenstein Atrium, 62nd and Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Please, come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

results.description:
We'll meet at the Main Street School parking lot for a loop run to Tarrytown and back. This is a lovely "run in the dark" with Hudson River views. Total distance is just over 4 miles.

Details about the run

Route: We’ll leave promptly at 7 pm from the Main Street School parking lot. We'll head north on the Old Croton Aqueduct Trail, and turn left (west) at the Lyndhurst greenhouses to connect to the Riverwalk. At the Riverwalk we'll continue north to Van Wart Ave, before turning right (east) to return to Broadway for the run back to Irvington. A route map is available here. 

Modifications for a shorter/slower-paced run: At various points runners can divert east toward Broadway and head back to Irvington.

Water/Bag Storage: There are no water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.


Location: Main Street School parking lot (101 Main St)

Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.
results.name: Irvington to Tarrytown Loop

results.description:
You're invited to join us for this weekly opportunity to sharpen your drawing skills! This session is open to sketchers of all levels.

What makes our sessions different? 

• We start on time in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break. 

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp! 

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)


• This is a two hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.  

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 


• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels. 


• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon

results.description:
Join us January 6 when Robin Hanson previews The Age of Em. His upcoming book and research unveil a world run by robots. Not a science fiction novel, he envisions every aspect of our lives influenced by the spread of robots from the workplace and life extension to personal relationships. His insights on employment challenges are especially noteworthy. Robin will devote extra time for Q&A, due to the subject’s depth and his varied interests (as below). Doors open at 6:30pm. 

About Robin in his words:


I am interested in all aspects of the future, including uploading, nanotech,  hypertext publishing, cosmology and the foundations of physics, future economic growth rates, limits of computation, and the origin of life. I'd love to specialize in the economics of science fiction. Some fun places to discuss such issues are the Polymath and the Extropians mailing list which I have participated in since 1991. (I especially enjoy posts by Hal Finney.) I don't sign onto "Extropianism" though; I don't sign onto any "ism". I am, however, a Alcor <a>cryonics</a> customer. For a few hundred dollars a year, I estimate I'm buying a >5% chance of living for thousands of (subjective) years. 

Pre-Order The Book:  http://www.amazon.com/The-Age-Em-Robots-Earth/dp/0198754620

Speaking Video:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9qcIsjrHENU

About Robin Hanson:  http://mason.gmu.edu/~rhanson/home.html#AboutMe

Blog: 

Overcoming Bias  



Web Coverage:

http://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2015/09/robin-hansons-new-book.html

http://www.overcomingbias.com/2015/03/oxford-to-publish-the-age-of-em.html

http://anglejournal.com/article/2015-06-brain-emulation-economies-the-next-stage-of-human-development/

RSVP Here. 

Admission is $5.50 online, $7 cash at door. Light snacks and refreshments included. Several tech/business books from our Promenade Speakers and Focal Press Sponsors plus one pre-order of The Age of Em will be given away at random. 

Lead Sponsor:  Promenade Speakers Bureau
results.how_to_find_us: Downtown Brooklyn subways, walk a few blocks to State St, off Court St
results.name: When Robots Rule The Earth – Robin Hanson, Author of The Age of Em

results.description:
Valentine is a human being raised on Mars, newly returned to Earth. Among his people for the first time, he struggles to understand the prejudices of human nature.


// Book 
Stranger in a Strange Land, Robert A. Heinlein 
This is the story of Valentine Michael Smith, born during, and the only survivor of, the first manned mission to Mars. Michael is raised by Martians, and he arrives on Earth as a true innocent: he has never seen a woman and has no knowledge of Earth's cultures or religions. But he brings turmoil with him, as he is the legal heir to an enormous financial empire, not to mention de facto owner of the planet Mars. Michael explores human morality and the meanings of love. He founds his own church, preaching free love and disseminating the psychic talents taught him by the Martians. 

// Location
The Ship, 158 Lafayette St.
Join us at this nautical themed cocktail bar in Soho. 
Cocktails $14 / Wine $12 / Beer $8

// Dues 

This book club does not require annual membership dues. However, we kindly ask that attendees bring $2 cash to the event to cover Meetup fees and the occasional book giveaway! (I also accept Venmo!) 

// Next Month
Join us next month for a month of LOVE. Vote here for your choice.

results.description:
A hacknight with a New Years twist!

The New Year is a great time to take a moment to reflect on your accomplishments and make goals for going forward. Really, we can do this anytime, but it's nice to have a prescribed moment for it.

As a group of awesome coders, let's take this sliver of time to share our goals and support each other in achieving them! Whether it be learning a new language, starting a project you've always dreamed about, launching a project that's been in the works, contributing to open source, or fine tuning an existing project of yours... all goals are perfect.

See you there for an evening of coding, story sharing, and snacks!

* Women only. If you consider yourself to be a woman, we do too. 
* No recruiters.

results.description: Come to our purely positive séance where we encourage mystics, psychics, mediums and all people to enhance their spiritual awareness in a safe and empowering environment. All of our séance conductors are highly trained and renowned mediums. Whether you are looking to connect with a loved one who has recently passed or to receive messages from spirit, our group offers a warm and friendly environment to all who are interested. Before each séance we begin our group with a 15 minute lesson on psychic development, covering topics from psychic impressions to spirit communication. We then begin our séance with a nondenominational prayer of protection and lead a guided visual mediation. After the meditation each person who attends will receive a message from one of our highly trained séance conductors. All participants are guaranteed to receive a message. Our group meets for approximately 2 hours. The purpose of our séance is to communicate directly with spirit and to form an open and inviting spiritual community in New York City Our meeting times are every other Wednesday Night at 7:00pm and our fee is $20. Please be timely, because we do not open our doors once we begin our meditation (for obvious reasons :). For legal purposes it is understood that our group and the messages given at our séances are for entertainment purposes only.
results.name: Seance in The City Meetup

results.description:
Find more energy and Peace in the new year! Join us for a group meditation!

If you are looking to introduce meditation in your life or meditate with a group, join us for this free one hour session. You will get to learn how you can be happy and peaceful through breath & meditation.


The workshop also offers a preview of a longer workshop called The Happiness program.

The Happiness Program teaches several practical and powerful tools to help you discover your unlimited power and freedom - not as a concept, but as a direct experience. You will discover that you can be happy, whatever the situation, and live a deeply fulfilling life.


Start your new year on a positive note. Join us for meditation!


More @ Behappymc.org

results.name: Start the New year with Peace, Energy & Meditation!

results.description:
Algorithms are everywhere. From taking an elevator to your office to making music, we use algorithms every day to solve problems. Developers routinely use algorithms to solve programming issues such as:

How will I keep this credit card information secure when I send it?

How can I store this data so I can retrieve it quickly?

How do I make this file smaller so it is easier to share?

In this workshop, we will discuss what an algorithm is, introduce the idea of algorithmic complexity (big O notation), demonstrate sort and search algorithms (with a hands-on demonstrations), and finish with an overview of the many types of algorithms out there.

As a prerequisite, you should have basic familiarity with a programming language (like by having attended our intro to JavaScript workshop or know a back-end language). Not sure if you qualify? <a>Email us.</a>

If you'd like to attend but cannot afford the cost, please request a GDI scholarship.


About your instructor: 

Steph Zhang is a developer at BuzzFeed.
results.name: Intro to Algorithms

results.description:
Wednesdays, 7-8:30pm
1/6 - 2/10/16 

This six-week course, taught by IDP’s Executive Director, Kimberly Brown, combines western psychological techniques with traditional practices and instructions to develop our limitless capacity for beneficial and wise action. 

Though we often regard love and compassion as limited qualities, of which we hardly have enough to extend to ourselves and our families, these states can be developed and expanded with practice and effort. In fact, each of us has a boundless capacity for kindness and understanding, which we can apply to all of our relationships -- to ourselves, our family and friends, people we don’t know, and even those we don’t like. 

With this unique offering, we’ll challenge our preconceptions about our limitations, learn to use gentleness to become aware of inherent biases, understand obstacles of guilt and shame, and uncover our true nature of lovingness and receptivity. 

Please visit http://theidproject.org/events/2016/01/06/creating-compassionate-world-nyc-online for details and registration. Please note that this space is not wheelchair accessible and can only be accessed by climbing two steep flights of stairs.
results.name: Creating a Compassionate World (Paid)

results.description:
D&D Encounters is an episodic-format event designed to allow new players to join in and learn D&D in a casual, pick-up game. Seasoned players with erratic schedules can easily hop in and out of Encounters; unlike a traditional campaign, DMs and players will rotate, resulting in a dynamic game experience. We are using the latest edition of D&D (5e) and each session lasts about 3-4 hours, easily fitting into your work or school schedule, and presents a new and exciting challenge each week. The $10 fee covers your use of the playspace, though committing to 10 weeks grants the player a discount.


We're always on the lookout for DM talent for this season-- volunteers keep programs like this one alive! However, more important than veteran DMs, Encounters is a place where even new players should feel comfortable testing out the DMing waters. Every Saturday we provide our DMs with that week's "adventure chunk", a set of 2-3 encounters in one simple, easy-to-read packet. This bite-sized DMing format is ideal for new DMs and veterans who don't have the time to create an entire campaign from scratch, and allow lots of room for alterations and improvisations as the DM sees fit. DMs who volunteer their time do not pay the $10 fee, and receive a steep discount on our D&D related products.


For our first session, we will be creating level 1 characters and running a brief "test run" of our new adventurers as they get their footing the world of the Forgotten Realms. It won't be long before we're on the road to great deeds, so you won't want to miss this great opportunity to get to know your fellow heroes!

Please private message Timm with any questions regarding DMing, the event, or anything else RPG related!
results.name: Brooklyn Strategist Presents: D&D Encounters, Rage of Demons

results.description:
What does a vision board do for you and how does it help you get you closer to your desired manifestations?

A vision board is a tool used to help clarify, concentrate and maintain focus on a specific life goal. It can be for one goal or a number of goals. Literally, a vision board is any sort of board (or box) on which you display images, quotes or sayings that represent whatever you want to be, do or have in your life.

Lets put together what we want for 2016!

Materials

Please bring the following materials with you: poster board, or small box, glue sticks, tape and scissors. (Please note that LOA Meetup will be not be supplying any of the suggested materials).

In addition, please bring your own magazines, newspapers, flyers, brochures, articles, or anything that will provide you with images, phrases, quotes and words that resonate positively with you and make you feel good. Choose items that bring vitality, sensuality, pleasure, success, achievement and excitement to your spirit.

$5.00 per person.

In case of inclement weather, an email will by sent to members by 5pm if a cancellation occurs.
results.name: YOUR VISION BOARD for 2016!

results.description:
A PRESENTATION BY THE NASSAU COUNTY FEDERATION OF REPUBLICAN WOMEN

Come hear Phil Haney speak on January 6, 2016 about his efforts to expose terrorist within the United States, and how his initiative was eventually shut down by administration officials.

A founding member of Department of Homeland Security, Phil Haney, began profiling individuals with links to Pakistani extremist groups in the early 2000s. This work grew into his intimate and detailed knowledge of a web of terrorist training efforts as well as the existence of some of the most hateful and extremist mosques in existence.

Because of his research and extensive insight into worldwide terrorist initiatives,

Phil Haney was able to compile an extensive database of information on terrorists and their worldwide efforts. He is personally responsible for identifying more than 300 suspected terrorists.

On January 6, Phil will explain how his efforts could potentially have prevented the San Bernardino attacks had he been allowed to continue his work. We will discuss how we can potentially harness his body of work to protect America moving forward. This is a presentation you do not want to miss.

You must RSVP to reserve a seat. Either email Rosemary Serra at [masked] or call her at:[masked]

Our Distinguished Host for the Evening:

results.description:
Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10 pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

*A listing of contests and magazines to submit to can be found on our Discussions page

See you there,
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

results.description:
Come join us for our climbing Meetup!!

As usual, everyone is welcome to join in on the fun as long as you're at least 18 years old, whether you’re a complete beginner just looking to give the sport a try or a seasoned veteran that can show the best of us a few new tricks. Bring your friends too, even if they've never tried climbing before. We'll make sure everybody is set up and having a blast. Age and strength don't even matter, everybody has fun.

1st time climbers at The Rock Club get in for FREE! All you have to do is rent a harness and shoes for $10.25. Returning Meetupers get a discounted daypass rate of $15. And be sure to have a look out at the gym for other special Meetup discounts.

We also host a special Meetup 101 class from 7:30 - 9pm for Meetup members only. When multiple people sign-up for the class you pay only $45 ($15 discount!).

Reserve your spot with the booking button and enter the promo code "Meetup" on the booking page.

IMPORTANT!!  This offer has restrictions. It is only valid for the Weds night Meetup 101 class, you must already be a meetup member and RSVP for the meetup as well (no guests).

</a>

<a href="http://bookeo.com/climbrockclub?type=2126XUFJR1387C98D3A8">

If this is your first time climbing just come on in and join the group. There’s no need to take the class just yet. You’ll be able to join other Meetup members who already have their belay certification. This way you’ll be able to get up and on the wall right away! When you decide that you absolutely love climbing (which you will!), then you can sign up for the class the following week.

As a heads up, when you come into the gym, the front desk staff will get you set up with gear and get you in the system. There will also be name tags for everyone. Wear them with pride so everyone knows who’s a part of Meetup!

DETAILS - Please read carefully!

RSVPing and Questions:
If you're attending the belay course you MUST call TRC to reserve your space.
If you have any questions, please email TRC directly: [url][masked][/url]

Time:
The closer to 7pm you arrive, the better. The 101 class starts at 7:30 sharp.

Directions & Transportation:
Please save time and aggravation by getting directions from our website (BEFORE you call or email us for directions :-). If you're coming on Metro North as a group (2 or more people!) we'll pick you up from the train station. Use the message baord to connect with other riders.  Just give us a call to let us know when you'll arrive. Go to the taxi stand in front of the station building!

We're looking forward to seeing you soon!
results.name: Weekly Climbing Meetup - New members climb for free!!

venue.name: Central Park: NE corner of Columbus Circle by the big statue!

results.description:
Wednesday Runs in Central Park!

On hump day, we own the pavement. Going forward, we'll meet on Wednesdays at 7:30PM at the southwest corner of Central Park. We'll start with a brief stretch and share, and then we'll embark on either the 3-mile or 6-mile loop.

This running group is for everyone in the innovation/startup community, but we don't discriminate. We're open to all runners and professions. Please RSVP when you know you'll be able to meet.

After our runs we'll relax at a nice nearby pub to discuss how we're going to fix the world's problems.

Clarification on the meeting spot: We'll meet at the northeast corner of Columbus Circle. This is the same as the southwest corner of Central Park. We'll meet right next to the big statue that is next to the entrance to the park trail. Just be precise, we'll meet at the immediate west of said big statue.

See you soon!

Alex
results.how_to_find_us: SW corner of Central Park on the west side of the large stature (Not the Columbus Statue in the middle of the circle) Cross streets: NE corner of Central Park West and 59th St.
results.name: Wednesday Runs in Central Park

results.description:
This is a casual in-store wine tasting event, usually on the 1st Wednesday of every month, featuring a selection of 3 wines and light refreshments.

Join the Sipper's Delight Wine Tasting Social Club at The Artisan Collective for wine sipping and socializing in a fun and unpretentious environment. Each month we will taste and discuss three new wines. This event is a great way to develop your wine tasting skills, learn about different wines and meet other wine enthusiasts!

Admission: $10

Directions: NJ Transit to Newark Penn Station or Broad Street Station.

From Newark Penn Station: Take the Light Rail to NJ PAC/Center Street and walk approximately 2 blocks West to the corner of Central & Halsey Street (cross Broad Street). Turn left onto Halsey and walk to the Artisan Collective, located at 25 Halsey Street.

From Broad Street: Take the Light Rail to Washington Park. Turn right onto Washington Street, then left onto Halsey Street. Walk 1.5 blocks South on Halsey Street (cross Central Ave) to the Artisan Collective, located at 25 Halsey Street.
results.name: Wine Tasting Wednesdays

Sign up at playerslounge.co


You spot will only be reserved if you sign up on our website!


Tournament Format: Team Packages. You pay extra for better teams!


$5 - 4 Star Teams and Below

$10 - 4 1/2 Star Teams

$20 - 5 Star Teams


Event Location:

Alligator Lounge

600 Metropolitan Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11211


Tournament Details:

FREE BEER AND PIZZA!

Age restrictions: 21+

Arrive at 7:30 PM. 

Event will end by approximately 11:30pm - but it depends on how far you go!

Double elimination - you have to lose twice to be out!

Games are played on Xbox One consoles


Prizes:

1st Place - $100

2nd Place - $50

3rd Place - Assassin's Creed Black Flag & Unity - Xbox One

Raffles:

Free tournament entries to upcoming Players' Lounge Events


Game Rules:

5 Minute Halves.

Club Teams Only

Legendary Difficulty

Injuries Off

Games tied after 90 minutes, overtime is played under golden goal stipulation.

Games tied after 120 minutes will be restarted and played under a golden goal stipulation. If still tied after 120 minutes in the second game, PKs decide winner.


Questions? Visit our FAQ or email [masked]

results.description: Our chorus has 50+ members that sing four-part harmony a cappella music.  We have a ton of fun while working hard on singing at a high level.  If you are a woman who likes to sing and think you might have interest in joining our group, come on down!  We would love to meet you and sing for you (and with you!).  We rehearse every Wednesday night beginning at 7:30pm.
results.name: Woman's Acappella Chorus Rehearsal

results.description:
Come rehearsal with us at our regular location, the Music Conservatory of Westchester! No need to prepare, just show up with your instrument and get ready to play. We have around 30-40 people at most rehearsals (most members are not on the Meetup page) so don't worry, you will have a full orchestra to play with.

RSVP on Meetup to let us know you're coming, or email [masked].

Parking: The Conservatory asks that orchestra musicians *not* park in the Conservatory parking lot unless you are a tuition paying student of either the Conservatory of the Steffi Nossen School of Dance. Street parking is free after 6pm, and there is a large municipal lot across Central Ave from City Limits (24hr meters in the lot).

The first rehearsal is free. Subsequent rehearsals are $10/rehearsal or a discounted annual rate.
results.name: Rehearse with the New Westchester Symphony Orchestra

results.description:
Let's play Crokinole on Wednesday nights!


Don't know Crokinole? It's like a table-top version of curling, shuffleboard, darts and billiards. If you like just one of these games, you'll probably dig Crokinole.

To learn more about this traditional Canadian game (circa 1860) and about our specific weekly sessions at Milk and Roses, then read the papers!


We've been in a few rags lately, and the best-written article is this one... from the Toronto Star: http://www.thestar.com/news/insight/2015/07/26/crokinole-gains-a-following-in-brooklyn-thanks-to-canadian-expat.html

Same place as usual: Milk and Roses (1110 Manhattan Ave in Greenpoint, between Dupont and Clay).

Same time as usual: 7:30pm 'till close.

Please RSVP if you'd like to join in! If I know how many people are coming, then I can be sure to have enough boards present and polished for plenty of playing time for all :)
results.name: Wed Night Crokinole!

results.description:
We will begin our evening by creating and energizing a Reiki Grid using the Antahkarana symbol and crystals. Bring your crystals and create a grid formation that will assist your intention.

We will continue the evening with a relaxing and healing Reiki share. 

A Reiki Grid uses crystals in combination with Reiki to send powerful energy to a situation or event that you want to infuse with positive and healing energy. The crystals act as a transmitter and amplifier of the Reiki energy.

A Reiki Crystal Grid can be created and charged with Reiki which will continue to send Reiki to heal, protect or manifest a goal for 48 hours or longer after it is charged.
results.name: Creating and Energizing Crystal Grids

Meet 10-30 other "single and fabulous" women in their 30s and 40s at our "speed" networking event over drink specials. My predictions is that you'll hit it off and leave with more numbers than any other singles event you've been to.

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

results.description:
Inward Bound: Life as a Spiritual Adventure

When things like work, family, wealth or relationships fail to deliver satisfaction, or leave us filled with uncertainty and pain, it is time to seek happiness from a different source.  Meditation can help us discover stillness within and reconnect with our deeper goals.  By learning to meditate on the stages of the path to enlightenment, our life becomes an inner expedition to greater meaning, fulfillment and purpose.

$15.00 Suggested donation. No one turned away for lack of funds.
results.how_to_find_us: Meditatenj.org
results.name: Inward Bound: Life as a Spiritual Adventure

results.description:
Join us, as we explore the basis of Meditation & Self-knowledge, Mysticism, Kabbalah, Esotericism, Astral Projection, Sacred Sexuality, Alchemy, and the mysteries of The human Consciousness.

Every Wednesday Night at 7:30pm. (Rsvp required)

Topics to study:


- Introduction to Gnosis: The term "Gnosis" & it's foundations; Science, Philosophy, Art and Mysticism.

- Foundations of Gnostic Psychology: The Consciousness, The Personality & the Ego. The Human Machine & the 3 Brains. The human mind & the Universal Mind.

- The Awakening of the Consciousness: Mindfulness, Self-observation & The fourth dimension. Lucid Dreams & The Astral World.

- Universal Laws and the Ray of Death: Return, Recurrence, and Reincarnation. Law of Karma and Dharma. The Mysteries of Life and Death. Evolution, Involution, and Revolution.

*** Guided Meditation for beginners and intermediate levels after every lecture***

"The mission of Gnosticism in this age is provide the methods and tools to rescue the highest values of the human being in order to pursue transcendence and the self-realization of the Being." Samael Aun Weor

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?


We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p.  

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact [masked]

Can't make this one?  visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: TurnON New York City

results.description:
This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners) taught every Wednesday from 8-10pm.  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  The class will be capped at 14 students to make sure that you have sufficient time to be on your feet.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.  

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

results.description:
Goals are important for creating positive changes, and the beginning of the year is a great time as it gives you an extra boost of energy to get started.

The problem is that resolutions usually focus on a symptom disguised as a problem. It's not the weight. Or being single. Or a lack of money. Or procrastination.
These are only signs that there is something behind the scenes interfering with your best interest.

Join me for a complimentary call to help you step into 2016 with your best foot forward!

I will guide you to:

•  Discover what needs your immediate attention.

•  Find what is specifically getting in the way of change.

•  Start taking steps to get on track for making 2016 happier and more fulfilling!


Sign up here.  You will receive email instructions on how to connect to the call.
results.how_to_find_us: You will receive instructions when you sign up.
results.name: Before the Resolution ~ Complimentary Call

results.description:
This will be the last Island Labs meeting before HRU. (Ham Radio University)


http://hamradiouniversity.org/


We're not giving any talks there this year but I'll be standing at the front of the room for the WiFi Mesh talk, in support of John Wilson. (of Nassau ARES)

We might pull out the old slide deck from when we did last year's Mesh talk.

It would be good to go over the equation for predicting signal strength at a given range. (and therefore the range of a wifi setup)

At the last meeting,  Jim setup his 18-core parallella and ssh'ed into it for the first time. and... there was a "Raspberry Pi" fight. (wrestling for control of an unsecured Pi)

Conversation included:

James' Arduino display is I2C (not RS-232) leaving some "room for improvement" re: being used as an arduino's serial monitor.

Making an Embossing Seal (for marking official documents)

Aluminum foundries: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lSoWxG30rb0

induction levitation furnaces: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q6Zrnv4OtbU

Human Powered Ornithopters: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DmzEKRSlA2k

Why do (Why would) galaxies take the form of a spiral? (also addressed by tech-net that Sunday)
What happens when galaxies collide? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MjRJeaNtxN4

How eliptical are the planet's orbits? https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Equation_of_time


Thickness of earth's crust

Harnessing the energy of Earth's rotation.
Natural coal fires (currently thousands, representing 3% of the worlds CO2 emissions?)
results.name: Prepare for Ham Radio University

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

[masked]

New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street


East Coast Swing/Jitterbug with  Spencer Weisbond

This six week, progressive session: Nov 11, 2015-Jan 06, 2016
Wed
8:30PM - 9:30PM
# of Sessions: 6
Except:
November 25
December 23
December 30

  101: Beginner   Learn cool moves to classic tunes! This progressive, basic swing dance class will teach the absolute beginner how to Jitterbug or what is now known as East Coast Swing. For young adults and above, this partner dance class will teach beginner moves in swing and the technique to execute them properly. The class will learn a routine over a six week period. No partner, experience, or TALENT required.

    

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]

  Register and pricing below:

  http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/PersonifyEBusiness/Default.aspx?TabID=416&pid=634127394


Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3300 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. www.SwingRemix.com </a>

Time to get READY to TAKE CONTROL of YOUR LIFE and stop letting your life take control of you. YOU KNOW that you’re supposed to be apart of something GREATER. You wake up every morning thinking ‘this can’t be my life’, or ‘my life sucks’. Yes it does, but it doesn’t have to stay that way. You can make the decision now to change your life and start living like you’ve dreamt, so you would with the help of earning while learning and doing real estate investing with a community.

This coming Thursday we are having a LOCAL Real Estate Investors Meeting in our office. You will have the opportunity to:

*Network with a group of successful Real Estate Investors.

*Learn how to fire your boss in the next 6 months.
*Find out how you can EARN 1-10K while you learn Real Estate Investing.
*Learn how to build MASSIVE wealth with strategies such as Fix and Flips and passive wealth with rental properties.
*Learn how to pay your current debts off faster.

results.description:
Aside from our League play we offer Open Play 6 days a week. 1 hour and 45 minute sessions only $11 midweek.

Format: 3 teams of 5 per court. Score by 1’s. Games to 7. Winner stays but must sit after 2 games. No refs. Call your own. Our moderator will help things along. All players must bring a white and a dark shirt (not grey). This is a friendly run. Anyone with the wrong attitude will not be allowed back. Age: 21+

Our open runs are designed for good fun and a run. The A / B breakdown is purely a self rating device to try and split things up in an enjoyable manner. Think of it as if you were going to the park to play. If you are average or above go to the A court. If you are average or below go to B.  It is not exact. There is always going to be some crossover.  

***Please note- RSVP'g on Meetup will not reserve your spot. Please go to our website to sign up.*** A credit card payment is required to reserve your space. Just click the session that interests you.


http://nyurban.com/open-play-basketball/

We will send you a confirmation email. Show up at the Gym with I.D. We will have you on our list but please bring your receipt. No payment at the door.

results.description:
Hey let's get together this Wednesday to have some great laughs with some of NYC's best comedians. We always have a good hang before and after the show. QED has a great beer & wine selection and on this night, some pretty heavy hitters in the comedy scene. First of all, Duo standup is when two comics perform stand-up comedy together. The show is a combination of regular standup, two person improv and those old 2 person sketches of the vaudeville days.

Headlining the January Duo Show are Joe List (Comedy Central Half Hour) and Mark Normand (Conan). Joe and Mark have a podcast called Tuesdays with Stories.

Also Featuring:
Amber Nelson (Comedy Central/Montreal Just for Laughs) and a Mystery Partner)
Tim Dillon (Gotham live) and Ray Kump (Funny or Die)
Jonathan Mcbride (Don't Grow up Comedy Show) and May Wilkerson (Cake or Death)
Ian Hunt and Matt Leary (Good for You at the Cantina Royal)
And also your Producers: FreddyG (Sirius) and Patrick Holbert (Cake or Death)

Hosted by: FreddyG

Lineups subject to change.

Come at 8:30 if you can! Get a good seat, have a drink, and get to know some other Astorians!

results.description:
Positive Connections for Success is a more relaxed and personal networking group for business professionals looking to build relationships and grow their business through referrals.

We focus on:

• Networking: Building relationships and earning each others trust to become referral partners

• Education: Understanding your business and helping you articulate your business

• Leadership: Leaders of the round table philosophy, every member is a leader of this group

We follow a structured meeting agenda starting with networking to develop relationships, giving us time to talk and get to know each other while having a warm breakfast, followed by:

• One Minute Elevator Pitch

• Business Presentations with Q&A and feedback (we have a large screen & clicker/pointer available for powerpoint presentations)

• Brainstorming Session, Successes & Referrals to Help Each Others Businesses grow

• Lots of Fun in the Process

"We Refer Business Partners, Not Business Cards!"

This is a group with category/specialty specific members (only one member per category/speciality).
Please view our sponsors page or contact us to verify your industry, category and specialty, before attending a meeting so as to not be in conflict with a group member.

We meet every Thursday morning from 7:00 AM to 8:30 AM and welcome guests to come and experience the group and then apply to join.

Non-members/guests pay a $10 fee to attend, which includes a warm served breakfast of their choosing and we ask to please be prepared with a one minute elevator pitch presenting:

• who you are

• type of business

• who would be a good referral for you


Current positions that we are interviewing, to build relationships with and pass referrals to include:

• Attorney

• Mortgage Broker

• Realtor

• Electrician

• Landscaper

• Limo or car service

• Painter

• Plumber

• And more...

Please contact us for information or if you have any questions.

We look forward to seeing you at our next meetup!

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.

results.description:
Simple, Powerful Portraits with One Light

As portrait photographers, we find or create light to help tell the story of our subject. Classic portraits commonly use 3 point lighting and while this is great, often times a simple one light set-up can tell the story just as well. Join Daniel Norton On Set as he shows you why sometimes simple is better. Learning to master a single light set-up is useful for shooting on location, where you don't have the time or space for a full set-up.

We will explore both studio style images and environmental portraits where you work with the light in your location and add a single key light to control color and quality on your subject.

Learn: How one light can act as 3 with a little creative placement.

Learn: Various go-to modifiers for the one light portrait shooter.

Learn: Techniques for both Speedlight and Large flash portraiture.

There will be three sessions, each covering different modifiers. Sign up for one or all 12pm, 2pm and 4pm

Biography:

http://www.adorama.com/alc/sites/default/files/styles/bio_image/public/DanielNorton_HEAD.jpg?itok=_Trb87cX

Daniel Norton is a photographer, director and DP with over 15 years experience in the advertising and editorial markets. As Senior Lighting Consultant and Trainer for Adorama Pro, Daniel can help you with any questions you might have about lighting, studio and production. Daniel also produces and hosts FREE weekly in-store trainings every Thursday as well as the AdoramaTV series OnSet with Daniel Norton.

To see more of Daniel's work, go to: dnphoto.com
results.name: FREE Demo! OnSet Day: Create Stunning Portraits with One Light

results.description:
Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

"That was absolutely amazing! I don't think I have ever fully let go and quieted my mind like that before. I feel so inspired. By the end of the session I was filled with so much love - love for myself, for others, and love coming from Source. Unconditional, pure love. Thank you." C.L.

results.description:
We begin our walk  by discovering various areas of Grand Central Terminal. We will end up back at Grand Central Terminal and Why? There is a FREE Jazz concert with "The Ebony Hillbillies" at the concourse starting at 6PM. Then, whoever wants to can join me for the concert. In fact, I scheduled this meet up so that you  can either enjoy the FREE concert,  or visit a nice neighboring  museum when it is pay-as-you-wish night… 
This tour is 90% indoors as we only go outside to view the beautiful exteriors of GCT,Chrysler building  and other surrounding buildings so you  can take some amazing pictures while I point out some not-so-obvious spots ...

Please note  there $15 MeetUp Member charge per person for this special tour. This tour's value is actually $250 (for 10 people) as that is my charge for most of my private tours. Kindly provide me with exact payment at the venue. Discount Pricing of $12 is offered for Seniors  (62 yrs and older) and students (up to 22 yrs old).

Also, you can join the meet up I am the founder of by clicking on this link:

http://www.meetup.com/Artful-Fun-Interactive-NYC-Area-Fact-Finding-Walkers/

See you soon,

         Thank you,

Cindy Ladopoulos- www.NYCindyTours.com
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet in the main hall by the clock on the side that faces the escalators

results.description:
This group isn't your typical 'networking' event:  Our focus is helping each other grow our businesses through mastermind/brainstorming.  We are building business through building relationships with each other, so we can help each other succeed.

Here is an example of a typical Mastermind:

5:30pm – Open mix and mingle (15 minutes)

5:45-6:30pm – Group business needs requests/Mastermind (45 minutes)

6:30-7:00pm – Connection exchange (30 minutes – or longer, as space availability allows)

It's a 'smallish' event with between 4-12 in attendance, so we have the time and environment to get to know each other.  Plus, it's relaxed and enjoyable, so join us!

Attendance costs $5 - you can pay here in Meetup when registering - or pay at the door.  We ask that you RSVP in advance, as we don't want to turn anyone away due to our space constraints.

Please take a moment to read "About us" at the top left so you get to know what we're all about before you RSVP.
results.how_to_find_us: Park in the dedicated parking lot in the back of the building, off of Cook Ave., then walk to the front of the building and come in the lobby door.
results.name: Monthly Mastermind

results.description: Our first cigar meet of the year will be at Club Macanudo as we celebrate another new year and what better way as we come together for another smokeful evening. Club Macanudo is considered the Rolls Royce of the free cigar lounges in NYC. This is very stylish with a bar & lounge in the front room & a dining room in the back. They do have a very selective cigar menu but it is very pricey. I do suggest to bring your own cigars. There is a cutting fee and the price depends on where you are seated. This is a fantastic place which we have used many times with large turnouts. Please be aware that they do check dress attire here and will not let you enter if they feel you don't make the standards. I suggest : no jeans, no sneakers ,button down shirts for men & just look neat. They do have a reaturant menu here where you can eat at the bar, lounge or dining room. If you plan to sit anywhere but the bar, make sure you asked for any minimum or cover chargers at the tables so you are aware of any fees. Want to get a good start for 2016? Just join us this evening for good smokes,drinks and great company!
Let's get together to bring in the new year with excitement and joy!!!!

(This session is currently capped at 8 players with all spots filled. If you have a interest in playing let me know and I may be able to get a second group going.)
In the bitter cold of a land mired in eternal winter, hunters take the shape of wolves to better kill their prey. They stalk the snow-filled forests on paws of deadly silence. Powerful and swift, these evil shape-changers roam the land at will, murdering those who oppose them and plundering the weak. At the head of this pack paces the great Black Wolf of the wood. Are you clever enough to survive against villains who are stronger, faster, and fiercer than any you have ever encountered? The Black Wolf awaits your answer in the biting cold....
More info can be found here at http://njdnd.boards.net/

results.description:
Raising capital is difficult, complicated, frustrating and often will lead to failure. The tools and techniques you will acquire in this workshop may put you on the path to succeed! This workshop will discuss the process of raising money, from the early development stage of financing to getting funds from investors.

Choosing a path to follow can be overwhelming. Facing the risks, costs and effort involved with raising capital, may make you hesitate to take the leap. 

What type of financing is best for your business?Where do you start looking?Who will provide the money?What  do you need to have to satisfy an investor?

Some of the topics include: Getting ready for funding, What investors look for in companies. Types of fundings: Venture Capital, Angels, Startup Financing, Microloans, Bank Loans, SBA, Royalty Financing, Grants, Initial Public Offering, SBIC and Crowdfunding. 

Some of the techniques are: Do's and Don'ts when pitching investors, What VC’s and Angels expect to know about your business, Overcoming common obstacles, How to convince Investors. 

Do NOT miss this workshop designed to give you access to an unprecedented amount of knowledge and insights shared by Roger Kuperways, Ph.D., an industry insider, life-long entrepreneur, investor, mentor and business coach -- He built a multi-million dollar empire from scratch and has many years of experience in a variety of businesses and industries. He also lectures at trade shows and corporate events on Business issues. The workshop is based on lectures given by Dr. Kuperways at New York University for more than 25 years.


Do NOT miss this workshop designed to give you access to an unprecedented amount of knowledge and insights shared by Roger Kuperways, Ph.D., an industry insider, life-long entrepreneur, investor, mentor, business coach and adjunct professor of entrepreneurship -- He built a multi-million dollar empire from scratch and has many years of experience in a variety of businesses and industries. He also lectures at trade shows and corporate events on Business issues. The workshop is based on lectures given by Dr. Kuperways at New York University for more than 25 years.

WORKSHOP CAPACITY IS 20 PEOPLE 

============================== 

MUST PREPAY FOR RSVP TO BE VALID!
Prepaid registration: $75.00
$100 cash at the door, without a ticket (if not sold out)

Click here to purchase your ticket
https://raisemoney1-7.eventbrite.com

Remember to bring your ticket. 

Our past workshops have all sold out so don't wait! 

Please note that it is essential to have a business plan before approaching any investors. Dr. Kuperways will be leading a workshop “Essentials for Creating Your Own Business Plan” on January 19, 2016.

============================== 

COMMENTS FROM RECENT EVENTS:

I very much enjoyed the workshop. I think you gave a very simple and clear overview of what one needs to do when venturing into a start-up. The side benefit, of course, is the input from those attending. You never know what unexpected tips you might get!  Thank you for giving your time to do this.  -- JB Manton

Loved this meetup! Definitely appreciated all of the members' different insight on each other's ideas. Very informative class. Dr. Kuperways was engaging and funny, and I even came out of this meetup with a new venture idea :) Looking forward to seeing the members in another meetup. -- Paloma Garcia

I just wanted to say thanks for throwing such a great networking shindig. -- Marc Rosenberg

Hello Roger. Thank you for a very interesting meeting.  The environment and the participants were very welcoming. Lots of good topics, insights, experiences shared. It was really great. Of course I look forward to attending the next meetup. -- Lucy Torres

I very much enjoyed the workshop and would be interested in attending the one regarding creating a business plan.

Thanks so much. -- JB Manton

I thought you handled the group well last evening. I liked your equation about when you can quit your job. I didn't do that this time, and paying the price. -- Tom Graham

Hi Professor,  It was a pleasure meeting you this evening and I really enjoyed the meetup. I'm just starting out in the NYC startup ecosystem -- Suzanne Sinatra

Thank you for your invitation to attend this evenings meeting

As usual it was very interesting and I gleaned some valuable insights as well as meeting some great people

Please let me know of any other meetings you have planned -- Fay Julia Meyer

Awesome! -- GabiLovve

Thank you for a very informative session tonight! Lots of good topics discussed and I look forward to attending this Thursday’s  meetup! -- Eddie Gomez

A knowledgeable host and curious participants and a very welcoming environment ! -- Ify E

“ This Meetup was sooooo informative. I walked away with a lot of tips, information and was able to network with other interesting participants. Looking forward to the August 12th Meetup for more of the same!! ” -- Linda Dixon

The startup meeting, I thought was great! Guidance - tips - references - take action - exercises - general layout of meeting -  jam packed full of great concepts --- Aideen Sinnott

============================== 

VOLUNTEERING: As always, with such big events, we will need extra hands. Anyone that would like to assist us with registration, please email me. 

============================== 

SPAM: Please don't spam our members with your products/services or company name/website because your message will be deleted and you will be banned from this group

==============================

We provide furnished, equipped, and staffed Manhattan office space featuring amenities and services to support your business in vibrant Midtown New York. NYC Office Suites is committed to delivering service excellence and flexible office contract terms. Our contracts carry a term length of as little as 3 months. Our flexibility allows companies to match their New York office requirements with their professional needs.

We offer many New York office space sublease configurations, including executive offices, multi-person offices, coworking, shared office space for rent, flexible workspace, team / project offices and cubicles.

He also lectures at trade shows and corporate events on Business issues. The workshop is based on lectures given by Dr. Kuperways at New York University for more than 25 years.

Hello Roger. Thank you for a very interesting meeting.  The environment and the participants were very welcoming. Lots of good topics, insights, experiences shared. It was really great. Of course I look forward to attending the next meetup. -- Lucy Torres

I very much enjoyed the workshop and would be interested in attending the one regarding creating a business plan.

Thanks so much. -- JB Manton

I thought you handled the group well last evening. I liked your equation about when you can quit your job. I didn't do that this time, and paying the price. -- Tom Graham

Hi Professor,  It was a pleasure meeting you this evening and I really enjoyed the meetup. I'm just starting out in the NYC startup ecosystem -- Suzanne Sinatra

results.description:
This group offers support for men and women who are 50+ and thinking of separating and divorcing or are already in the midst of a divorce or are dealing with post-divorce.  Every phase of life brings different issues and questions and all people do not fit into a one-size-fits-all mold.


If you are considering (or are in the midst of) a divorce after the age of 50, your concerns are different, as are your potential risks and possible mistakes and so here's a group created just for you.   Life has given us a different perspective than when we were younger and you know that no one can be an expert on every topic but you learn to get the information needed when it is required.  This group is here to make that information-gathering process easier and it will also be a comfortable place get all your legal questions answered and meet some other people going through a similar situation at the same time as you.

Some of the issues that will be discussed that may be unique to our phase of life are pensions, retirements, maintenance, social security, the adult children, maybe there are grandchildren and the house.  We hope you will join the next group meeting.

This group is combined with the Separation and Divorce Legal Group to increase the likelihood of group support and we also try to promote it via calendar of events in the community. As this group grows, we will separate the groups -- this way works best for now.

Bring your questions for an even livelier discussion. We look forward to seeing you then.

If this date is not good for you, this group meets on the first Thursday of every  month. We also offer a free consultation appointment in our office at a time that is convenient for you -- you can make that appointment whether you attend this group meeting or not.

You can also visit www.lawjaw.com for more info about our law firm.

Meeting is from 6:00pm to 7:30pm.  Please call the office at[masked] if you cannot arrive by 6:30pm.
results.how_to_find_us: Just west of Community Drive on Northern Blvd.  Parking in rear of building.
results.name: Join us for the next DIVORCE OVER 50 meeting

results.description:
Click here to watch the event live!

Columbia University, edX, George Washington University, McKinsey Academy, IBL Studios and Open Online Academy's representatives will talk about the state of Open edX and explain how this open-source technology is helping universities and businesses to implement MOOC-style courses, intended for blended, continuous education, professional development, alumni engagement, lead generation and for-credit programs. 


• Maurice Matiz, Director, Media & Instructional Design Studio, Columbia Center for Teaching & Learning, Columbia University

• Joel Barciauskas, Engineering Manager at edX


• Lorena A. Barba, Professor at George Washington University and Chair of Open edX Universities Symposium


• Paul Schiff Berman, Vice Provost for Online Education and Academic Innovation, George Washington University 


• Jennifer Gormley, Senior Director, Product and Marketing at McKinsey Academy

• Michael Amigot, Founder at IBL Studios (Open edX) 

• Ivan Shumkov, Founder at Open Online Academy (ooac.org)

This event will take place after the success of the Open edX Universities Symposium in DC, organized by the same team. 

This short, welcoming event –free of sales pitches– will include 10 minute brief talks, along with a round-table discussion and networking. Paul S Berman will moderate the panel.

This event will be live broadcasted and open to outside participation. All of the talks will be filmed and distributed  throughout the Open edX community.  

Our third Open edX meetup will be sponsored by McKinsey Academy, WeWork and IBL. 

Access is free, although seats are limited. Beer and pizza will be served.  


[Real time conversation on Slack's Open edX nymeetup channel] 


Post: Open edX's Platform Global Success
results.name: Open edX Series: What Makes This Open-Source Platform Unique?

results.description:
This page has images of the openings we will be attending, so if you do not see them and you are........


1) viewing this page on the Meetup app click the description tab to view the list of galley openings.  

2) using an Android mobile browser open your browser's settings menu and click ''Request Desktop Site". 

3) using  Apple IOS then click the desktop site button at the bottom of the page. 

For those new to the Hop you might be wondering how you will find the group. Well below is a lovely pictures of myself. Study my face carefully and commit it to memory. Now that I am burned into your hippocampus simply look for me hovering near the entrance to the first gallery.

I very rarely take myself this seriously :)

Just a little more business...


Every week I receive emails from new members asking if there is a fee to join or attend the Thursday Night Gallery Hop. So rather than answer each email individually I'll kill a whole flock of birds with one stone.  

THE HOP IS, ALWAYS HAS BEEN, AND WILL REMAIN COMPLETELY FREE 

That said if you would like to help offset my organizer fees or buy me a post-hop bourbon you are more than welcome to click the 'chip in' button on the left side of this page. But let me reiterate contributions while appreciated are NOT required. 

And now the openings...


Sam Friedman, Josh Sperling From the Cradle to the Grave


Joshua Liner Gallery - 540 West 28th Street, Ground floor

Larry Poons Choral Fantasy - Paintings from the 1970s to 1980s

Loretta Howard Gallery - [masked] W. 26th Street

Cianciolo, Donegan, Hardy, Musson, Pope.L, Salle, Warhol BODY SUPERFICIAL


Sgorbati Projects - [masked] West 26 Street, Fourth Floor  

NOAH BECKER PRESENTS...SOMETHING


Berry Campbell - 530 West 24th Street, Ground Floor

David Mann Sympathetic Strings

Margaret Thatcher Projects - 539 West 23rd Street, Ground Floor 

Li Hongbo Textbooks & Gao Rong The Simple Line

Klein Sun Gallery - 525 West 22nd Street

Janet Fish Glass & Plastic, The Early Years,[masked]


DC Moore Gallery - 535 West 22nd Street, 2nd Floor

Peter Dudek, Dawn Clements, KK Kozik, Joshua Johnson, Caroline Cox, Sydn Space, Light, and Disorder

Kathryn Markel Fine Arts - 529 W 20th Street, Suite 6W 

Concrete Cuba

David Zwirner - 525 & 533 West 19th Street

After the openings (around 8 pm) everyone who would like to continue with the group are welcome to join us at a nearby restaurant (location TBD) for refreshments and general merriment.  

Look forward to seeing everyone

Todd

Then Again......

https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=zlwQVZUTdJA

results.description:
Take A Whole Health Journey with Author and Filmmaker Michael Bedar

Overcoming type 2 diabetes and chronic metabolic syndrome and enjoying life more are possible for you, holistically, naturally, and compassionately to self and others. You can reach your health goals and fall in love with wellness…if you can stand the suspense!

Come:

• Learn how Sweet Healing: A Whole Health Journey, a page-turner of a thrilling mystery novel packed with 15 years of expertise and research in healing and nutrition, can teach you and inspire you to sustain yourself on the path like no other book!

• Find out why the author of Sweet Healing: A Whole Health Journey writes about the natural healing process in character fiction, where personal growth, plant-sourced unrefined food, and sacred lifestyle practices are parts of our shift from dis-ease to thriving!

• Discover the impact Sweet Healing: A Whole Health Journey can make for your healthy enjoyment of life, and for the people you gift Sweet Healing to this winter.

• Bring your questions!

People who have come to previous book readings on Sweet Healing with its author, Michael Bedar, MA, said they enjoyed experiencing the creativity storytelling style, while delving into important realities in health and life, as well as the positive uplifting energy.

6:00 “Tea Time” with the Author
6:45 Talk and Q&A
7:30: Book Signing

Contact:

Rockin' Raw Owner, Tere Fox

[masked]

We constantly learn & earn together and have fun together. Within our real estate investing community, we train people with no experience to people who have been working in the real estate field for many years. So it's not important what experience you have! Working with our community, you will learn in depth knowledge of how real estate investing strategies work and you will also develop yourself to be a successful real estate entrepreneur.

At this meeting we talk about the biggest money making opportunities (Wholesaling, Fix and Flips, Buy & Holds, Seller Financed Notes + Tax Liens/Deeds, Multi-Family/Commercial and Money Lending) for a Real Estate Investor in today’s market. You will get to learn about new investors that are investing in real estate and making $10,000-$100,000+ per real estate transaction, we will also talk about how you can make $1,000-$10,000 commissions helping our community grow and you will learn working strategies from professional and practicing Real Estate Investors on how to create wealth through real estate investing.. This way you can learn & earn, get educated so you can invest in real estate, enjoy your life and pass your wealth on to future generations. Because we will cover a LOT of things in a short amount of time such as saving money on taxes, investment opportunities and other ways to make money working with our team, only those who attend the orientation will get invited to private follow up meetings to cover more in depth advanced strategies and working with our community.

To attend, simply RSVP & answer the registration questions for location! If you would like to bring a friend or business partner with you to the meeting, please email us their name, email address and phone number so that we can make sure they are registered for the meeting.
results.name: Learn About Our Real Estate Investing Community, Training & Income Opportunity!

group.name: The NYC Real Estate Investors Success Meetup Group

results.description:
Graybar Toastmasters is open to all who wish to improve their public speaking and leadership skills. In addition, this is a great way to network with a dynamic and diverse group of professionals.

Founded in 1954, we are one of the oldest Toastmasters clubs in New York City. We are a friendly club with members dedicated to helping each other become better speakers.

We meet from 6:15pm to 8:15pm on the 1st and 3rd Thursdays of each month in the same location. 

Our meetings are structured to allow everybody to participate, practice and learn.

In our meetings the members of the club take different roles that allow them to practice and improve their public speaking and leadership skills by completing different projects.

The different roles, among others, include giving prepared presentations, chairing the meeting, improvising a short speech, telling a joke, giving feedback to speakers, evaluating the whole meeting, all in a very friendly and supportive environment.

People who RSVP this meetup attend as guests. They introduce themselves at the beginning of the meeting and give feedback at the end, and some of them may participate in an improv exercise. This is an opportunity for you to check out the club by coming to one or a couple of meetings, and deciding if you want to join as an active member. 

To learn more about Toastmasters International please visit http://www.toastmasters.org/

See you there!
results.how_to_find_us: 28 East 35th Street, between Park and Madison in New York City. To enter, please press buzzer #2 outside the red door for the Gallery/Lounge on the 1st Floor. PLEASE attend the meeting only if you RSVP since the space available is limited.
results.name: Graybar Toastmaster meeting!

group.name: Graybar Toastmasters - Become a skilled speaker!

results.description:
Club Dance Class

guys & girls are welcome!

Would you like to feel confident on the dance floor?

These classes will prepare you for dancing in public!

How it works:

I, unlike other teachers, don't spend entire class on teaching you choreography - you don't need it unless you want to be a professional dancer. My focus is on teaching you how to move comfortably in a club, at a party, wedding, etc. (Unless of course you request choreography).

I teach basics: finding and keeping rhythm, easy steps you can use anytime making sure you know how to transition smoothly between them.

During the first class I assess what it is we need to work on; whether it's musicality, rhythm, coordination, attenuation, groove etc. From that point on, I adjust the class to students' needs.

https://vimeo.com/82163219

https://vimeo.com/87729077

https://vimeo.com/78107028

https://vimeo.com/77569204

https://vimeo.com/89375819

Cost:

Regular single meetup is $20


New students: package of 6 classes is only $90, buy here: https://getdance.ticketleap.com/semi-private-dance-class/dates/Jan-07-2016_at_0630PM

Cancellation policy: if you need to cancel I need to know by 12pm a day before (Wednesday) - if I don't get your cancellation a day before class, I will have to charge you for the class you missed.

Please note that there is at least 4 guys/girls every meetup even though they don't RSVP'd here - join us!

Rewards Cards available - get your card and start earning free classes!

See you on the dance floor! :-)

Monika
