A Hypnotic & Vortex Healing® Journey

1st Thursday of each month (date may vary)

6:30 – 8:30 PM (ending time may vary)

CLICK HERE TO REGISTER


$35-regular price

$30-early bird (available until 1 week before event)

Please join us this evening to experience a fusion of 2 powerful  modalities -

•  Guided Meditation & Hypnosis

•  And VortexHealing®: Divine Energy Therapy

and how they can help you, and enjoy how wonderfully and synergistically they work together.

Do You Want to Learn More About Hypnosis, Energywork, Vortex Healing® or Spirituality?

Do You Have Something that is Troubling You, You Want Something Different from the Way Your Life is Going Right Now?

Are you stuck, uncertain, confused, frustrated or something else? You’re not sure if it’s emotional, energetic, mental or spiritual.

Come join Joel & Simon, and

• Let go of old thoughts, habits and beliefs

• Release blocked karma and energy

• Open gateways of mind and spirit

• Remove limitations

• Set new, more powerful intentions

• Heal old emotional issues

and begin to achieve your most heartfelt desires.

First timers, Experienced Journeyers, Come, Participate, Explore & Transform!

Give yourself this gift of healing and change


Experience Simon & Joel working together:

Joel will guide you into trance. Relaxing your mind and body, connecting you to your unconscious. Let his positive suggestions help you go deeper in trance, feel yourself become more receptive to Simon’s healing energies, divine consciousness and support healthy, ecological, appropriate change. As your trance deepens, imagine habits changing, limiting beliefs dissolving, new insights and subtle, rich, wonderful transformations occurring.

Simon will channel the VortexHealing® energies and divine essences. He will channel from the deepest levels of divine consciousness, releasing and awakening the deepest levels of emotional blocks and negative conditioning from your system. Imagine a vast set of divine frequencies and energies so powerful that there is no limit to where they can heal and transform. VortexHealing® creates powerful healing acceleration, releases karmic blocks, cleanses chakras, powerfully shifts your reality to higher divine expressions while connecting to your angels, guides and deities.

As Joel & Simon, continue to work together, envision Guided Meditation and Vortex Healing® complimenting each other. Notice the words take on more power, the energy flowing more strongly deeply. And find yourself opening more to your unconscious, Divine Consciousness and Spiritual awakening.

Imagine releasing the mental and energetic blocks that disconnect you from yourself and from the divine in times of stress and crisis.

Imagine feeling the energies inspire the words, and the words guide your energies.

Imagine opening your awareness to encompass the dance between these elements each time going deeper, and deeper, places you weren’t even aware of, helping you create more change, more release.
Imagine feeling  new hope, new ideas re-energized.

What to Expect: We create a safe and comfortable space, and take the time to answer any questions you might have. Typically, there are 2-3 rounds of guided meditation and Vortex Healing® combined. In each round, Simon and Joel work together. Joel guides the meditation with words, creating trance. And Simon channels the Vortex Healing® energies.

Each round, words, energies and trance will blend together, taking deeper into mind, body, energy and soul to create more profound effects. Who is this class for? This class is for anyone who is curious about experiencing hypnosis, energy work and wants to make change in their life. What’s required for this class? Just bring yourself, an openness to new experience and the possibility of change.

=================================

For more go here or try the links below to answer more questions:

Joel Elfman’s website and Hypnosis & NLP FAQs

Simon Deacon’s website and more info about Vortex Healing

We look forward to seeing you. Joel & Simon

Joel Elfman is Hypnotist, NLP trainer and bodyworker with over 15 years of experience. He helps transform old issues such as stress reduction, social anxiety/confidence and weight loss. Change and create new habits and beliefs for life.

For more about Joel visit his website, www.joelelfman.com

results.description:
KIZOMBA & SEMBA 


by David Campos and Guida Rei

Every THURSDAY :
Kizomba Level 1 - 6:30pm
kizomba Level 2 - 7:30pm 
Semba - 8:30pm

REGULAR CLASSES: 


- $20/CLASS
- $135 - MONTHLY UNLIMITED classes (Kizomba, Salsa, Bachata, Tango, Hustle, Afro cuban, Chacha, kids program, Hip Hop, Rueda de Casino, etc...)
- Discounted price for New Students : $90 for 2 Month Unlimited

CLASSES LOCATION : 
PEARL STUDIO
500 8th avenue (between 35th /36th street)
New York, NY, 10001

INFO & REGISTRATION:


PIEL CANELA
New York center for latin arts
http://www.pielcaneladancers.com/
212-924-6160 
[masked]
http://onlinestore.pielcaneladancers.com/

David Campos
[masked]
(646)[masked]
www.davidcampos.fr

http://youtu.be/G5Yi2Ar7z5k


<a>https://www.facebook.com/dcamposkizomba
https://www.facebook.com/DavidCamposKizomba
https://www.facebook.com/groups/dance2heartbeatnyc/</a>;

VIDEO LINK : http://www.youtube.com/user/sbsdancefusion/videos?shelf_id=1&view=0&sort=p

What is Kizomba – The Origin

Kizomba is a breath whose rhythm is a beating heart, and where the perfect connection between two dancers gives birth to harmony, exaltation of senses and sensuality" D. Campos

Kizomba (a word meaning "Party" in angola ) takes its origin from the Angolan dance Semba, which is also the origin of the Brazilian Samba.
It appeared at the end of 70’s – 80’s, while the young Angolans, although very attached to their traditional dance,sought a new musical identity, and finally found their inspiration and new voice at a concert given by Kassav, a famous French Caribbean Zouk band. Kizomba was born out of this new generation’s desire to bring a touch of sensuality and sweetness to their national Semba.
The influence of the Angolan Kizomba soon spread to all the African Lusophone countries such as Guinea Bisau, Cape Verde, Mozambique. From there the dance quickly found its ticket to Europe via Portugal, where it further developed, by all these Artists, teachers, choregraphers coming from these Luso-African countries.
As it rapidly gained popularity, Portugal exported Kizomba to various countries in Europe such as France, Spain, Poland, Belgium, Danemark and England. 
Today it is rare to find a Latin dance party without Kizomba represented, as well as salsa or bachata.
This "African Tango Zouk", also called "Tango Lusophone" continues to conquer a growing audience of passionate dancers, eager for beauty of gesture and sensuality, but also the indispensable complexity of exchange and trust present in each motions of Kizomba.
This young dance of barely thirty years is booming today, and constantly evolving.
"Kizomba is a tribute to sensuality, an ode to love and sharing. A moment when the woman's beauty, enhanced by her partner, must embody all its essence. " D. Campos
Be the pioneers here in the U.S. of a dance that will become soon a must for your dancing nightlife !!
results.name: KIZOMBA/SEMBA CLASS - Every THURSDAY, NEW YORK

results.description:
This is an opportunity to practice Japanese conversation, and discuss and study the grammar, particles, Kanji, and culture. The topic varies among all these, according to what people are interested in talking about and the natural flow of conversation.

Members of all levels are welcome, from absolute beginners on up, and there is never a prerequisite. Native speakers are also encouraged to attend, both to lend their expertise and to receive the benefit of a look at the structure of Japanese from an outside linguistic perspective.

Here's a photo of the area where we meet, for reference:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The meeting is free, with no membership dues, hourly costs, or other expenses.

 

==> Learning & Practice RESOURCES

Various materials http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/thread/3199165/0#[masked]

KANJI http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1175397
KATAKANA http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1198386
HIRAGANA http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1198387

Please click over DISCUSSIONS ->Message Board, then select your favorite topic. Have a lot of FUN learning about Nihon & Nihongo! http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/
results.how_to_find_us: Look for me, with the pile of Japanese dictionaries at one of the tables in the Atrium, or one of the other groups speaking in and about Japanese.

results.description:
When Harlemites set about each other with knives, it's an everyday kind of happening. But when a white man is shot dead in a Harlem street one steamy evening it means trouble, big trouble.
Plenty of people had motives for killing Galen, a big Greek with too much money and too great a liking for young black girls. But there are complications - like Sonny, high on hash, found standing over the body with a gun in his hand that fires only blanks, a street gang called the Moslems, a disappearing suspect, and the fact that Coffin Ed's own daughter is up to her pretty neck in the whole explosive situation...
results.name: The Real Cool Killers, by Chester Himes

results.description:
Unlike most Meetups, you don't sign up for these events--no RSVP required. This is a first come/first served, drop-in service offering one-on-one counseling for LGBT individuals and couples.

Two Identity House volunteer peer counselors staff the Walk-In Center for 2 hours, each Saturday and Sunday night. Each session with a client or couple is about 45 minutes.

What is a peer counselor? The word, "peer", means "equal". In this usage, a counselor and a client are on level ground. The counselor is not a therapist and does not provide professional therapy.

As peers, we have the opportunity to share as equals with our clients. This means that, unlike therapists, we can share our personal experiences, so that the client knows there are others who have been through a similar situation.

What does a peer counselor do? Using active listening skills, empathy, and the sharing of experiences, the counselors help clients clarify their thoughts and feelings; and explore various options or solutions.

What else can the counselors do? Sometimes clients just come in to talk and that's all they need, but if clients feel that they might benefit from referrals to other resources, the counselor will discuss with them: short-term peer counseling (8 weekly, 1-hour one-on-one visits), therapists, discussion groups, and other community resources.

Our outreach is supported by donations from Identity House members and our clients. We do ask for a reasonable donation at the conclusion of the counseling session, but no one is ever turned away because they are unable to donate.

For more information about Identity House or how you can support our work with a donation, please visit our website: www.identityhouse.org.
results.name: Now, An LGBT Walk-In Center on Thursdays Nights

results.description:
A prompt is a writing exercise with a specific theme and a time limit. These small exercises get writers to move away from their comfort zone and try a new genre, voice or character. Inspiration can be drawn from unlikely places and time limits lead to creativity.

JCW members provide the writing prompts on a rotating basis. These prompts can be anything the scheduled writer decides. The only rule is the group just has 10 minutes to write it!

After a long week what could be better than meeting with friends and potential new friends to fold your work week away! Come fold with us at AWOL!

Its a lot of fun and more intimate than our once a month big meetings. A great place to learn some new models and also get help on models you're been stuck on. Bring your latest folds and creations for show and tell and your favorite models to teach and learn.

This meeting is free and open to all level of folders from beginners to advanced. bring paper and your books and also there will always be free paper available to share so you can just show up and fold! 

Please try to RSVP so others will know you will be there.

Also I usually get there a bit earlier, so please look for paper folders, or at least the presence of paper. 

-Linda

NOTE: Please try to RSVP if possible so others will know you will be there. Thanks.

results.description:
The NYC Safe Energy Campaign is meeting this Thursday, Jan. 7th , at a new location, the Murphy Institute, 25 West 43rd St., classroom 18A.

6:30pm for pot luck and socializing, 7PM the meeting starts. This Thursday. 25 W. 43rd St., classroom 18A.

1. We'll be talking extensively on the Trans-Pacific Partnership and organizing against it. NYCSEC.org has a web page with many links for information and analyses.
2. We'll also be talking about various strategies different groups are taking for closing Indian Point and about the City Council resolution, which has been stalled on 18 co-sponsors for a long time.
3. We'll learn what solar installers are saying about policy impediments to growing the sol industry.
4. We'll plan for the building efficiency speak we'll have in two weeks, on Jan. 21st.

For more information on the NYC Safe Energy Campaign, go to www.nycsec.org

See you this Thursday,
Ken

When the air or water are clean, thank an environmentalist. If not, become one. 'Nuff Said!

"People are worried about corporate personhood. The Trans-Pacific Partnership is corporate Nationhood." - Arthur Stamoulis
results.name: Fight the TPP and make NYC 100% renewable energy

This is a FREE yoga class that meets from 6:30 to 8:00 pm, instructed by Chia-Ti Chiu, one of the organizers of this Meetup group.

It is an OPEN LEVEL HATHA FLOW class, appropriate for beginners to advanced students.  There are many variations given to accommodate the different levels of yoga experience.


** You will need to bring your own mat.  There are no yoga mats for rent or use. You can buy yoga mats inexpensively at Marshalls, Filene's Basement, Modells, TJ Maxx, and Target. Many yoga studios also carry a wide range of mats for sale.

IF YOU COME FOR THE FIRST TIME: PLEASE FILL OUT THE REGISTRATION FORM AT THE FRONT DESK. RSVPing on Meetup does not count as Beacon registration.  Your participation and registration helps keep the numbers needed for this program to stay free!


FOR EVERYONE: PLEASE SIGN IN AT THE FRONT DESK CLEARLY AND LEGIBLY

DIRECTIONS:The Beacon Center is located in PS 198. It is an elementary school that takes up the whole block; entrance is on 3rd Ave. The exact address is: 1700 Third Avenue, between 95 & 96 St.

BY SUBWAY: 6 train to 96 St. Walk 1 block East on 96 St to Third Ave. Make a right onto Third Ave.

BY BUS: Third Ave Bus - M101, 102, 103 to 96 St.

Madison Ave Bus - M1, M2,M3, or M4 To 96 St.


ANY QUESTIONS? Contact Chia-Ti through Meetup or through her website: www.onelovewellness.com

Investing.

results.description:
Welcome to 2016 – the year that everything could change for you.  

Multifamily real estate is set to experience another record setting year, and its time to get IN on the action instead of watch from the sidelines.

At this meeting, Christopher Urso will break down why now more than ever, multifamily real estate is the darling alternative investment. 2015 broke transactional records for deals, and 2016 is poised to do the same. Chris feels that there truly is a deal out there for each person’s unique criteria.

Chris, along with his partners at URS Capital Partners control over $70,000,000 worth of multifamily real estate across the US. Chris helps beginner and advanced investors own multifamily real estate. Whether you want to invest passively, or own your own deal Chris help his clients do it safely and most importantly: lucratively.

These meetings fill to capacity, so make sure that you REGISTER NOW.

At out kickoff meeting, we will discuss:

- An overview of where the multifamily market is today and the opportunities that exist

- Understanding your goals for investing and what resources you have at your disposal to achieve them

- Understanding how the process of investing works for both passive and more active investors

Click here to register for the January 7th meeting

Thanks and see you at the Hotel Viana in Westbury!

PS. This is the only meetup group solely focused on investing in multifamily real estate on LI, and we pride ourselves in providing quality information.

Don’t let this year pass you by, make 2016 the year that you take action in real estate.
results.name: Apartments for 2016: Keys to Getting Started

results.description:
I'm loving the momentum of this group and witnessing how folks are improving their language skills and making friends. To me, it makes all of this worth doing!

So let's get ready for another great meetup! 

As always, first introduce yourself in the language you are studying. Then introduce yourself in your native language. 

Following that, we will dedicate 30 minutes towards helping those learning English, then 30 minutes of Chinese. 

Then we mingle again until its time to go. 

We are usually done by 8:30 but those that want to stick around or continue hanging out after the meetup (bubble tea, karaoke, etc) are more than welcome to do so!

Thanks again for your support thus far and let's have many more great meetups! 非常感谢大家的支持！

This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Thursday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's.   We are 1 room over from the pool tables.  There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Five Tribes, Kingsburg, Istanbul, Catan, Pirate's Cove, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Stone Age, Suburbia, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Lords of Waterdeep, Splendor, The Cave, and more.  

Here is a list of the board games I own on the BGG website: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/MarkNY8?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Here is a list of Co-Host Kenny's games on BGG: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/kenk1982?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark

results.description:
Hi Everyone,

Treadwell Park just opened up on the Upper East Side in the 60s.  I stopped in for their grand opening and it has the potential to be a great beer hall in the area.  If you've never had a beer float, this is going to be one of the best places to try your first one.  Look forward to seeing everyone there.   

Ruvan

Yelp Reviews

http://www.yelp.com/biz/treadwell-park-new-york

Urban Daddy Review

http://www.urbandaddy.com/nyc/nightlife/36580/Treadwell_Park_On_the_UES_Here_s_Your_Beer_Spot_New_York_City_NYC_Bar

A UES beer hall that’s going to challenge your commitment to beer experimentation, opening tomorrow.

Look, it’s a beer hall. You know what they look like. Wood, brick, a bar, the occasional television. Here are the more distinctive highlights at this particular beer hall:

The Beer Conditions
Twenty obscure beers and ciders on tap that’ll rotate each and every week. You can get them in four-ounce, pint and 32-ounce sizes. Also expect some winter-friendly cask beers.

The Food Conditions
You’ve got your smoked-brisket sandwiches and your chipotle barbecue wings. A banh mi lobster roll and pulled-pork tacos. It’s all over the place.

The Game Conditions
Two ping-pong tables, a Dirty Harry pinball machine and a Metallica one.

The Cocktail Conditions
This is your opportunity to try a cocktail that employs both peanut butter and preserves titled “Peanut Buttah Jellae Time!!!” We apologize on their behalf for that.

The Beer Float Conditions
Let us explain. You know root beer floats? Well, these are like those, minus the root, and plus blue cheese ice cream or bacon-and-chocolate ice cream.

It could really go either way.

Read more: http://www.urbandaddy.com/nyc/nightlife/36580/Treadwell_Park_On_the_UES_Here_s_Your_Beer_Spot_New_York_City_NYC_Bar#ixzz3tZZiwFoo

results.description:
Like our Facebook Page!:

   facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.25 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.25 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy: 


* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

                                         2731 Broadway

                                     New York, NY 10025

                            Betwee[masked]th and Broadway  

By RSVP'ing you agree to our Liability waiver:

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 


I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.description:
If you're  looking to get out for the New Year and try something different, may I suggest coming out and playing Trivia Quiz.

We have had a very nice group of regulars that have been participating since October and are always looking for more people to join us.

It is free to play and there is no Meetup fee for this event. So give it a try. And if you're coming right from work Vintage does serve food...very Reasonable and Good




Vintage has been serving the White Plains community for many years.

It's comfortable, affordable & centrally located.


**There will be a prize for the winning team!**


And there will also be bonus questions where a team can win stuff!!

Bring your friends or you can join other Meetup members to form a team.

It's a great opportunity to use all that information you have acquired over the years.  *_*

There will be an entertaining mix of questions!

Let's get those brain cells working & have some FUN!!!

There are 5 rounds
Questions are read off and each team writes down the answers....it's a team effort!

****All are welcome to attend!****


And there are always people from the Pub itself playing, we will be joining in on the FUN!

I look forward to seeing you there! *_*
results.name: Trivia Quiz Night @ Vintage in White Plains

results.description:
New York Tarot Tarotology is a class devoted to a detailed study of the pictorial language of the Tarot. Have you ever wondered "What do the cards mean?" Or, "Why does every book you've looked at say the cards mean something else?" This class will answer both those questions and more. 

These on-going classes, will feature Tarot Symbolism, the Esoteric Titles and what those titles mean, Astrology and the Tarot, Qabalah and the Tarot, which includes a general study of the Tree of Life, and Alchemy and the Tarot. 

The first half of the class will be a short discussion on the individual card with any questions you might have, and then in the second half we will have some fun doing spreads and reading for one another. After all we are here to learn to become stronger readers, so please be sure to bring questions with you that you would like to have the Tarot answer, along with your Universal Waite deck*,  some paper and a pen to take notes.

All levels are welcome, even if this is your very first class.

Payment can be made in class. 

There will be a Meet-up sign on the table. I will arrive around 6:00 PM, or earlier, to get us a table. Panera Bread sometimes gets crowded but I have found that the noise level isn't usually that bad. Please try to arrive on time, if possible.

*You can get the Universal Waite pocket-size edition at Namaste Bookstore on 14th street or from Amazon.com.

If you cannot get a copy of the deck by then, don't worry, because I'm going to bring a few decks with me :)
results.how_to_find_us: Panera is near the corner of 33rd Street & 5th Ave. Closest subway is the F at 34th Street. Walk one block to 5th Ave. Turn right & walk down one block to 33rd. Street. We will be in the Cafe downstairs.
results.name: Welcome All Tarot Enthusiasts

results.description:
Maximize your potential with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your NEW YEAR with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call 

<a>[masked]</a>

.- numbers may not show- phone number in words:

-nine-zero-eight-three-zero-three-five-zero-three-one-


Looking forward to training with you!
results.how_to_find_us: Behind Kean University on the football stadium side.  501 green lane, Union, NJ

results.description:
Join DM Tom Gilbert in his first Wildpig RPG!

A pale body lays among the dark leaves, the blood long since cooled in the late autumn chill. Frost is forming on the ground, coating the corpse in silver. It shines in the dawn light, while the dark red blood freezes on her neck. In the nearby village of Lyalintsi, Magister Illian Antonov is about to discover his daughter is missing. Another young girl from his community is gone, and he must face his people with no more answers than before. The darkness of the forest is closing in on the village, and the night is full of horrors. 

The province of Magrevia is a land of dark shadows and deep forests. A century before, the Empire of Thyatis sent its troops, intent on adding the region to its dominion. Today, the Thyatians stay within their outposts, still unable to penetrate the wild lands that surround them. The Magrevian people continue to dwell in the communities that have sheltered them for generations, their doors and windows closed tight each night against the darkness. 

Maya Antonov is Dead is a campaign for D&D 5E. The focus is on the horror surrounding the players, and the challenge of surviving in a world set against them. Characters will begin at first level, and advancement will be challenging.

Races: Human, Elf, Dwarf, Halfling, Tiefling.
Classes: Barbarian, Bard, Cleric, Druid, Fighter, Paladin, Ranger, Rogue, Warlock, Wizard
results.name: D&D 5E: Maya Antonov is Dead - Character Creation

If you love great Thai Food and great conversations this is a great event for you!  Join us at Yum Yum Bangkok Restaurant near Times Square for one of our famous rotating group dinners.  You will enjoy 5 delicious courses and switch seats 3 times during the meal so that you get to sit, socialize and eat with all new people almost every course!

How it works: arrive at 7pm for registration and cocktails at the bar.  Once everyone arrives you will randomly be assigned a seat at the table.   After your appetizer is served you will pull a number out of a hat and switch seats so that you get to meet all new people!  Finally after your entree you will switch again for dessert.  Following the dinner the group will likey go to a nearby tavern for drinks.

What is included: Soup & salad, choice of appetizer, choice of entree, choice of dessert, tax, tip.

Not included: any beverages which can be paid for at the bar

Cost: $45  Please bring exact change DO NOT REGISTER FOR THIS EVENT UNLESS YOU PLAN TO ATTEND.

Can I come alone?  Yes 99% of those attending will come on their own.

What to wear: Most come from the office so business casual
results.name: Rotating Thai Food Group Dinner

results.description:
Evolution meets game theory in this follow-up to Wright’s The Moral Animal. Wright contends that history progresses in a predictable direction and points toward a certain end: a world of increasing human cooperation where greed and hatred have outlived their usefulness. “Non-zero-sumness”, which in game theory means a kind of win-win situation, he argues, is the future of human society.

“Insightful, witty, profound, Nonzero offers breathtaking implications for what we believe and how we adapt to technology’s ongoing transformation of the world.” – All formats.

Join us even if you haven’t finished reading. The SHSNY Book Club is open to all … and free!
results.name: SHSNY Book Club - Non-Zero: The Logic of Human Destiny, by Robert Wright

results.description:
Share, learn and network with fellow Product Managers at The Product Group.

Some topics to expect...
- Product Ideas (coming up with them)
- and more...

Featured Product: Memo

From Ryan Janssen at Memo:
"I'm the founder, CEO, and product person for Memo (http://getthememo.com), an anonymous messaging app for companies.  We've spent the summer building a suite of Enterprise tools to help companies harness the power of their Memo communities.  

This is, essentially, the third direction for this company in the past two years, so I'd like to discuss the only thing I seem to be really good at as a product manager--failure.  Let's talk about how to recognize when our genius ideas are anything but, and how to respond to impending doom!"

Note: Please make sure your meetup.com information is up-to-date (incl. First & Last names). You will need to show ID matching the name you used to RSVP. 


Hope to see you there!

results.description:
Kick off the New Year with clarity around what you want and what to do to achieve it. Access the power of your voice & inner knowing, experience bold confidence in the actions you need to take, and clear the blocks for nourishing and fulfilling relationships. This workshop asks you to think about your relationship with desire, your understanding of desire and ways to create a pathway to awakening your desire. 

Do you know what you want? Is your passion foggy and unclear? What blocks you from experiencing fulfillment of your deepest desires? 

When you have a relationship with desire it affects the power within.
You will be given distinct and creative tools that enable you to unveil the potent self. Including somatic intelligence meditations, psychodrama to unveil hidden archetypes, and exercises to voice your truth.
And that is just the beginning...
Limited to 25 participants. All are welcome.

Hosted by Life Coach: Leah Petrusich & Psychotherapist: Edy Nathan

Also, we have a discount of $10 off if you prepay ahead of time!

You can purchase at this eventbright link:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/awaken-your-desire-an-interactive-workshop-tickets-19680935207?discount=magic2016

Discount Code: magic2016 

Pricing: 

$20 online

$30 at door

__________________ Schedule

7:00 PM Doors open
7:00 — 7:15 PM Registration
7:15 — 9:15 PM Workshop (Please wear comfortable clothes)
9:15 — 9:30 PM Wrap up & questions

__________________


The Alchemical

We will be meeting in a beautiful white room with glass windows overlooking the city. Together we will create a sacred space to share our inner worlds with each other. The Alchemical is a true artistic laboratory with a history that dates back to 1981.

__________________


Directions

104 West 14th Street, Studio D (between Sixth & Seventh Ave) New York, NY 10011
The Alchemical is located on the cusp of Chelsea and the West Village in downtown Manhattan.

Accessible by all major subway lines: 1/2/3, F/M, L, A/C/E, N/R/Q, 4/5/6
F train to 14th St / L train to 6th Ave / PATH trains to 14th St will let you off right at door.
1/2/3 to 14th St arrive at 14th and 7th Ave; walk 1 block east.
A/C/E to 14th St arrive at 14th and 8th Ave; walk 2 blocks east.
N/R/Q, 4/5/6 to Union Square; walk 3 blocks west.

There are parking garages nearby and street parking can often be found. Parking is free on 14th only on Sunday. Otherwise you have to feed the meter every hour and the traffic cops are very strict.

__________________


FAQs Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?
All participants should be at least 18 years or older.

Is this event for couples?
Singles and couples are welcome. The workshop is open to all sexual orientations, and relationship styles. Can I arrive late?
No late arrivals. The workshop will start promptly at 7:15. What do I need to bring to the event?
Please have your photo ID to check you into the event and wear comfortable clothes. Beverages will be provided at the venue. Do I need my printed ticket?
No, we will check you into the event by your first and last name. What is the refund policy?
Please contact us if you are unable to attend. Tickets are refundable before 12/31/15. No refunds will be issued the week of the event.
results.name: Awaken Your Desire: An Interactive Workshop

results.description:
The Consulate General of India, New York and the Art of Living Foundation are partnering to bring ‘Meditation Happy Hour’ to the community every other Thursday. A unique opportunity for you to experience stillness in the city that is always ‘on’. Leveraging the ancient techniques of yoga, breath and meditation, the 60 minute session will allow you to go beyond daily mental stresses and help you recharge yourself and tap into greater happiness, purpose, creativity & intuition.

This 60-minute free meditation class is open for people with any or no experience of meditation, yoga or breathing

results.description:
TOPIC

Please join us for our annual walkthrough of the new calendar year, which is currently being restructured (thanks Uranus-Pluto squares!) for ALL levels of astrology to enjoy the some answers and plenty of questions about 2016, and a look back at 2015. Life stories don't happen in a vacuum after all!

While we walk through astrological 2016, each of us can make notes about those dates that stick out to us whether by intuition and/or logic. To achieve this, please bring your natal chart with your along with a 2016 astrological datebook to make notes in. (Our venue sells these by the way from two or more publishers!) Also, please bring your 2015 datebook/calendar as well with all the appointments, etc. noted in them. (Yes, you read that correctly - 2015.)

SPEAKER

Demetrius Bagley is an award-winning movie producer (Vegucated), and nationally recognized events producer. He’s godfathered projects like Vegan Street Fair, SoCal VegFest, Veggie Conquest, and many others. Since 2004, he’s led NYC Vegan EatUP, one of the world’s largest vegan Meetups. Recently, he wrote about being a 20+ year vegan in “Letters to a New Vegan”.

Demetrius is also an internationally published astrologer who wrote Vibe Magazine's celebrity horoscope column 2010–2011. He published and sold customized annual Personalized AstroDatebooks from 2007–2013. In 2012, he project coordinated the anthology book, “Astrology: The New Generation”. He is the marketing & design dude for the annual State of the Art (SOTA) astrology conference.


A suggested donation is $5 very much appreciated. Please know whatever you can afford is acceptable. Donations collected pay our rent, Meetup.com fees, beverages and snacks, and speaker! 

PS: If you show up a little early, the Quest Bookshop is an excellent source of many metaphysical books and items, and well worth a browse. They close at 7 pm. 


DIRECTIONS

The meetup takes place at the Theosophical Society, which is next door to Quest Bookshop. You may enter through the bookshop before 7 pm (when it closes) or to the left of the bookshop after 7 pm. A sign will be posted on the door you can enter. The following is a rough outline. The meetup will start at 7 pm SHARP.


MEETUP TIMING

7–7:20 - Short talk sharing some astrological fundamentals, especially for beginners 

7:20–7:40 - Brief intros from attendees, announcements 

7:40–8:40 - Main presentation 

8:40–9:15 - Socializing (while putting away chairs)
results.how_to_find_us: Come through the tall fenced in area to the rightmost door. Usually we have a sign taped up saying Astrology Meetup on it!
results.name: January 2016: Annual Overview + 2015 Review

results.description:
Comic time! This week: Fluttershy and Zecora, and Rainbow Dash and Trixie  .  So pack your books and come over to this week's meetup for Friends Forever #5 and #6(descriptions and download links below) 

http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/mlp/images/7/75/Friends_Forever_issue_5_cover_A.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20140219194438

Friends Forever #5

 While sweeping in her cottage, Fluttershy says hello to a squirrel and is shocked when the squirrel returns the greeting. When she asks the squirrel since when it could talk, the squirrel says it's always been able to talk and only now has Fluttershy started listening. Before Fluttershy can question the squirrel further, it runs off, stating it has a "busy day." Fluttershy chases the squirrel as it flees into a tree and tries to talk with it further. Rarity sees this and, thinking Fluttershy is sleep-deprived, tells her friends to get some rest.

Written by: Thom Zahler
Artwork by: Tony Fleecs 

Download link: https://www.comixology.com/My-Little-Pony-Friends-Forever-5/digital-comic/97829?ref=c2VhcmNoL2luZGV4L2Rlc2t0b3Avc2xpZGVyTGlzdC9pdGVtU2xpZGVy

http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/mlp/images/1/13/Friends_Forever_issue_6_cover_A.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20140319161335

Friends Forever #6

Rainbow Dash walks through Ponyville with a distinctive swagger, earning scornful gazes from some ponies. When her friends ask about her air of confidence, Rainbow explains that she has been summoned by the queen of Dimondia to give an aerobatic performance for the kingdom. The ponies have never heard of the place, but Rainbow only takes it as an indication of how far stories of her "awesomeness" have reached. She takes off for Dimondia and Pinkie Pie tells her to send a postcard.


Written by: Thom Zahler
Artwork by:  Agnes Garbowska


Download link: https://www.comixology.com/My-Little-Pony-Friends-Forever-6/digital-comic/103239?ref=c2VhcmNoL2luZGV4L2Rlc2t0b3Avc2xpZGVyTGlzdC9pdGVtU2xpZGVy

******************************************************

Due to colder weather we will be meeting at the Atrium rather than the usual place in Central Park.

601 Lexington Ave – Btw. 52nd & 53rd Street – Take the 6 train to 51st Street. The building itself is actually connected to the 53rd Street E/M/6 MTA subway station and is one of New York's largest skyscrapers.

results.description:
Kick off the New Year with clarity around what you want and what to do to achieve it. Access the power of your voice & inner knowing, experience bold confidence in the actions you need to take, and clear the blocks for nourishing and fulfilling relationships. This workshop asks you to think about your relationship with desire, your understanding of desire and ways to create a pathway to awakening your desire. 

Do you know what you want? Is your passion foggy and unclear? What blocks you from experiencing fulfillment of your deepest desires? When you have a relationship with desire it affects the power within.

You will be given distinct and creative tools that enable you to unveil the potent self. Including somatic intelligence meditations, psychodrama to unveil hidden archetypes, and exercises to voice your truth.
And that is just the beginning...
Limited to 25 participants. All are welcome.

Buy Tickets on Eventbright: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/awaken-your-desire-an-interactive-workshop-tickets-19680935207?discount=magic2016

Prepay for ticket and receive $10off, discount code: Magic2016 

Pricing: $20 online & $30 at door.

If you love great Thai Food and great conversations this is a great event for you!  Join us at Yum Yum Bangkok Restaurant near Times Square for one of our famous rotating group dinners.  You will enjoy 5 delicious courses and switch seats 3 times during the meal so that you get to sit, socialize and eat with all new people almost every course!

How it works: arrive at 7pm for registration and cocktails at the bar.  Once everyone arrives you will randomly be assigned a seat at the table.   After your appetizer is served you will pull a number out of a hat and switch seats so that you get to meet all new people!  Finally after your entree you will switch again for dessert.  Following the dinner the group will likey go to a nearby tavern for drinks.

What is included: Soup & salad, choice of appetizer, choice of entree, choice of dessert, tax, tip.

Not included: any beverages which can be paid for at the bar

Cost: $45  Please bring exact change DO NOT REGISTER FOR THIS EVENT UNLESS YOU PLAN TO ATTEND.

Can I come alone?  Yes 99% of those attending will come on their own.

What to wear: Most come from the office so business casual

results.name: New Players, New Games

results.description:
Flexible Systems
The Power of Generic Operations

Abstract

Most systems we build work well for the application that they were designed for, but they are brittle in that adapting to even small changes in the problem requires large changes in the code.  Can we optimize for flexibility, trading off other virtues like proofs of correctness or efficient execution?  I think this is often the right path.

Indeed, Postel's Law, "Be conservative in what you do, be liberal in what you accept from others," is strong advice for enhancing robustness in open systems.

In the spring term I teach an advanced programming class, where the goal is to learn how to avoid programming oneself into a corner.  One of the most powerful (and dangerous) techniques for enhancing flexibility is the use of extensible generic operations.

I will show where it is to our advantage to make systems with extensible generic operations, and how to control such systems.

Bio

Gerald Jay Sussman is the Panasonic Professor of Electrical Engineering at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). He received his S.B. and Ph.D. degrees in mathematics from MIT in 1968 and 1973 respectively. He has been involved in artificial intelligence research at MIT since 1964. His research has centered on understanding the problem-solving strategies used by scientists and engineers, with the goals of automating parts of the process and formalizing it to provide more effective methods of science and engineering education. Sussman has also worked in computer languages, in computer architecture and in VLSI design.

Sussman is a coauthor (with Hal Abelson and Julie Sussman) of the introductory computer science textbook Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs. It was used at MIT for several decades, and has been translated into several languages.

Sussman's contributions to artificial intelligence include problem solving by debugging almost-right plans, propagation of constraints applied to electrical circuit analysis and synthesis, dependency-based explanation and dependency-based backtracking, and various language structures for expressing problem-solving strategies. Sussman and his former student, Guy L. Steele Jr., invented the Scheme programming language in 1975.
results.name: Gerald Jay Sussman on Flexible Systems

results.description:
Join Adventure Cycling Association and Gotham Bicycle Tours for a special party in Manhattan, near Herald Square — celebrating the new year and Adventure Cycling’s 40th anniversary — on Thursday, January 7 from 7:00 to 9:00 p.m. Adventure Cycling staff and volunteers will be in town for the New York Times Travel Show (see the PS below for free ticket instructions). Join us for libations (including beer, wine and non-alcoholic drinks), snacks, prize giveaways, and a free raffle of an awesome new Raleigh Clubman Disc. There will be short presentations from both Adventure Cycling’s executive director Jim Sayer about 40th anniversary events and New York-based adventurer Charles Scott, author of multiple books, including the new Daunted Courage about a challenging cycle journey he recently took with his young children on the Lewis & Clark Bicycle Route.

When: Thursday, January 7 from 7:00 to 9:00 p.m. with presentations and prize giveaways to attendees at 8:00 p.m.
Where: Dancing Classrooms, 25 W. 31st Street, 4th Floor, NYC [masked]) — very transit accessible in the heart of Manhattan.

Please RSVP at [masked] or (406)[masked] by January 5.

We look forward to seeing you in the Big Apple to celebrate a big year of bike adventures!

Beth Petersen
Member Services Manager

results.description:
Kick off the New Year with clarity around what you want and what to do to achieve it. Access the power of your voice & inner knowing, experience bold confidence in the actions you need to take, and clear the blocks for nourishing and fulfilling relationships.
This workshop asks you to think about your relationship with desire, your understanding of desire and ways to create a pathway to awakening your desire. 

Do you know what you want? Is your passion foggy and unclear? What blocks you from experiencing fulfillment of your deepest desires? 

When you have a relationship with desire it affects the power within.
You will be given distinct and creative tools that enable you to unveil the potent self. Including somatic intelligence meditations, psychodrama to unveil hidden archetypes, and exercises to voice your truth.
And that is just the beginning...
Limited to 25 participants. All are welcome.

Also, we have a discount of $10 off if you prepay ahead of time!

You can purchase at this eventbright link:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/awaken-your-desire-an-interactive-workshop-tickets-19680935207?discount=magic2016

Discount Code: magic2016 

Pricing: 

$20 online

$30 at door

*When registering or checking in, please make sure to let us know you heard about the event from the Pleasure Without Borders Meetup*

__________________

Schedule

7:00 PM Doors open
7:00 — 7:15 PM Registration
7:15 — 9:15 PM Workshop (Please wear comfortable clothes)
9:15 — 9:30 PM Wrap up & questions

__________________


The Alchemical

We will be meeting in a beautiful white room with glass windows overlooking the city. Together we will create a sacred space to share our inner worlds with each other. The Alchemical is a true artistic laboratory with a history that dates back to 1981.

__________________


Directions

104 West 14th Street, Studio D (between Sixth & Seventh Ave) New York, NY 10011
The Alchemical is located on the cusp of Chelsea and the West Village in downtown Manhattan.

Accessible by all major subway lines: 1/2/3, F/M, L, A/C/E, N/R/Q, 4/5/6
F train to 14th St / L train to 6th Ave / PATH trains to 14th St will let you off right at door.
1/2/3 to 14th St arrive at 14th and 7th Ave; walk 1 block east.
A/C/E to 14th St arrive at 14th and 8th Ave; walk 2 blocks east.
N/R/Q, 4/5/6 to Union Square; walk 3 blocks west.

There are parking garages nearby and street parking can often be found. Parking is free on 14th only on Sunday. Otherwise you have to feed the meter every hour and the traffic cops are very strict.

All participants should be at least 18 years or older.

Is this event for couples?

No late arrivals. The workshop will start promptly at 7:15. What do I need to bring to the event?
Please have your photo ID to check you into the event and wear comfortable clothes. Beverages will be provided at the venue. Do I need my printed ticket?
No, we will check you into the event by your first and last name. What is the refund policy?
Please contact us if you are unable to attend. Tickets are refundable before 12/31/15. No refunds will be issued the week of the event.

If you love great Thai Food and great conversations this is a great event for you!  Join us at Yum Yum Bangkok Restaurant near Times Square for one of our famous rotating group dinners.  You will enjoy 5 delicious courses and switch seats 3 times during the meal so that you get to sit, socialize and eat with all new people almost every course!

How it works: arrive at 7pm for registration and cocktails at the bar.  Once everyone arrives you will randomly be assigned a seat at the table.   After your appetizer is served you will pull a number out of a hat and switch seats so that you get to meet all new people!  Finally after your entree you will switch again for dessert.  Following the dinner the group will likey go to a nearby tavern for drinks.

What is included: Soup & salad, choice of appetizer, choice of entree, choice of dessert, tax, tip.

Not included: any beverages which can be paid for at the bar

results.description:
PRETTY GIRLS - KARIN SLAUGHTER

#1 internationally bestselling author Karin Slaughter returns with a sophisticated and chilling psychological thriller of dangerous secrets, cold vengeance, and unexpected absolution, in which two estranged sisters must come together to find truth about two harrowing tragedies, twenty years apart, that devastate their lives.

Sisters. Strangers. Survivors.

More than twenty years ago, Claire and Lydia's teenaged sister Julia vanished without a trace. The two women have not spoken since, and now their lives could not be more different. Claire is the glamorous trophy wife of an Atlanta millionaire. Lydia, a single mother, dates an ex-con and struggles to make ends meet. But neither has recovered from the horror and heartbreak of their shared loss—a devastating wound that's cruelly ripped open when Claire's husband is killed.

The disappearance of a teenage girl and the murder of a middle-aged man, almost a quarter-century apart: what could connect them? Forming a wary truce, the surviving sisters look to the past to find the truth, unearthing the secrets that destroyed their family all those years ago . . . and uncovering the possibility of redemption, and revenge, where they least expect it.

Powerful, poignant, and utterly gripping, packed with indelible characters and unforgettable twists, Pretty Girls is a masterful thriller from one of the finest suspense writers working today.
results.name: January 2016 - PRETTY GIRLS

results.description:
*** 01/07 3D THURSDAY - 3DHubs Night ***


Get the most out of your 3D printer

Calling all makers! Join us on January 7th for a meetup at Fab Lab. We'll talk about our printers' successes and failures, and go over ways to make the most from your printer. Hubs from all over NYC are invited to participate, and are encouraged to bring in examples of failed prints.

Fat Cat Fab Lab, founded in 2013, is a maker space devoted to learning, sharing, designing, and collaborating with fellow makers. The facility provides community access to a growing set of traditional and digital fabrication tools, with an emphasis on low cost open source innovation.

Make sure to RSVP for this event at 3DHubs so that they arrive at Fat Cat Fab Lab prepare for you and your machines on Thursday night!

LINK: https://www.3dhubs.com/new-york/events/get-most-out-your-3d-printer


3D Thursdays!

So .... there has been a lot of fuss about this desktop 3D printing revolution thing for a while now. Still very exciting! 

We have a new-old idea that leaps beyond the news hype and celebrates the wonder of the activity itself. Let's get together every Thursday evening to explore this broad field, in all of its many facets and manifestations. And get to know each other better -- from bold pioneers, to new adopters, from teachers to students, manufacturing experts, to code and electronics hackers. This is your space to grow and share.

Topics we might explore on a typical Thursday evening include:

- 3D design software and techniques. From getting started, to pushing boundaries.

- Explore more of the 3D ecosystem, from making use of 3D printing service bureaus to starting and managing your 3D Hub.

- How to prototype and develop your own physical products, tools, and artwork.

- 3D printing materials: strategies for fabricating in more than just 1-2 plastics.

- Casting and mold-making: from precious metals to candy bars.

- Finishing techniques. Sanding, painting, sealing, melting, deforming, decorating, hydro-printing.... Why just make things that look like plastic?

Let's spend time together sorting out better ways to use these tools, and better ways to design.

results.description:
Evolution meets game theory in this follow-up to Wright’s The Moral Animal. Wright contends that history progresses in a predictable direction and points toward a certain end: a world of increasing human cooperation where greed and hatred have outlived their usefulness. “Non-zero-sumness”, which in game theory means a kind of win-win situation, he argues, is the future of human society.

“Insightful, witty, profound, Nonzero offers breathtaking implications for what we believe and how we adapt to technology’s ongoing transformation of the world.” – All formats.

Join us even if you haven’t finished reading. The SHSNY Book Club is open to all … and free!
results.name: SHSNY Book Club - Non-Zero: The Logic of Human Destiny, by Robert Wright

results.description:
Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! We'll be in the cafe. Look for our red Meetup sign. Please feel free to arrive late or leave early. It's great if you can RSVP in advance, but in case you can't, come anyway.

As a reminder, this group has two goals. The first is to explore the relationship between happiness and goodness. The second, much more fun, goal is for us to become much happier just by getting together and talking about happiness. The theory behind this second goal comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll often have set topics, like gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group, and those are our goals. It's also very, very important that we have fun. With that in mind, let's get ready to get good and happy!

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

Sometimes it's helpful to write in a group. So in this meeting we're coming together to just write. No critiques, no audiences (unless you want one), no pressure but that which you put on yourself. Here's how it works:


Part 1: 7:00- 7:45 we will write from a prompt provided by the organizer or one of the attending members.


Part 2: 7:50 - 9:50 is dedicated time for free writing. Work on whatever you want. We'd hope that work generated during these sessions will be submitted to any of the other Meetups or for broadcast on our podcast, Kaleidocast.


Please feel free to bring drinks or snacks. Arielle has power strips to plug in and space to write at both a table and on couches and chairs. Also, there are two cats, in case anyone has allergies.

The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for many years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

If you feel uncomfortable leaving your personal belongings at the track, you can drop them off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team.  They will store our belongings for us.  ***Please note that they will not let you in without your ID so please bring that with you to the track.   http://www.acebar.com/about.html

See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!

results.description:
I'm very excited about starting this group!  Although this is an inaugural event, there's plenty to discuss!


Our regular discussion format: a coverage of the three most compelling stories and issues unfolding locally (on a county or state level), around the nation, and around the world.


Here's the proposed evening agenda:

• 7 to 8pm: introductions and a discussion of the recent spike in violent crimes in Jersey City.

• 8 to 9:30pm: watch the President's "townhall" discussion on guns (live TV broadcast courtesy of the restaurant).

results.description:
People Who Get Ahead In Life Are Those Who Can Communicate Effectively.


Wouldn't You Like To Develop This Priceless Skill?  Now You Can!”

Come to  our First West Side Talkers  meeting of 2016 and Get on The Road to Becoming The Best Speaker in Your Neck of the Woods!

Develop your public speaking skills in a Fun, Warm, Friendly and Enthusiastic environment. 

Ralph Waldo Emerson once said, “All great speakers were bad speakers at first”. Emerson was right because great speakers are not born; they are made!

But in order to transform yourself into a great speaker you have to show up! Woody Allen said it best.  "80 percent of success is  just by showing up. " 

West Side Talkers is vibrant toastmasters club that's creative and thinks out-of-the-box. Over the years we have incorporated additional valuable segments that we offer at our club which have been added on top of the already great Toastmasters model. At our club, our members do speeches and we provide constructive evaluations, and we host table topics, thought of the day, word of the day, etc. (These are all part of the Toastmasters model)

At West Side Talkers you will experience everything that a toastmasters club can offer and more. We take all the great things that are in the Toastmasters program and we take it up a few notches (well maybe more than a few!) so that we can bring more value to our members and guests.

Below are the ADDITIONAL ITEMS that we have incorporated into our meeting agenda which add more value to our members speaking development. (not part of the Toastmasters model)

SPEAKING TIP

Where you will pick up a valuable Speaking Tip by a Certified World Class Speaking coach which you can immediately use in your very next speech.

IMPROV COMEDY

As a member of West Side Talkers we take you through "actual" improv exercises to help you develop your emotional expressiveness, characterizations, and your spontaneity in your speaking more quickly and efficiently. Improv can help you FAST TRACK your speaking development and do it WHILE HAVING FUN!

COMMERCIAL MINUTE

IF you were asked at a networking luncheon to get up and talk for 60 seconds about your business and what you do, would you be able to do it effectively? As a member of West Side Talkers we can help you learn how to deliver effective 60 second commercials.

Please contact us via email if you have any questions about our exciting program.

At our “West Side Talkers” Toastmasters public speaking meetings we encourage people to challenge themselves and get up and speak. However, we do not force anyone to do so. You can learn a lot by just attending our meetings. By just coming to our meeting you have made an initial step towards challenging your fears...!!!

So whether you just want to conquer your fear of public speaking or you want to become a Champion Speaker – “West Side Talkers” will help you get there!

If you have ever been to other Toastmasters public speaking clubs, at West Side Talkers, you will experience a Toastmasters club like no other. Come To Our Next West Side Talkers Meeting and Experience it For Yourself!

When:

Thursday January 7th,  2016  7:00pm - 9:00pm

Where:

The Jewish Center 131 West 86th Street, 10th floor (between Columbus and Amsterdam)  New York, NY 10024

Cost:

$6  (this helps cover our overhead)  Pay at Door or Pay online By CLICKING HERE 

Reservation is Required! 

Please RSVP to ([masked] or [masked])

results.description:
LOOKING FOR AN ALTERNATE PLACE TO MEET.  GOT ANY IDEAS? PLEASE SUGGEST!

Welcome and thanks for joining. This new Thursday meetup is here to support your poetic side. Rather than critique, we will discuss our poetic work; share feelings, and grow as poets or as writers who love being poetic. We will explore how you can be true to your poetic sensibilities and be understood, or not, as may be appropriately applicable and then emphatically, take it to a higher level. Discussion will be on our posted work. We will also look at what others are saying about poetic prose and poetry, as well as the writing of published poets. And help you along to achieve your goals. As with the Monday and Wednesday groups we will be setting goals and discussing the craft. Our agenda is as follows:

7:00 - 7:05 - Chat

7:05 - 7:20 - Intros, 7:20 - 7:50 - Set writing goals for upcoming week & share potential obstacles and how to overcome them.

7:50 - 8:30 - Discussion of submitted works: One or two writers chosen at preceding meeting will submit. After the discussion, we will determine who will submit for the following week.

8:30 - 9:00 - Craft discussion/poetic brainstorming

9:00 - 9:15 - Talk about group issues, concerns etc. Wind down.

How to post:

You must attend at least one poetic meetup before posting, in order to become familiar the format of the meetings. This is a discussion of your work, not a critique. Discussion is for everyone and should reveal how people receive your work as well as what you intended in writing it.

• Post only if you have been chosen to submit. Post by Sunday. (For critique/thought sharing outside of the meetup format, your work can be posted in "Pages" in menu above, where others can easily find your work.)

• Poetic Prose Length: General rule, 3,000 words max. Should be about 10 - 12 pages. Please advise us if you are interested in posting more so we can make arrangements and be prepared.

• Poem/Poems, a total of 6 pages (TBD). If you would like to read/recite your poem to the group, please inform us beforehand. It may be necessary to post fewer pieces.

• All work should be double-spaced, in 12 pt font, with 1 inch margins (unless aesthetics dictates otherwise)

• Number your pages

• The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

Post in Files under More tab with the following information under Description: Poetic Thursdays/including date; Title of piece; Brief description of concerns you might like addressed (also include in your document) and if you want to read/recite.


*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

See you there.

dan

results.name: EMPHATIC POETIC  Poetic-Prose and Poetry: Submit Work, Discuss, Set Goals.

results.description:
Hong Thaimee's East Village restaurant has done a fine job juxtaposing traditional Thai flavors with the Western accoutrements (seasonality, sustainability) of a trend-driven modern restaurant. Ngam serves some of the best pad Thai on the mainland, redolent of fish sauce and brimming with crunchy peanuts, but the former runway model and Spice Market chef also plays to the crowd with a curry paste-spiked burger with a side of kabocha squash and sweet potato Chiang Mai tempura fries. Though not as aggressive with the pepper some of the city's more traditional establishments, you'll receive a good dose of spice if you ask for it. There's fire during dessert as well in the form of a malty, rich Ovaltine brownie kissed with heat from bird's eye chilies.


We will share a variety of dishes and share Bill + T&T (you will be responsible for the cost of any drinks and individual dessert that you order.) • Serious RSVP only, please. Do not RSVP if you're not certain. • "NO-SHOW" or Last day RSVP change Will NOT be tolerated. • There will be a $2.00 meetup fee and will be added to your bill. • Cash Only. Please bring small bills. Makes everyone's life easier :) • Feel free to bring friends to join this event! If you are bringing non-members, please make sure they understand the rules stated above. • Please do not RSVP if you do not agree to all points above. I look forward meeting you all! Ken

On the heels of the Haskell Book Club, we're exploring different languages that are on the fringe of usefulness and popularity.

The wheel of languages has betrayed us and brought us a repeat language, so this month we'll be re-visiting Haskell.

Haskell is designed to be a pure, functional language. It has many applications towards writing programs that are provably correct or otherwise math heavy. Learn more at https://www.haskell.org/ or swing by to find out more.

[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.]

MakerBar is a 501(c)3 NJ Non-Profit Organization.. All donations are tax deductible.....consider donating today...Help keep the H@ck3ry alive!

results.description:
Very Important before attending. Please read this completely. Soon we hope to be officially a Study Group Associated with"Temple of the Presence" which is located in Tucson, Arizona.  We will be reading from Ascended Master written material for five Minutes or so and then practicing some simple Meditation Techniques of the Ascended Masters such as the I AM Decrees, Visualizations of the  Three Fold Heart flame and the Violet Consuming flame of forgiveness and more... There will also be Plenty of time for discussion and Questions and Answers. This Meditation Practice will be Guided with also some time for Silence practice. It will be for about 15-20 minutes. We will be having this Group every month. Practicing in a group is know to greatly enhance our Spiritual experience so please join us and see. We ask that everyone Practice Silence about their Personal Inner Spiritual Experiences at the meetup group and only speak in a very general and light way, like this worked for me or I felt Joy or love etc. without going into details and to Please Follow the Program Outlined by the Organizers. This will make for a more equality consciousness in the group with out people standing out as being more spiritually Conscious then others. It is not the purpose of this group to talk about our personal Spiritual experiences but to learn the teachings and techniques to have our own Spiritual experiences and Awakening, that is our focus.

Thanks and we Look forward to seeing you all then.

Peace & Blessings

Mindy & Anthony

This will be the official Korean beginner's class. The class material will be provided. We will go through all the basics and foundations, and practice with fun activities.

We will practice mostly the basic sentence structure using proper particles. Basic action verbs, verb conjugation, present tense, and pronunciation & speaking.

Since I need to book a space ahead, please consider your RSVP seriously and let me know if you can't make it after you said YES to come.

We may hang out and mingle after the class. I'm very excited to see you all and look forward to it!

Eli Block, 7-year Orgasmic Meditation practitioner and Teacher at OneTaste  is coming to New York this week to teach the Men's Course and give a talk for the community.

With a ton of love, patience, and entertaining personal stories of his own experiences, Eli helps men remember how to be in their full power — to escape paralyzing masculine conditioning, to break through their own walls, and to have the sex and relationships they want. This is an opportunity to get a taste of what's possible. Come listen, learn, ask questions, and open the first door to a whole new way of relating.

This is a CO-ED event and everyone over 18 is welcome!

Doors lock at 8:10 and this event is FREE.

results.description:
Want to: Meet your new ski/boarding buddy?  Learn about trips, lift ticket discounts, instruction, racing, hiking, and the amazing lodge in central Vermont?  Play free foosball, pool, shuffle board or darts?  Come to a meeting (maybe buy a drink at the bar at a good price) and introduce yourself to the person* closest to you and next thing you know you will be in the middle of 6 degrees of snow-mazing separation.  Thursdays from September to April, the snow networking location is at the Knights of Columbus (KofC) in Ramsey, 8 PM.

Park across the street in the train station parking lot. Many meetings have special speakers or activities, so keep an eye out for costume parties, equipment lectures, and amazing stuff.

FYI: Attendance varies (20-50 people usually) and represents only a small fraction of our 300+ membership base.  There will always be lots of dedicated skiers and boarders who are not on meetup.com who are in the official Ramapo Mountain Ski Club. Members vary in age (8-80 year olds come to meetings), ability, availability (schedule wise), and martial status (aka dating wise) - but everyone is looking for the perfect snow partner ;0)

Ramapo Mountain Ski Club Web Site

*For first timers: ask for Elyse, Ken of Hospitality, or Maggie, our President, to sign-in, help answer questions and connect you to others in the club with shared interests.

Ski yah Soon!

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (Your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests.)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Art K.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Art K.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)
