results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

results.description:
Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass

BRING INDOOR SHOES OR SNEAKERS

Permit Disclosure: We have a Permit!

(Leaders Chris & Ben) 

Street Soccer USA's unique court with walls and medium sized goals creates a very fast paced and exciting match!  4v4 with at least 3 teams rotating every 10 minutes and switch goalies every 5 minutes.


Rules:

Fun Play
No Sliding
Game restarts from goalie
Kick-ins.. no throw ins 
Corner kicks 

Directions:

By Car - Cross the RFK Bridge and take the I-278 exit towards Randalls Island. Turn right onto Central Rd until it turns into Hell Gate Circle. Turn Right crossing under the RFK Bridge onto Sunken Garden Loop.  Help SEC is across from Fields 90-91. 

By Bus - Take the M-35 bus which leaves from 125th St and Lexington Ave in front of the Duane Reade. It is the second to last stop on the bus route. 

By Train - Take the 4-5 train to 125th St. Transfer to the M-35 bus.

If you have any problems please call Ben on[masked]Two or Chris on[masked]Six.

PS2G promotes clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture.

The fee is  $5 via paypal, (includes insurance, permit, security guard) 100% of the proceeds go to Street Soccer USA. Learn more about our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Street Soccer USA is sports for social change. Using our entrepreneurial instinct as well as evidence based practices, we make a measurable difference in the lives of undeserved youth in urban areas and special needs populations, including homeless families, adults, people in recovery, among others.

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game. 


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? Go take jujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

• Minimum 6 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time). 


If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

ATTENTION ALL MEMBERS OF THE CHRISTIAN PARTY OF AMERICA.

All members of the national organization of the Christian Party of America are invited to attend the monthly “Members Only” Conference Call via Skype.  If you are already a member of the national organization, you can obtain the call-in information by emailing the National Chairman Clell Drumheller at [masked].  If you are not yet a member but would like to become a member, you can find out how to join and obtain the membership forms at http://christianpartyonline.com/wp/join-the-party/

So members Please join us at the Christian Party of America’s monthly Members Only Conference Call to discuss current political issues with like-minded Christians. The conference call is the first Thursday of each month at 8:30 PM est. (7:30 PM central). Clell Drumheller, National Chairman of the Christian Party of America and Texas State Chairman will lead the discussion on what can be done to address the concerns we all share for the status of our country’s civil government. Every quarter the National Executive Committee will hold its business meeting during the call and members are invited to observe the Executive Committee meeting on those occasions.

The Christian Party of America’s nationwide members only Conference Calls are a great opportunity to connect with other members of the Christian Party as we try to make a difference in this country. So sign on with us for the conference call to discuss issues and contribute your thoughts about what we can be doing politically. It is an easy-access way to share ideas and learn more about what is going on around the country with the Christian Party of America. Hope you can make it!

There is no extra charge to participate other than the usual charges by your phone plan for a long distance call.

results.description:
This workshop will help you make a lasting impression at Hustle Summit, the most epic networking event you’ll ever attend, on Friday, January 29th. Meet reps from Blue Apron, Hachette, HBO, Madison Square Garden, BuzzFeed, and more while networking and partying with the best young pros in NYC.

At a Glance
Free, live, virtual workshop focused on how to use Twitter and LinkedIn to network online, showcase your work, get noticed by employers, and make an impression at events (even if you aren’t there in person), plus a live Q&A with our Founder & CEO, Emily Miethner.

Why Attend?
Did you know social media platforms like Twitter and LinkedIn can help you network and even land a job? We’ve recruited several interns through these platforms, and we’ll show you how to use them to get noticed. You’ll learn how to:
- Use social media to network at events
- Optimize your Twitter bio
- Write a LinkedIn headline that will catch a recruiter’s attention
- Participate in Twitter chats
- Use Lists to sort who you follow
- Publish on LinkedIn
- Use #hashtags the right way
- Get the attention of people you admire via social media
- Make the most of your profiles using different management tools
- Practice common social media etiquette

This 45 minute workshop will be held by none other than our fabulous and fearless leader, Emily Miethner. She promises that by the end of this workshop you will feel equipped with all the tools you need to quickly and actionably bring your career development to the next level!

Workshop will be about 45 minutes for presentation, with a 15 minute Q&A.

Testimonials
“FindSpark events just keep getting better and better. I recommend FindSpark to all my friends who are job searching, transitioning to a different career track, or simply looking for ways to meet intelligent young people. Even if you’re not looking, FindSpark events are a great way to keep those networking skills sharp!”

“FindSpark brings together top talent with career professionals who ACTUALLY care about assisting young professionals in the workplace. After working with FindSpark, individuals feel motivated and ready to take on the scary world of the job market.”

“Looking for an internship in New York while being in Florida could be seen as a daunting task with so much distance, but FindSpark has made it so easy. Connecting with companies and other interns alike has been made easily accessible to people, even when not in the same state, through their virtual workshops as well as Twitter chats.”
results.name: Hustler Bootcamp: A Twitter & LinkedIn Workshop

Aside from our League play we offer Open Play 6 days a week. 1 hour and 45 minute sessions only $11 midweek.

Format: 3 teams of 5 per court. Score by 1’s. Games to 7. Winner stays but must sit after 2 games. No refs. Call your own. Our moderator will help things along. All players must bring a white and a dark shirt (not grey). This is a friendly run. Anyone with the wrong attitude will not be allowed back. Age: 21+

Our open runs are designed for good fun and a run. The A / B breakdown is purely a self rating device to try and split things up in an enjoyable manner. Think of it as if you were going to the park to play. If you are average or above go to the A court. If you are average or below go to B.  It is not exact. There is always going to be some crossover.  

***Please note- RSVP'g on Meetup will not reserve your spot. Please go to our website to sign up.*** A credit card payment is required to reserve your space. Just click the session that interests you.


http://nyurban.com/open-play-basketball/

We will send you a confirmation email. Show up at the Gym with I.D. We will have you on our list but please bring your receipt. No payment at the door.

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include... 

30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.
results.name: Hill Running Workout

results.description:
Ramapo Mountain Ski Club presents

INSTRUCTION WEEKEND 2016

January 8-10, 2016 at Jiminy Peak, Hancock, MA

Instruction Weekend is RMSC's largest annual weekend trip. Because of our lodge it is our only trip! Members who are instructors at various mountains, many PSIA, volunteer to teach group lessons a couple hours each day. While lessons are options, those who take lessons rave about them. No matter what stage you are at, everyone can benefit from a lesson! Even instructors, racers and many experts continue to improve their skills with instruction.

Instruction Weekend is also just a great weekend to meet RMSC members & friends!

·  Only 2.5 hours from Mahwah NJ

·  2 nights at the beautiful Williams Inn with top notch service, a short 15/20 minute drive away

·  2 buffet breakfasts & 1 buffet dinner prepared by premier chiefs

·  Local museums and shopping with-in walking distance perfect for non-skiers

·  Downhill skiing or boarding on 39 trails and parks, including blue/green and blue/black trails

·  Two half-day lessons (Downhill Skiing or Boarding) with our club instructors

·  Top Notch Instruction from Ramapo Members

COST:

ADULT: Double occupancy $275pp*; NON-SKIERS: Deduct $98* per person
CHILDREN: 10 and under Deduct $25 *
NON-MEMBERS: add $20 and please pay by money order or have a club member pay on behalf

Payment due December 10, 2015 - or until space runs out.

Space is limited! Sign up today 


*Please contact me for payment details.  Fees will be added if using PayPal

results.description:
As the new year begins, it is an ideal time to take stock of your successes, regroup, strategize and position yourself to achieve your 2016 business goals.  Our WEN group is filled with talent, resources and a wealth of information.  So, to start the year off our January meeting, we will tap into this treasure trove with a roundtable exchange where all members can learn from each other. Whether you are looking for insight, solutions or inspiration for 2016, this roundtable should kick start your year. The format this month is not a presentation, but rather an exchange, so please bring your own experience to the table (successes and challenges), feel free to pose a question or business challenge or network for talent – whatever is on your list for 2016. 

We will start the roundtable promptly at 9:30 am but feel free to come at 9:00 am for some coffee and networking.

In the meantime, everyone have a happy and safe holiday season – we will see you in 2016!

results.description:
Other than strict RSVP rules (if you say you're coming and you don't show, you're out of the group), this is a chill game, open to anyone who <a>signs up</a>.

Here's what separates this group from many others:

• Chill, positive attitudes. (People without forgiving personalities don't last long in this group, let alone in a given game.)

• Good quality equipment: $145 match balls; solid small goals - not pop-ups!

• Freshly laundered, adult-size, pillowy soft pinnies.

• We won't ever over-crowd a game. The size of pitch we use is best suited for 7v7. We're happy to make the pitch smaller if numbers are low. But we won't make it bigger or allow more than 7 players per team. 


• The small fee we ask of each player (at least $3 per session) supports a non-profit that we created and run: a high school soccer league for under-funded schools that don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming. 

See nyisl.com or the below video for more info. about our <a>program</a> for under-served public school students.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc. 

If you have any of these, please bring them to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee!
results.name: Sign-Up Soccer for Social Change

results.description:
Hello Fam!

We hope you had a restful holiday season! We're kicking off the new year right with Eric Green of DaoCloud.


Eric, co-founder of DaoCloud, the social wellness network, is an entrepreneur and wellness enthusiast on a mission to reverse the rate of chronic health conditions. He co-founded DaoCloud after learning to reverse Crohn's disease, while in a living-learning incubator at the University of Maryland. He's also an advisor for Javazen, a superfood coffee company that combines organic teas, coffee, and superfoods.


Eric is actively involved in the wellness and technology communities around NYC and Washington DC (having lived outside DC for the past 5 years, and relocating to NYC over the summer).


We'll get a chance to hear about his journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Also join us for good coffee, good bagels, and excellent conversation.

Until then, stay warm and classy... See you this Friday!

Future events:

1/09 - Urbacraft Craft-a-thon
1/14 - Pitch Deck Teardown
1/15 - Taku Harada (Peatix)
1/22 - Joshua Siegel (Rubicon VC)

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
